italy tel: (+39) 051 20 93186       (+39) 051 20 93069 (lab) fax: (+39) 051 20 93073 skype: gianluca_1977 mailto:gianluca.palli at unibo.it   https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www-2dlar.deis.unibo.it_people_gpalli_&d=dwicba&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=a8maywxenxngdy5xjopftlzakqg5ee6ydihtr3ki_re&s=nrqnobzf1p6or7gfqp5tso-qongf3d-p8qnh55pjrbw&e=   computers are like air conditioners; they stop working properly when you open windows...

subject: four post-doc positions in medical  robotics @ iit, italy
content: * post-doc 1: mechatronics for robot-assisted laser microsurgery * post-doc 2: mechatronics for robot-assisted laser microsurgery * post-doc 3: sensing and automation in robotic surgery * post-doc 4: real-time medical image analysis the advanced robotics research line of istituto italiano di tecnologia is seeking four highly motivated, full-time post-docs in the area of medical robotics. the positions are linked to the robotic microsurgery translational project of advr??s biomedical robotics laboratory (brl). this project aims to refine, enhance and validate promising medical device prototypes developed by brl??s research team. the final objective is to develop advanced device prototypes to enable clinical trials with the new technologies. this will allow their introduction into medical practice, leading to significantly enhanced health outcomes. details on the positions are provided below. the successful candidates will be offered a fixed-term contract (24 months) with a highly competitive salary commensurable with qualifications and experience. workplace: genoa, italy to apply, please send electronically a detailed cv to leonardo.mattos at iit.it by december 1, 2017 stating the position title in the subject of the e-mail.  --------------------------------------------- 1. post-doc in mechatronics for robot-assisted laser microsurgery --------------------------------------------- we are looking to appoint a skilled and enthusiastic mechatronics engineer with experience on the design, development and assessment of precision surgical robotic systems for microsurgery applications. the candidate should possess a phd degree in mechatronics, robotics or related field and an excellent publication record related to robotic science and engineering (ideally in the area of surgical robotics). the selected candidate will join an interdisciplinary team and contribute both to the improvement of existing prototypes and the creation of novel systems, being able to pursue his/her own creative ideas towards robotic systems for high-precision, high-quality laser microsurgeries. this is a major area of research at brl, one which includes close collaboration with top surgeons and surgical device companies. currently the group is developing robotic technologies for free-beam and for endoscopic laser surgery. both applications offer a vast number of research topics that can be explored, including in mechatronics, surgical automation, micro-robotics, moems and surgeon-robot interfaces. experience in one or more of the following areas will be considered a plus: robotics, laser surgery, robotic microsurgery, endoscopic systems, medical devices, clinical trials. --------------------------------------------- 2. post-doc in mechatronics for needle-based diagnosis and robot-assisted therapy --------------------------------------------- we are looking to appoint a skilled and enthusiastic mechatronics engineer with experience on the design, development and assessment of systems for disease diagnosis and/or therapy. the candidate should possess a phd degree in mechatronics, robotics or related field and an excellent publication record related to robotic science and engineering (ideally in the area of needle-based robotic procedures). the selected candidate will contribute both to the improvement of existing prototypes towards clinical trials and to creation of novel systems, being able to pursue his/her own creative ideas. experience in one or more of the following areas will be considered a plus: robotics, needle-based medical devices, real-time tumor detection, intravenous catheterization, clinical trials. --------------------------------------------- 3. post-doc in sensing and automation in robotic surgery --------------------------------------------- we are looking to appoint a skilled and enthusiastic engineer with experience on the design, development and assessment of sensing and automation systems for biomedical applications. the candidate should possess a phd degree in medical robotics or related field and an excellent publication record. the selected candidate will join an interdisciplinary team and contribute to the development of novel sensing technologies and autonomous behaviors in the area of robotic laser surgery. a number of research topics that can be explored in this area, including in real-time tumor detection, surgical planning, surgical automation, micro-robotics and laser-tissue interaction. experience in one or more of the following areas will be considered a plus: robotics, laser systems, tumor detection, planning and automation in robotic surgery, medical devices, clinical trials. --------------------------------------------- 4. post-doc in real-time medical image analysis --------------------------------------------- we are looking to appoint a skilled and enthusiastic computer scientist or engineer with experience on the design, development and evaluation of computer vision algorithms for pattern analysis and recognition. the candidate should possess a phd degree in computer science, robotics or related field and an excellent publication record. the selected candidate will contribute to the development of novel vision algorithms for pattern recognition, tracking and registration in real-time endoscopic images, primarily in the context of otolaryngology. research topics that can be explored in this area include, for example, real-time tumor detection, surgical planning, surgical automation, shared-control, and augmented reality. experience in one or more of the following areas will be considered a plus: medical image processing, pattern analysis and recognition, tracking, registration, real-time applications, fpga, clinical trials. ______________________________________________  dr. leonardo mattos head of biomedical robotics lab department of advanced robotics istituto italiano di tecnologia via morego, 30 - 16163 genova, italy phone:  +39.010.71781.409 fax: +39.010.71781.232 www.iit.it https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__old.iit.it_en_advr-2dlabs_biomedical-2drobotics-2dlab-2dnew.html&d=dwif-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=okrbtpv8utnnyxcbcbmtfametw57hg3mvfl7brqgrxm&s=lf0m-jwrkr7s-oawqs6nywjo5dmykqcclq163woyjv0&e= istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit), with its headquarters in genova, italy, is a non-profit institution with the primary goal of creating and disseminating scientific knowledge and strengthening italy??s technological competitiveness. the institute offers state-of-the-art equipment and a top-level interdisciplinary research environment focused on robotics and computer vision, neuroscience, drug discovery, nanoscience and technology. in order to comply with italian law (art. 23 of privacy law of the italian legislative decree n. 196/03), the candidate is kindly asked to give his/her consent to allow iit to process his/her personal data. we inform you that the information you provide will be solely used for the purpose of assessing your professional profile to meet the requirements of istituto italiano di tecnologia. your data will be processed by istituto italiano di tecnologia, with its headquarters in genoa, via morego 30, acting as the data holder, using computer and paper-based means, observing the rules on the protection of personal data, including those relating to the security of data. please also note that, pursuant to art. 7 of legislative decree 196/2003, you may exercise your rights at any time as a party concerned by contacting the data manager. istituto italiano di tecnologia is an equal opportunity employer that actively seeks diversity in the workforce.

subject: call for postdoctoral position in  machine learning for biomedical image analysis - 74477
content: call for postdoctoral position in machine learning for biomedical image analysis - 74477 postdoctoral position in machine learning for biomedical image analysis bc 74477 workplace: genova, italy expires on november 15th, 2017 the pattern analysis and computer vision (pavis, https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__pavis.iit.it_&d=dwif-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=i5o5bjdstvkca4sffbidpelmjnolj7pd6spxfuwct08&s=dgsllv_y6sb3jdlpwmjmkoelyuout5zwx3jqmygc5pq&e=) department and the visual geometry and modelling (vgm, https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__vgm.iit.it_&d=dwif-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=i5o5bjdstvkca4sffbidpelmjnolj7pd6spxfuwct08&s=ngemc6xvjqupnxbmpf5ldk6kjcsgegflw6bndlj4zik&e=) research line at istituto italiano di tecnologia are looking for a highly motivated full-time post-doc (1 year duration) to work on a biomedical imaging project related to blood smears image analysis. the candidate will consolidate pavis/vgm expertise in the research area of image analysis for cells detection, segmentation and classification. the research theme is related to the development of a highly efficient medical application in collaboration with an industrial partner. the focus will be on the creation of a software tool inspecting stained blood films for the detection and classification of blood white cells based on their morphological characterization. this implies the development of ad-hoc algorithms for detection and classification of cells based on machine learning methods and in particular exploiting deep learning state-of-the-art models. the inspection problem will also require the investigation of standard classification approaches based on visual-feature, exploiting therefore feature extraction and selection methods. the ideal candidates for this position has a ph.d. in machine learning, computer vision or related areas, and research experience and qualification should be within the following subjects: image analysis, cells detection and segmentation, machine learning, deep learning,  feature extraction. strong programming skill are highly required, preferably with good knowledge of matlab, python and c/c++ languages. evidence of high quality research on the above specified areas in the form of published papers in top conferences/journals and/or patents will be duly considered. salary will be commensurate to qualification and experience and in line with international standard. further details and informal enquires can be made by email to pavis at iit.it quoting bio-pd 74477 as reference number in the subject. please send your application, including a curriculum vitae (possibly with a pdf of your most representative publications) a research statement also describing your previous research experience and outlining its relevance to the call topics and the names of 2 referees,  to pavis at iit.it, quoting ??bio-pd 74477?? as reference number. this call will remain open and applications will be reviewed until the position is filled, but for full consideration please apply by november 15, 2017. please note that this position is contingent on budget approval. istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit), with its headquarters in genova, italy, is a non-profit institution with the primary goal of creating and disseminating scientific knowledge and strengthening italy??s technological competitiveness. the institute offers state-of-the-art equipment and a top-level interdisciplinary research environment focused on robotics and computer vision, neuroscience, drug discovery, nanoscience and technology. in order to comply with the italian law (art. 23 of privacy law of the italian legislative decree n. 196/03), we have to kindly ask the candidate to give his/her consent to allow iit to process his/her personal data. we inform you that the information you provide will be used solely for the purpose of assessing your professional profile to meet the requirements of istituto italiano di tecnologia. your data will be processed by istituto italiano di tecnologia, with headquarters in genoa, via morego 30, acting as the data holder, using computer and paper based means, observing the rules on protection of personal data, including those relating to the security of data. please also note that, pursuant to art.7 of legislative decree 196/2003, you may exercise your rights at any time as a party concerned by contacting the data manager. istituto italiano di tecnologia is an equal opportunity employer that actively seeks diversity in the workforce.

subject: postdoc in legged robot locomotion at  iit, italy (deadline 30/nov)
content: ****************************************** postdoc in legged robot locomotion at iit, genova ****************************************** the advanced robotics research line and the dynamic legged systems lab  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__dls.iit.it_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kmpvozvkm4jikg4jxesxzarrkwexsio6xv6wyijhuee&s=7h5d9ccvzkv6lph_hysp8envxygcnqnhmnfds4ic05e&e=> of istituto italiano di tecnologia, an  english-language research institute, is seeking a highly motivated,  full-time post-doc, who will have a leading research role in the  development of locomotion strategies for a quadrupedal field robot. info  about the quadruped robot: www.iit.it/hyq the selected candidate will join an interdisciplinary team and have the  opportunity to pursue research within the project ?sistemi cibernetici  collaborativi ? teleoperation? in collaboration with inail (?istituto  nazionale per l'assicurazione contro gli infortuni sul lavoro? -  national institute for insurance against workplace injuries) cup  j32f17000950005. the project will create the next-generation, collaborative master-slave  teleoperation system for intuitive operation in hazard-prone industries,  with the aim of reducing risks to workers? health and safety.  specifically, the objectives of the project are the development and  system integration of: (1) a hydraulic quadruped field robot; (2) a  novel dexterous robotic manipulator arm for grasping and manipulation of  objects; (3) a novel master hand exoskeleton device for haptic  tele-manipulation; and (4) a novel user interaction interfaces for  intuitive teleoperation using augmented reality and virtual reality  systems. the project will be developed within an inter-disciplinary  group (robotics, engineering, and ergonomics), in close collaboration  with end-users. further details about the position and the application procedure can be  found at the below link. the deadline for applications is november 30, 2017. https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__dls.iit.it_open-2dpositions_openings_565-3apostdoctoral-2dposition-2din-2dquadrupedal-2dlocomotion-2dof-2dfield-2drobot-2dfor-2dadvanced-2dteleoperation&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kmpvozvkm4jikg4jxesxzarrkwexsio6xv6wyijhuee&s=fmalk69lyi5a2antgkxluisxcfgks2qxpu-mxwwmlim&e= best regards, claudio semini --  claudio semini, phd head of dynamic legged systems lab istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) advanced robotics department via morego 30, 16163 genoa, italy phone: +39 010 71781 912 email: claudio.semini at iit.it web: www.semini.ch or www.iit.it/people/claudio-semini

subject: two post docs positions at icaros  center/prisma lab
content: dear roboticists around the world: the prisma lab group (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__prisma.dieti.unina.it_&d=dwic-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=gsgpyz3peiyjpxbuhdhmiyelcpt6ekufxu2fhpdypci&s=iwo7dskquoc01yxdqapxteqzrzeqjlglqtz_j4_yyke&e=) and the icaros  center (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.icaros.unina.it_&d=dwic-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=gsgpyz3peiyjpxbuhdhmiyelcpt6ekufxu2fhpdypci&s=enmwurokgvcx7yuhcpdetk3ikq8lpsalyij46u18uts&e=) both headed by prof. bruno  siciliano at university of naples federico ii in italy, are seeking to  recruit two senior postdoctoral research fellows that will have a key  research role in the following area: robotic manipulation focused on  prehensile manipulation of rigid and non-rigid objects and on  anthropomorphic hand and surgical tools mechanical design.  the  successful candidates will conduct their research within the musha  project (www.musha.unina.it). ** description of the first position the candidate will develop learning and control algorithms for  rigid/deformable objects grasping and manipulation with anthropomorphic  hands using visual feedback. one challenge is to recognize rigid  objects, another challenge is to track and model deformable objects. ** description of the second position the candidate will develop mechanical design of anthropomorphic tools  with tendon-based motion transmission system. **  we are looking for highly-motivated young scientists with a  background and phd in automatic control and/or robotics or mechanical  design, preferably with at least two years of experience abroad, and a  well-established publication record. desired qualifications include one  of the following: -competencies in computer vision and machine learning; - sound background and working experience in robotic  manipulation/control system design; - competencies in numerical modeling and simulation of rigid and  deformable systems -competencies in mechanical design of anthropomorphic tools furthermore all the candidates should have those desired qualifications - experience programming (c/c++, ros) and matlab - excellent publication record - creativity and proactive attitude - fluency in both spoken and written english - strong team player ** project idea musha aims at creating future generations of bio-inspired tools for  surgery and advanced bio-aware manipulation paradigms toward  breakthrough mini-invasive surgical instruments for organs manipulation  and android robotic hands. bio-inspired mechanical design will address  the reduction of tools weight and dimension by limiting the number of  actuators while preserving dexterity and manipulation capabilities.  fiber optic sensor will be suitably integrated to measure the contact  forces exchanged with the environment. the project aims at designing an  underactuated and sensorized three-fingered hand to be used as a  surgical tool for manipulation.  but the learning and control strategies  that musha is willing to develop are of interest also for  anthropomorphic hands. besides innovative control design, musha  will  develop an integrated framework merging vision and touch information in  reasoning to carry out complex manipulation tasks.  the innovation will  be linked not only to the mechanical design and integrated sensor  systems but also to novel planning and control algorithms generating  intelligent and effective actions. musha will integrate contributions  from: surgeons, on surgical tool requirements definition and on testing  in mechanical simulators and surgical settings; electronic engineers, on  the development, design and integration of fiber optic sensors; robotic  engineers, on mechanical design, on vison-force control development from  the observation of human sensory-motor coordination and on testing  robotic manipulation. the synergy of the different competences is the  key point to accomplish musha objectives. **about prisma lab university of naples federico ii is the third oldest university in italy  and the oldest public university in europe. the school of engineering,  with a population of 10,000 students, is the oldest in italy and  recently celebrated its second centennial since the foundation by king  gioacchino murat in 1811. the prisma team operates in the department of  electrical engineering and information technology, where since almost 30  years is conducting research in robotics. current interests include  force control, visual servoing, dual-arm/hand manipulation, human-robot  interaction, service robotics, and aerial robotics. the team has gained  world-wide recognition and is currently engaged in six projects  supported by the european community. see www.prisma.unina.it for further  information. ** about icaros center the icaros center (interdepartmental center for advances in robotic  surgery) of the university of naples federico ii was founded in march  2016 by the will of prof. vincenzo mirone of the school of medicine and  surgery and prof. bruno siciliano of the school of engineering and basic  sciences, who is the director of the center. the center aims at creating  synergies between clinical and surgical practice and research on new  technologies for computer/robot assisted surgery. **about naples naples is the third largest city in italy, and is the capital of the  campania region. world-known for its rich history, art, culture,  architecture, music, and gastronomy, naples is a lively, exciting and  bustling city situated on the southwest coast in a gorgeous gulf, and is  surrounded by attractive tourist and archaeological sites such as capri,  ischia, amalfi coast, pompei, ercolano, mount vesuvius. see  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__en.wikipedia.org_wiki_naples&d=dwic-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=gsgpyz3peiyjpxbuhdhmiyelcpt6ekufxu2fhpdypci&s=we_f_5y7ltqcedipxi_jb_8qobti9en7x2tttoju5fa&e= for further information. **salary and duration the positions are full time and will be paid according to the current  italian scheme. salary will be determined depending on the level of  experience and research seniority of the individual candidate. positions are available immediately and will remain open until a  suitable number of strongly qualified candidates are selected. ** qualified potential applicants holding a phd degree should provide  the following material:       1) cover letter briefly describing their background and career plans       2) cv       3) link to their research web-site       4) list of publications       5) date of availability       6) names and contact information of at least two references all documents should be submitted via email as a single compressed/pdf  file to prof. bruno siciliano, bruno.siciliano at unina.it and dr. fanny  ficuciello fanny.ficuciello at unina.it with the subject: postdoc candidate  musha. for more information, please contact: dr. fanny ficuciello fanny.ficuciello at unina.it https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__wpage.unina.it_fanny.ficuciello&d=dwic-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=gsgpyz3peiyjpxbuhdhmiyelcpt6ekufxu2fhpdypci&s=zvw5fygb-85cewcojzvbpzrm_2lurvbkm4gs1gg3pb4&e=

subject: postdoctoral position in mechatronics  and control for haptic feedback systems at iit, italy
content: ************************************ postdoc in mechatronics and control for haptic feedback systems and teleoperation at the istituto italiano di tecnologia, italy ************************************ the advanced robotics research line at istituto italiano di tecnologia, an english-language research institute, is seeking a highly motivated, full-time post-doc, who will have a leading research role in the development and control of a dexterous master teleoperation system. the selected candidate will join an interdisciplinary team and have the opportunity to pursue research within the project ?sistemi cibernetici collaborativi ? teleoperation? in collaboration with inail (?istituto nazionale per l'assicurazione contro gli infortuni sul lavoro? - national institute for insurance against workplace injuries) cup j32f17000950005. the project will create the next-generation, collaborative master-slave teleoperation system for intuitive operation in hazard-prone industries, with the aim of reducing risks to workers? health and safety. specifically, the objectives of the project are: (1) integration of a new hydraulic quadruped field robot; (2) development of a novel dexterous robotic manipulator arm for grasping and manipulation of objects; (3) development of a high performance 6 dof force feedback master and integration of a hand exoskeleton for dexterous haptic tele-manipulation; and (4) development of novel user interaction interfaces for intuitive teleoperation using augmented reality and virtual reality systems. the project will be developed within an inter-disciplinary group (robotics, engineering, and ergonomics), in close collaboration with end-users. further details about the position and the application procedure can be found at the below link. the deadline for applications is january 15, 2018. https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_585-2dpostdoctoral-2dposition-2din-2dmechatronics-2dand-2dcontrol-2dfor-2dhaptic-2dfeedback-2dsystems-2dand-2dteleoperation&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=pqwh2rofnx-gy89kegbsbmc5wdgce3rh7p1l_ri6xa8&s=rvdmtetq5vvze1vtoeu4o4rnshvnb87dc71njia_0ea&e= best regards, ~ nikhil deshpande ---------------------------------- researcher advanced robotics istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) via morego 30, genova, 16163, italia ph: (+39) 010 71781 805 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iit.it_people_nikhil-2ddeshpande&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=pqwh2rofnx-gy89kegbsbmc5wdgce3rh7p1l_ri6xa8&s=e16c3qo-fgelkmwt2ibbhresfi7nykqaakw31djw_qc&e= ----------------------------------

subject: multiple engineer positions in advanced  robotics at iit, italy
content: ************************************ multiple engineering positions for advanced robotics development at the istituto italiano di tecnologia, italy ************************************ the advanced robotics research line at iit, istituto italiano di tecnologia, an english-language research institute, is building an interdisciplinary team of highly motivated, full-time engineers with key development roles in mechanical design, electronics, embedded systems, and software development. the selected candidates will join a motivated, inter-disciplinary group of researchers and engineers, and have the opportunity to pursue research and development within the project ?sistemi cibernetici collaborativi ? teleoperation? in collaboration with inail (?istituto nazionale per l'assicurazione contro gli infortuni sul lavoro? - national institute for insurance against workplace injuries, italy) cup j32f17000950005. the project will develop a novel, collaborative, master-slave teleoperation hardware and software system targeting operation in hazard-prone industries, with the aim of reducing risks to workers? health and safety. it will utilize, develop, and integrate advanced technologies in tele-locomotion, tele-manipulation, and human-machine interaction. the project will be developed within an inter-disciplinary group in close collaboration with end-users. the objectives of the project are: (1) integration of a new hydraulic quadruped field robot; (2) development of a novel dexterous robotic manipulator arm for object grasping and manipulation; (3) development of a high performance 6-dof force feedback master and integration of a hand exoskeleton for dexterous haptic tele-manipulation; and (4) development of novel user interaction interfaces for intuitive teleoperation using augmented and virtual reality systems. the successful candidates will form part of the team responsible for the master haptic tele-manipulation systems. the goal of this team will be to design, develop, and control the master haptic system consisting of a high performance force-feedback device and its integration with a dexterous hand exoskeleton for the teleoperation of the dexterous torque-controlled manipulator arm. details on the different positions and the application procedures are available at the below link (scroll down for english version!). the deadline for applications is january 31, 2018. https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__bit.ly_2eupwqn&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=r_cnlp5cnj-imqad3ivecevl76v0wdo-gf2na7fldiu&s=vgwycac9p8cirpqtdfyqb7-hmg_vqz1evsqxbpknr2c&e= best regards, ~ nikhil deshpande ------------------------------------ researcher advanced robotics istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) via morego 30, genova, 16163, italia ph: (+39) 010 71781 805 ------------------------------------

subject: research engineer in humanoid  tele-operation, in inria, france
content: *************** full job description here:   https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__jobs.inria.fr_public_classic_en_offres_2017-2d00205&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=tzvd8nqoe_xaawjfnjuuqtrgkzcpjz2xabntxajnqis&s=wct1cjtevkelmx1nfdl10v_qwobzynfdq1nke-qgtxc&e= *************** we are looking for a research engineer to join the team larsen in inria (nancy, france). the engineer will join the team working in the european project andy (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__andy-2dproject.eu_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=tzvd8nqoe_xaawjfnjuuqtrgkzcpjz2xabntxajnqis&s=cvljj6f92oua1giq0rday07j8urfd-6i3tbzcdc7lgq&e=) <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__andy-2dproject.eu_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=tzvd8nqoe_xaawjfnjuuqtrgkzcpjz2xabntxajnqis&s=cvljj6f92oua1giq0rday07j8urfd-6i3tbzcdc7lgq&e=)>, a h2020 funded project with several international partners in germany (dlr),  slovenia  (jsi) and italy (iit).  one of the objectives of the project is to realize collaborative scenarios between the humanoid robot icub and a human partner, equipped with several wearable sensors. collaboration is intended as anticipatory physical interaction that assists the human partner in realizing a task while optimizing some criteria (equilibrium, effort, ergonomy). for example, we need to realize a collaborative assembly or pick & place task, where the icub and the human partner pick an object together, transport it (eventually) to a desired location, and then place it, to make some assembly.  in this context, we would like to implement an immersive whole-body tele-operation of the icub, so that a human operator can control in real-time the humanoid icub, to provide demonstrations of the desired robot behavior during these tasks. the human operator will be equipped with a xsens mvn suit, a wearable system for motion capture, a virtual-reality system with joysticks (e.g., htc vive), sensorized gloves and shoes. in the team we proposed preliminary theoretical model for offline synthesis of the robot's movement from xsens data, and we already have a working kinematics retargeting implementation online. the goal of the engineer will be to retarget the movement and actions of the human operator into the robot icub, in real-time, ensuring the safety and stability of the robot motion. requirements: ms or phd in software engineering or robotics and/or experience in collaborative software development excellent teamwork and experience in collaborative software development (agile, ...) excellent knowledge of robotics expertise in programming development and software architecture previous experience in collaborative projects, real robots or tele-operation is a plus the position is for 1 year, extensions are possible. salary depends on experience. to apply: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__jobs.inria.fr_public_classic_en_offres_2017-2d00205&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=tzvd8nqoe_xaawjfnjuuqtrgkzcpjz2xabntxajnqis&s=wct1cjtevkelmx1nfdl10v_qwobzynfdq1nke-qgtxc&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__jobs.inria.fr_public_classic_en_offres_2017-2d00205&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=tzvd8nqoe_xaawjfnjuuqtrgkzcpjz2xabntxajnqis&s=wct1cjtevkelmx1nfdl10v_qwobzynfdq1nke-qgtxc&e=> candidates are also expected to contact via e-mail serena ivaldi, serena.ivaldi at inria.fr --------- serena ivaldi team larsen inria nancy grand-est room c104 tel: (+33) 03-5495-8475 mail: serena.ivaldi at inria.fr web: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__members.loria.fr_sivaldi_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=tzvd8nqoe_xaawjfnjuuqtrgkzcpjz2xabntxajnqis&s=em5umspdndxe5luqnkutnpdfiary2ru4-oufilvuyra&e= do not miss two important conferences in robotics: * humanoids 2017 @ birmingham (uk): https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.humanoids2017.org_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=tzvd8nqoe_xaawjfnjuuqtrgkzcpjz2xabntxajnqis&s=mlncgwd3ct_s8qaocbe19nhn-ups7gueq8emuffh350&e= * arso 2018 @ genova (italy): subject: postdoc at istituto italiano di  tecnologia in assistive robotics for rehabilitation and elderly care
content: (please redistribute; apologies for cross-postings) *************************************************************** postdoctoral position at istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) full job post description available here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_606-2dpostdoctoral-2dposition-2din-2ddeveloping-2dassistive-2dintelligence-2dof-2da-2dpersonal-2dhumanoid-2dfor-2dclinical-2drehabilitation-2dand-2dhousehold-2delderly-2dcare&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=evvu8t3pb09nmw99ppogkqa00dddgx7bacnxebqw_8a&s=oyfnkjeworb9ckoqednsiv8qyuopeqk6snjergexahu&e= topics: assistive robotics, health-care, rehabilitation, humanoid robots, human activity recognition, human-robot interaction, teleoperation, clinical and household environment. *************************************************************** in the context of the collaboration iit has recently established with fondazione don gnocchi - a clinical institution active on motor rehabilitation - we are looking for a postdoc researcher with outstanding competences and strong motivation to work with real robotic platforms and cooperate with end-users and health experts in a clinical environment. the project aims to advance the current capabilities of r1 humanoid in scenarios where it will be required to: (1) assist and monitor patients with motor impairments during daily rehabilitation at hospital; (2) allow caregivers to operate the humanoid remotely to enable natural telepresence and tele-rehabilitation; (3) implement efficient solutions to improve the quality of life of frail elderly people in sensorized household settings (e.g. accomplish fetch-and-carry tasks, detect and handle emergency conditions, perform cognitive stimulation). requirements: *         phd degree in robotics, engineering, computer science or related areas; *         outstanding technical and theoretical background; *         hands-on experience in control theory and/or computer vision; *         in-depth knowledge of embedded real-time systems; *         excellent c/c++ programming skills; *         familiarity with robotic middleware and development tools; *         ability to analyze, improve and propose new algorithms/solutions; *         excellent communication, teamwork and collaborative attitude. an internationally experience-related competitive salary will be offered. to apply, follow the instructions published on the job post webpage. ____________________________________ ugo pattacini<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_people_ugo-2dpattacini&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=evvu8t3pb09nmw99ppogkqa00dddgx7bacnxebqw_8a&s=n9kgtzz3p53frzdqxtu92ndnfpat0tjihbg7z9o4okg&e=> istituto italiano di tecnologia via morego 30 16163 genoa, italy ph: +39 010 71781-523

subject: post-doctoral position in design &  control of an innovative collaborative gripper for industrial robots
content: the icub facility line at fondazione istituto italiano di tecnologia, an english-language research institute, is seeking a highly motivated, full-time post-doc, who will have a leading research role in the design and control of an innovative collaborative gripper for industrial applications. the selected candidate will join an interdisciplinary team and will have the opportunity to pursue research within a project jointly developed by iit with camozzi automation group, an industrial partner operating worldwide in the automation field.  the aim of the project is to create the next-generation of collaborative grippers that will be employed in factory plants working safely with, or in close proximity to, humans. the project objectives range from the development of a force sensing system to be used with pneumatic grippers to the development of a novel electrical collaborative gripper capable of interacting with the environment and with human operators. the investigation will include the design of a control system for grasping soft and fragile objects and the integration of sensors and electronics to enhance human-robot interaction. the successful candidate should have the following skills: - phd degree (already taken or expected to be taken soon) in in robotics, engineering or related areas; - ability to communicate technical knowledge in a clear and understandable manner; - hands-on experience with analysis, design, and testing of robotic systems; - broad understanding of modern and innovative manufacturing techniques; - experience in control and programming in c++ is welcome; - familiarity with data acquisition, control and communications with embedded systems is welcome; - experience in mechanical design with solidworks, creo etc., actuators and drives, hands-on system integration is welcome; - experience in computer vision and object recognition is welcome; expected start date is march 2018 or soon after. to apply, follow the guidelines published in the full job post description available here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_611-2dpost-2ddoctoral-2dposition-2din-2ddesign-2d-2dcontrol-2dof-2dan-2dinnovative-2dcollaborative-2dgripper-2dfor-2dindustrial-2drobots&d=dwicag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=k_md4nfrgocbh70rb3jwon5i12frcssn7hlyfi3b3wq&s=dh2jckp9jsukcrmrou3ig4yjhogx7tyjudbkh6hysy4&e= luca fiorio istituto italiano di tecnologia via morego 30 16163 genoa, italy -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwicag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=k_md4nfrgocbh70rb3jwon5i12frcssn7hlyfi3b3wq&s=cuvd61wpw2hciyn1y23e-zyr8ccjdbrrloboub9ygm4&e=

subject: openings in robotics for rehabilitation  and prosthetics at the italian institute of technology (iit)
content: job openings in robotics for rehabilitation and prosthetics the rehab technologies facility at iit (rehab technologies<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_research_lines_rehab-2dtechnologies-2dinail-2diit-2dlab&d=dwif-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=cilyabiiptnrkj1cp1dr14ipnplq9hwmhwunp0mpyg0&s=f7wy7kybxryv3kdisdz8yvyefg4ylgavme52qyjwje4&e=>) is seeking to appoint full-time engineers in the following areas: a) software development b) control engineering c) biomedical engineering -- context -- the projects will be a technological challenge in which iit and an internationally recognized clinical partner will share resources, competencies and motivation to achieve excellent results transferable to the medical field. the selected candidates will be part of an interdisciplinary team (consisting of experts in engineering, robotics and medicine) that aims to design exoskeletal and prosthetic robotic devices. -- where -- the italian institute of technology (istituto italiano di tecnologia - iit), with its headquarters in genova, italy, is a non-profit institution with the primary goal of creating and disseminating scientific knowledge and strengthening italy?s technological competitiveness. the institute offers state-of-the-art equipment and a top-level interdisciplinary research environment focused on robotics and computer vision, neuroscience, drug discovery, nanoscience and technology. -- what we offer  -- a fixed term contract -- what we're looking for  -- a) software engineer (junior) the successful candidate will be responsible for developing software code in the area of control and human-machine interface for rehabilitation and prosthetic robotic devices. qualifications and desired skills: - an excellent master degree in computer science or engineering/related areas - from  entry level up to 3 years of proven extensive programming experience - expertise in c, c++ (using an oop approach) - ability in analysis and solution of logical problems - strong interest in robotics - good communication skills and ability/willingness to integrate and collaborate within a multidisciplinary team will be an advantage: - proven experience in one or more of the following areas: --> gui design and knowledge of toolkits such as qt, wxwidgets or others --> multithread programming, inter-process communication and related issues - experience in collaborative software development (agile) - knowledge of version control software (svn or git) will be an advantage - practical knowledge of english b) robotics engineer the successful candidate will be responsible for designing and developing critical control systems that improve the performance and safety of our platform in c / c++. qualifications and desired skills: - excellent knowledge of robotics - develop simulations and deploy control on our robotic devices. - kinematic and dynamic modelling - motion planning and calibration - signal processing - embedded programming - knowledge in c, c++ (using an oop approach) - software integration, debugging, configuring and testing will be an advantage: - experience in one or more areas: --> mechatronics --> system integration c) biomedical engineer (junior) the successful candidate will be responsible for supporting the biomedical team in: - defining rehabilitation protocols and metrics suited for implementation in medical robotic devices - carrying out clinical trials to study efficacy and effectiveness of robotic rehabilitation devices - analyzing data - managing of the documentation to mark ce a medical device - managing of the documentation required by the quality management system iso 13485 standards qualifications and desired skills: - possess a master degree in bioengineering or biomedical engineering - basic work/academic experience in the clinical environment and with medical devices in a real world scenario - technical understanding of medical devices - technical understanding of clinical rehabilitation protocols - ability in analysis and solution of logical problems - good knowledge of statistical analysis - good knowledge of matlab and/or r for statistics for applications, please send a motivation letter and a cv to giulio.cerruti at iit.it best regards, giulio cerruti senior mechatronic engineer @ rehab technologies<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_research_lines_rehab-2dtechnologies-2dinail-2diit-2dlab&d=dwif-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=cilyabiiptnrkj1cp1dr14ipnplq9hwmhwunp0mpyg0&s=f7wy7kybxryv3kdisdz8yvyefg4ylgavme52qyjwje4&e=> tel.  +39 010 71781 418 fax. +39 010 71781 203 via morego, 30 16163 genova, italy

subject: post-doc in sensing and automation in  robotic surgery at iit, genoa, italy
content: ==================================================== post-doc in sensing and automation in robotic surgery (cb 74499) ==================================================== the advanced robotics research line of istituto italiano di tecnologia is seeking a highly motivated, full-time post-doc in the area of medical robotics. the positions are linked to the robotic microsurgery translational project of advr's biomedical robotics laboratory (brl). this project aims to refine, enhance and validate promising medical device prototypes developed by brl's research team. the final objective is to develop advanced device prototypes to enable clinical trials with the new technologies. this will allow their introduction into medical practice, leading to significantly enhanced health outcomes. details on the positions are provided below. the successful candidates will be offered a fixed-term contract (24 months) with a highly competitive salary commensurable with qualifications and experience. workplace: genoa, italy to apply, please send electronically a detailed cv to leonardo.demattos at iit.it by february 28, 2018 stating the position title in the subject of the e-mail.  ---------------------------------- about the ideal candidate ---------------------------------- we are looking to appoint a skilled and enthusiastic engineer with experience on the design, development and assessment of sensing and automation systems for biomedical applications. the candidate should possess a phd degree in medical robotics or related field and an excellent publication record. the selected candidate will join an interdisciplinary team and contribute to the development of novel sensing technologies and autonomous behaviors in the area of robotic laser surgery.  this is a major area of research at brl, one which includes close collaboration with top surgeons and surgical device companies. currently the group is developing robotic technologies for free-beam and for endoscopic laser surgery. both applications offer a vast number of research topics that can be explored, including in real-time tumor detection, surgical planning, surgical automation, micro-robotics and laser-tissue interaction. experience in one or more of the following areas will be considered a plus: robotics, laser systems, tumor detection, planning and automation in robotic surgery, medical devices, clinical trials. ------------------------------------------------? leonardo mattos, phd  head of biomedical robotics lab department of advanced robotics istituto italiano di tecnologia via morego, 30 - 16163 genova, italy phone:? +39.010.71781.409  mobile:? +39.327.1647194  fax: +39.010.71781.232 www.iit.it   https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__old.iit.it_en_advr-2dlabs_biomedical-2drobotics-2dlab-2dnew.html&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=vjs_kkkemunpt0qhxhbsvzp20vjlzuohbbwrks6knvy&s=ylu28qoovym4xzyapuflyj_kzymwlicdseodieti-mo&e=  istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit), with its headquarters in genova, italy, is a non-profit institution with the primary goal of creating and disseminating scientific knowledge and strengthening italy's technological competitiveness. the institute offers state-of-the-art equipment and a top-level interdisciplinary research environment focused on robotics and computer vision, neuroscience, drug discovery, nanoscience and technology. in order to comply with italian law (art. 23 of privacy law of the italian legislative decree n. 196/03), the candidate is kindly asked to give his/her consent to allow iit to process his/her personal data. we inform you that the information you provide will be solely used for the purpose of assessing your professional profile to meet the requirements of istituto italiano di tecnologia. your data will be processed by istituto italiano di tecnologia, with its headquarters in genoa, via morego 30, acting as the data holder, using computer and paper-based means, observing the rules on the protection of personal data, including those relating to the security of data. please also note that, pursuant to art. 7 of legislative decree 196/2003, you may exercise your rights at any time as a party concerned by contacting the data manager. istituto italiano di tecnologia is an equal opportunity employer that actively seeks diversity in the workforce.

subject: senior technician opening in  human-robot interaction - istituto italiano di tecnologia (genoa, italy)
content: the social cognition in human-robot interaction team is looking for a highly motivated, skilled and experienced candidate to conduct experimental work within a commercial project for a large, well-recognized international company. the task will be to examine human-robot interaction with a humanoid robot, and in particular, human responsiveness to various robot expressions. the selected candidate will work with various humanoid robots, including the icub robot developed at iit. the ideal candidate would have:    - phd degree in software engineering, robotics or related fields    - high interest in human-robot interaction    - excellent programming skills (c++, python, matlab)    - experience with gnu/linux systems    - experience with ros/yarp middleware.    - experience with version control systems (git preferably)    - excellent spoken and written english experience with the following would be an asset:    - integration of various components of the experimental design    (presentation of stimuli, eye tracker, eeg system, a humanoid robot)    - studies in human-robot interaction    - working in interdisciplinary teams the successful candidate will work on designing empirical studies, programing robot behaviours for human-robot interaction, and conducting the experiments. the research will focus on expressions and social gestures of the robot and will examine human responses to those expressions. deadline: february 16, 2018 to apply for this position please refer to the following link: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_617-2dsenior-2d&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=tjg6unbi6jsaysjedg51ho9fzovpwp5cre8iiveumfq&s=iulgs-0sjjdundmsoopaxgi9snkmj8kmtkekmikfp3a&e= technician-opening-in-human-robot-interaction <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_617-2dsenior-2dtechnician-2dopening-2din-2dhuman-2drobot-2dinteraction&d=dwmfaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=gnvf7i_ioooabqv8jnmhtv7npsazoeabmkzf6v8suww&s=nmnarsai-b_72_mbzkcyjy2ahezb2_om6ekcypfqe-0&e=> more information about our research line at: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_research_lines_social-2dcognition-2din-2d&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=tjg6unbi6jsaysjedg51ho9fzovpwp5cre8iiveumfq&s=3wxjf7tty1fbhv8qrw_fk0kq278afzdvf0jxpnwoqnm&e= human-robot-interaction <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_research_lines_social-2dcognition-2din-2dhuman-2drobot-2dinteraction&d=dwmfaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=gnvf7i_ioooabqv8jnmhtv7npsazoeabmkzf6v8suww&s=qwnmjguwvnhpk3fcnmnhj7lmqwu9qchzvgkfgtcriao&e=> best, davide de tommaso --  *davide de tommaso* software engineer - social cognition in human-robot interaction tel: +39 010 8172 245 istituto italiano di tecnologia center for human technologies via enrico melen 83, 16152 - genova https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iit.it_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=tjg6unbi6jsaysjedg51ho9fzovpwp5cre8iiveumfq&s=sd1a6i-tf6vz7hs1ii28v76r3hqzxmlgsqdkuykeyuy&e=

subject: postdoc openings at humanoid & human  centred mechatronics lab, department of advanced robotics,  italian institute of technology
content: postdoc openings in humanoid & human centred mechatronics lab department of advanced robotics italian institute of technology the humanoid & human centred mechatronics lab of the department of advanced robotics (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iit.it_en_advanced-2drobotics_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wba00aetynjiw21q8ncum2rcnpyk0iu-khlu7t8_bio&s=uwkv-p78x8nhn4a29e6oc5k3ntfbk3hpkgmucoclwti&e=) at the italian institute of technology iit is seeking to appoint two international well motivated full-time junior/senior postdoctoral research fellows that will have a key research role on the control of mobile manipulation platforms.   we are looking for highly motivated, outstanding young scientists with a background and phd in mechanical/control engineering and an excellent, well established publication record in one or more of the following areas:   *   design and control of multi-dof manipulators for special purposes   *   design of torque/impedance controlled robots   *   master-slave control in bilateral teleoperation   *   control of force-reflecting assistive robotic systems with customized sensing and actuation   *   motion tracking technologies iit is an english language institute and international applications are strongly encouraged and will receive logistic support for visa issues. the successful candidate will be offered a contract for the whole term of the project (30-months max.) with a highly competitive salary, which will be commensurate with qualifications and experience. the position is open for immediate starting.  the full details of this position requirements as well as instructions on how to apply can be found in the following link: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_592-2dpostdoctoral-2dposition-2din-2dcontrol-2dand-2dmechatronics-2dof-2drobotic-2dmanipulators-2dfor-2dadvanced-2dteleoperation&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wba00aetynjiw21q8ncum2rcnpyk0iu-khlu7t8_bio&s=ve2phmtrb4lrm7h1imkc5dzpewmwcurqqozudzlflr8&e= interested applicants should submit in electronic form their cv outlining experience and qualifications, three relevant publications, a statement of research interests and plans, and the names of at least three referees to nikos tsagarakis (nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it<mailto:nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it>). for consideration, apply by 25.02.2018. kind regards, nikos tsagarakis -------------------------------------------------------------------------- nikos tsagarakis, tenured senior scientist head of humanoids and human centred mechatronics lab dept. of advanced robotics subject: postdoctoral position in multi-robot  systems for precision farming
content: *** expressions of interest for a post-doc position expressions of interest are invited for a post-doc position to carry out research in the areas of control, robotics, and optimization  at the research group led by prof. andrea gasparri at the department of engineering at rome tre university in rome, italy. the post-doc position is funded by the h2020 project ?pantheon - precision farming of hazelnut orchards? (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.project-2dpantheon.eu&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ubtjnvqz93pbn3-2bpag5pz7ijzislp8mulkvvtow3a&s=8iw5qmr2zidabwuv4mznmbqrdclxzfiutbyvg7tgopk&e=)  coordinated by prof. gasparri, which started on november 1st, 2017. research experience is expected in one of the following areas:  simultaneous localization and mapping, robot motion planning, multi-robot coordination and task allocation, cloud robotics, and field robotics  with experimental validations. the knowledge of the robot operating systems (ros) will be considered as a plus. candidates should hold a phd in relevant fields. in addition, candidates should have a track record of high impact international publications  and demonstrate enthusiasm for performing both theoretical and experimental research activities. furthermore, candidates should have  strong programming skills in c++, c, and (possibly) python. responsibilities include: theoretical and experimental research activities,  tutorship and mentoring of graduate and phd students. should any candidate be considered fit for the post-doc position, a call for applications will be opened. the post-doc appointment is to begin  at any time during 2018, the sooner the better. the position is full-time. the position is open to candidates of any nationality; in particular,  no knowledge of the italian language is required. the gross salary is 27.362,00 ?, which will result in ~1650 ? net per month.  travel funding will be available. the reply to this call should consist of an email, sent to gasparri at dia.uniroma3.it <mailto:gasparri at dia.uniroma3.it>, containing: (1) a curriculum vitae, including a list of publications;  and (2) the names and contact details of at least two references. expressions of interest should be sent no later than the 28th of february 2018.   *** abstract -- h2020 project ?pantheon - precision farming of hazelnut orchards?   the project pantheon introduces a supervisory control and data acquisition (scada) system for the precision farming of orchards. pantheon objective is to design an integrated system where a limited number of unmanned aerial and ground robots move within the orchard  to collect data and perform typical farming operations. the data is stored in a central operative unit where the information is integrated in order  to perform automatic feedback actions (e.g. to regulate the irrigation system) and to support the decisions of the agronomists. the proposed scada will acquire information at the resolution of the single plant. this will allow to dramatically increase the detection of limiting  factors for each individual plant, such as lack of water or pests and diseases affecting the plant health, and to react accordingly. this focused  intervention will result in a better average state of health of the orchard. this architecture has the potential to increase the production of the orchard  while being more cost-effective and environmentally-friendly. the proposed scada will be experimentally validated in a real-world (1:1 scale) hazelnut orchard located in the tuscia area (province of viterbo, italy). we are looking forward to receiving your expression of interest. best regards, andrea gasparri -- prof. andrea gasparri associate professor dipartimento di ingegneria universit? degli studi "roma tre" via della vasca navale, 79 00146 roma (italy) e-mail: gasparri at dia.uniroma3.it website: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__gasparri.dia.uniroma3.it_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ubtjnvqz93pbn3-2bpag5pz7ijzislp8mulkvvtow3a&s=lzuxvdk-otuuvr5he5lwwqi3b5wqkt8bdglhfieixye&e= phone: +39-06-5733-3206 fax:   +39-06-5733-3612
