subject: deadline extended - post-doctoral  position in design & control of an innovative collaborative gripper for  industrial robots
content: *apologies for cross-postings* the icub facility line at fondazione istituto italiano di tecnologia, an english-language research institute, is seeking a highly motivated, full-time post-doc, who will have a leading research role in the design and control of an innovative collaborative gripper for industrial applications. the selected candidate will join an interdisciplinary team and will have the opportunity to pursue research within a project jointly developed by iit with camozzi automation group, an industrial partner operating worldwide in the automation field.  the aim of the project is to create the next-generation of collaborative grippers that will be employed in factory plants working safely with, or in close proximity to, humans. the project objectives range from the development of a force sensing system to be used with pneumatic grippers to the development of a novel electrical collaborative gripper capable of interacting with the environment and with human operators. the investigation will include the design of a control system for grasping soft and fragile objects and the integration of sensors and electronics to enhance human-robot interaction. the successful candidate should have the following skills: - ph.d. degree (already taken or expected to be taken soon) in in robotics, engineering or related areas; - ability to communicate technical knowledge in a clear and understandable manner; - hands-on experience with analysis, design, and testing of robotic systems; - broad understanding of modern and innovative manufacturing techniques; - experience in control and programming in c++ is welcome; - familiarity with data acquisition, control and communications with embedded systems is welcome; - experience in mechanical design with solidworks, creo etc., actuators and drives, hands-on system integration is welcome; - experience in computer vision and object recognition is welcome; expected start date is march 2018 or soon after. to apply, follow the guidelines published in the full job post description available here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_611-2dpost-2ddoctoral-2dposition-2din-2ddesign-2d-2dcontrol-2dof-2dan-2dinnovative-2dcollaborative-2dgripper-2dfor-2dindustrial-2drobots&d=dwicag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ucr580kbuxuimp1qlcjvqb2htvj43nq_eggvf3sqj08&s=esmojry_h7akwy8v5gnq9uk5xcuxebncukihyxyx0wc&e= luca fiorio istituto italiano di tecnologia via morego 30 16163 genoa, italy -- sent from: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robotics-2dworldwide.1046236.n5.nabble.com_&d=dwicag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ucr580kbuxuimp1qlcjvqb2htvj43nq_eggvf3sqj08&s=9q_j6xft8fwttoc-12js_durj1m9tlzbe0t3nrdijo8&e=

subject: 2 open positions at iit: 1 hardware  designer for sensory assistive technologies + 1 post-doc position on  augmented hearing
content: fellow position - hardware developer for sensory assistive technologies workplace: genova, iit at cht expires on: 22/02/2018 fondazione istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) is looking for a fellow position (7 months duration), to be involved in an ongoing research project focused on prototypes of wearable sensory aids for persons with hearing disability. the contract may have an extension within a spin-off project of iit. the end goal of the project is to engineer lightweight, low-power prototypes by increasing their trl (technology readiness level), for possible industrial applications. the selected candidate will: ? design and maintain the current hardware setup, deciding which solutions are more suitable for the evolution of the prototypes ? co-design the firmware specifications ? implement specific audio codecs the candidate will work in close collaboration with scientists of the spatial awareness and multisensory perception lab and engineers of the electronic design lab. candidates should have a degree in electronic or computer science engineering. the following skills are required: ? deep knowledge in embedded architectures based on dsp+arm soc (stm32). ? experience with wireless communication protocols (bluetooth 4.0, 5.0) ? programming languages: c, c++ and scripting languages ? strong knowledge in eda tools (orcad, spice, pads) experience with audio codecs (lossless and lossy, mpeg audio, itu standards) will be a plus. the research activities will mainly take place at iit in genoa, in the new laboratories at the center for human technologies. an internationally competitive salary, dependent on experience, will be offered. interested applicants should submit cv, list of publications, names of 2 referees and a statement of research interest to jobpost.74940 at iit.it by february 22, 2018, stating " fellow position - hardware developer for sensory assistive technologies- cb:74940 ? in the subject of the e-mail. more info at: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__iit.it_careers_openings_opening_623-2dfellow-2dposition-2dhardware-2ddeveloper-2dfor-2dsensory-2dassistive-2dtechnologies&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0vclmumtkf34ffrvgwxvoanjusumbss3hu-0qkif1-w&s=gypghzczi2xpt2cyriqfe6zqof89eid5pr3o0lg-69y&e= **************** post doc position- signal processing from array of sensors for augmented hearing workplace: genova, iit at cht expires on: 22/02/2018 a 12-months postdoctoral position is available at the istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit), genoa, italy. the contract may have an extension within a spin-off project of iit. the use of the audio channel as complementary source of spatial information is widely known: the brain is able to decode binaural cues and segregate unwanted background noise. however, when the hearing system is weak, artificial systems can modify the spectrum for sounds to be better understood. array of sensors can also allow algorithms to artificially point to arbitrary sound sources thanks to beamforming algorithms. there is still a lack of research on how such systems can be integrated with the human hearing system to increase its capabilities, especially when sensory deficits occur. the selected candidate will design acoustic beamforming algorithms specifically targeted on the human hearing system. he will study how the array architecture can be intertwined with perceptual needs. the research will be carried out in collaboration with a team of engineers, psychologists and experts in the field of sensory disabilities. the ideal candidate should have: ? a msc degree in computer science engineering, electrical engineering or equivalent ? a phd in the fields of signal processing, speech and audio processing ? strong skills in probability, statistics and linear algebra he/she should also have published in the related field. programming skills with software suites manipulating multidimensional data (matlab, python) is necessary. additional skills in c, c++ are welcome. the research activities will mainly take place at iit in genoa, in the new laboratories at the center for human technologies in a fully equipped laboratory of the ?spatial awareness and multisensory perception? lab. an internationally competitive salary, dependent on experience, will be offered. interested applicants should submit cv, list of publications, names of 2 referees and a statement of research interest to jobpost.74939 at iit.it by february 22, 2018, stating "post-doc position signal processing from array of sensors for augmented hearing - cb:74939? in the subject of the e-mail. https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__iit.it_careers_openings_opening_621-2dpost-2ddoc-2dposition-2dsignal-2dprocessing-2dfrom-2darray-2dof-2dsensors-2dfor-2daugmented-2dhearing&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0vclmumtkf34ffrvgwxvoanjusumbss3hu-0qkif1-w&s=kyzm2u1txvlhdt_kzodlyzvzpv5dkyiolbl_wvji51i&e= -- luca brayda, phd researcher robotics, brain and cognitive sciences dept. istituto italiano di tecnologia center for human technologies via e: melen 83, 16152 genova tel: +39 010 81 72 205 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.blindpad.eu&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0vclmumtkf34ffrvgwxvoanjusumbss3hu-0qkif1-w&s=a_8iyjbr4bj132n28o4bc7zjrrwkefslek9ury2at2o&e= https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_people_luca-2dbrayda&d=dwigaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0vclmumtkf34ffrvgwxvoanjusumbss3hu-0qkif1-w&s=g1bezgvth7lyaov8mvaggd7hmwmjdjptv7yff6rt02w&e=

subject: openings in robotics for rehabilitation  and prosthetics at the italian institute of technology (iit)
content: job openings in robotics for rehabilitation and prosthetics the rehab technologies facility at iit (rehab technologies<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_research_lines_rehab-2dtechnologies-2dinail-2diit-2dlab&d=dwif-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hgtwzdgtkhfrzjawsllnhe-mus2a5m3e4cij-x2ikbe&s=5x__lt8birvqhlv-wvjoiosjcjg96psindmnn-zjmlm&e=>) is seeking to appoint full-time engineers in the following areas: a) software development b) robotic engineering c) mechatronic engineering -- context -- the projects will be a technological challenge in which iit and an internationally recognized clinical partner will share resources, competencies and motivation to achieve excellent results transferable to the medical field. the selected candidates will be part of an interdisciplinary team (consisting of experts in engineering, robotics and medicine) that aims to design exoskeletal and prosthetic robotic devices. -- where -- the italian institute of technology (istituto italiano di tecnologia - iit), with its headquarters in genova, italy, is a non-profit institution with the primary goal of creating and disseminating scientific knowledge and strengthening italy?s technological competitiveness. the institute offers state-of-the-art equipment and a top-level interdisciplinary research environment focused on robotics and computer vision, neuroscience, drug discovery, nanoscience and technology. -- what we offer  -- a fixed term contract -- what we're looking for  -- a) software engineer (junior) the successful candidate will be responsible for developing software code in the area of control and human-machine interface for rehabilitation and prosthetic robotic devices. qualifications and desired skills: - an excellent master degree in computer science or engineering/related areas - from  entry level up to 3 years of proven extensive programming experience - expertise in c, c++ (using an oop approach) - ability in analysis and solution of logical problems - strong interest in robotics - good communication skills and ability/willingness to integrate and collaborate within a multidisciplinary team will be an advantage: - proven experience in one or more of the following areas: --> gui design and knowledge of toolkits such as qt, wxwidgets or others --> multithread programming, inter-process communication and related issues - experience in collaborative software development (agile) - knowledge of version control software (svn or git) will be an advantage - practical knowledge of english b) robotics engineer the successful candidate will be responsible for designing and developing critical control systems that improve the performance and safety of our platform in c / c++. qualifications and desired skills: - excellent knowledge of robotics - develop simulations and deploy control on our robotic devices. - kinematic and dynamic modelling - motion planning and calibration - signal processing - embedded programming - knowledge in c, c++ (using an oop approach) - software integration, debugging, configuring and testing will be an advantage: - experience in one or more areas: --> mechatronics --> system integration c) mechatronics engineer (junior) the successful candidate will be responsible for supporting our r&d team. qualifications and desired skills: - possess a master degree in mechatronics engineering - minimum 1 year relevant industrial experience or phd - signal processing - proficiency in hardware design (actuation units, force and interaction sensors, articulated systems) - excellent hands-on practical skills - strong competences in mechatronic systems analysis and physical system modeling will be an advantage: - basic work/academic experience in the clinical environment and with medical devices in a real world scenario - technical understanding of medical devices - ability in analysis and solution of logical problems - rehabilitation and haptic devices and tactile/force sensing technologies - innovative actuation systems for applications, please send a motivation letter and a cv to giulio.cerruti at iit.it<mailto:giulio.cerruti at iit.it> with matteo.laffranchi at iit.it in cc. best regards, giulio cerruti senior mechatronic engineer @ rehab technologies<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_research_lines_rehab-2dtechnologies-2dinail-2diit-2dlab&d=dwif-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hgtwzdgtkhfrzjawsllnhe-mus2a5m3e4cij-x2ikbe&s=5x__lt8birvqhlv-wvjoiosjcjg96psindmnn-zjmlm&e=> tel.  +39 010 71781 418 fax. +39 010 71781 203 via morego, 30 16163 genova, italy

subject: fellowship in control with smart  actuators, dynamic legged systems @ istituto italiano di tecnologia
content: the dynamic legged systems <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__dls.iit.it_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=gw0kga7qky4ol_gcb_qkyut3oxrq0sp5r2x83uzs3yq&s=4_xwwnosxprezkw1wsomnwlhi-dqamatftgojuu5rck&e=>, at the istituto  italiano di tecnologia, are currently looking for a highly motivated, full-time fellow to work in the evaluation of smart hydraulic actuators,  with the possibility of performing a master thesis project. at the moment of application, the candidate should be about to receive a  master's degree in systems and control, robotics, mechanical engineering or electrical engineering, or have already  received a master's degree not more than 6 months ago. the successful candidate will be involved in the modeling, simulation,  controller design and experimental evaluation of the novel smart hydraulic actuators to be used in the dls lab robotic  platforms. furthermore, the candidate will undertake the task of designing, implementing and evaluating the performance of novel  control strategies for hydraulic systems. requirements:   * strong background in modeling and control theory, frequency and time     domain analysis, signal analysis;   * strong programming skills in matlab/simulink (for both design and     analysis);   * strong communication skills (written and spoken) in english language;   * strong team player;   * willingness to integrate into a multidisciplinary, dynamic,     international research group further desirable skills:   * experience with hydraulic systems;   * knowledge of feedback linearization and nonlinear control strategies     in general;   * experience in legged robotic systems;   * good c++/python programming skills; to apply please send electronically your detailed cv, university  transcripts and cover letter outlining motivation, experience and qualifications for the position to claudio.semini at iit.it  <mailto:claudio.semini at iit.it>?, victor.barasuol at iit.it  <mailto:victor.barasuol at iit.it> and octavio.villarreal at iit.it  <mailto:octavio.villarreal at iit.it> stating ?*smart actuator position*? in the subject of the e-mail. regards, victor barasuol senior post-doc researcher dynamic legged systems - dls department of advanced robotics - advr istituto italiano di tecnologia - iit

subject: software developer and operation  (devops) engineer
content: the icub group at the italian institute of technology, is looking for a talented and motivated software developer and operation (devops) engineer. we are a multidisciplinary department developing hardware, firmware and cross-platform libraries for humanoid robots. the selected candidate will help our engineering team improve the production chain by reducing deployment time, developing and reviewing code, building and testing releases, packaging new software to target multi-platforms scenario, in close alignment with our research objectives.  more details are available here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_614-2dsoftware-2ddeveloper-2dand-2doperation-2ddevops-2dengineer-2d-2dicub&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=djy66j98turfgygrquylozsmasvqelodg5ozgoe6hxw&s=bxn0ev96pmg_w55zt643pybevlltrsuyahdbltfvaq8&e= -- istituto italiano di tecnologia lorenzo natale, phd lorenzo.natale at iit.it via morego, 30 16163 genova ph: +39 010 71781946 fax: +39 010 7170205 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__lornat75.github.io&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=djy66j98turfgygrquylozsmasvqelodg5ozgoe6hxw&s=fowntpw1aowwznviubfibs-pu4f67pdpxiknropybha&e= www.iit.it

subject: postdoctoral position in software  development for robotics on icub
content: dear roboticists, please see the following call. giorgio postdoctoral position in software development for robotics workplace: genova, iit deadline: 20/03/2018 the icub research line at istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) is seeking to appoint an international full-time post-doc on the topic of software development for robotics. applicants are expected to have a track record (phd research) in software development (e.g. ros), software testing, robotics, repository management (e.g. github), software integration, and related topics. the successful applicant will join the icub interdisciplinary team based in genoa, italy, and conduct research in the context of the european action 'the european robotics research infrastructure network - terrinet' funded by the european commission with grant agreement n. 730994, in partnership with other top-notch research institutions in europe (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__cordis.europa.eu_project_rcn_212585-5fen.html&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=sygpxf6msyver9_madvgxionwq65gpnrtusxf2hpp6o&s=jeh9ygkwljtimzin7va-z_9dtdypejqhb0weaqcixhe&e=). the successful applicant will be involved in the development of a lightweight methodology to provide access to robotics platforms, build repeatable experiments on real robots and simulators, integrate a variety of middleware systems and in general investigate opportunities to capitalize on the vast european research network in robotics. research will happen in the icub laboratories (home of the icub humanoid), where researchers can count on state of the art mechanical and electronic design facility, software development skills and about 50 enthusiastic researchers with a variety of competences ranging from optimal control, computer vision, to machine learning and force control. we are looking for a highly motivated scientist with a phd in robotics, engineering, physics, mathematics or other related fields. candidates are required to have outstanding technical and theoretical skills (c++ programming required). a strong and focused publication record in software development for robotics will be positively evaluated. proficiency in english (written and spoken) is required. the successful candidate will be offered a contract with a highly competitive salary. expected start date is may 1st, 2018. please apply by march 20th, 2018 by sending your application to applications at iit.it<mailto:applications at iit.it> quoting exactly "bc 74864 post doc terrinet project" in the subject of the e-mail. your application should contain a detailed cv with list of publications, university transcripts, your best first-author paper, a cover letter outlining motivation and statement of research interests/plan and names of 2 referees. only complete applications will be evaluated. istituto italiano di tecnologia (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iit.it&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=sygpxf6msyver9_madvgxionwq65gpnrtusxf2hpp6o&s=sq71mvrauxym_itula2kg0ftd7ktzhgvpt2odhdm8pq&e=<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iit.it_undefined_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=sygpxf6msyver9_madvgxionwq65gpnrtusxf2hpp6o&s=--wfx3wgr69b4kgesgmtwigyklsnvwewa-1ovqwqoc8&e=>) is a private foundation with the objective of promoting italy's technological development and higher education in science and technology. research at iit is carried out in highly innovative scientific fields with state-of-the-art technology. istituto italiano di tecnologia is an equal opportunity employer that actively seeks diversity in the workforce. in order to comply with italian law (art. 23 of privacy law of the italian legislative decree n. 196/03), the candidate is kindly asked to give his/her consent to allow iit to process his/her personal data. we inform you that the information you provide will be solely used for the purpose of assessing your professional profile to meet the requirements of istituto italiano di tecnologia. your data will be processed by istituto italiano di tecnologia, with its headquarters in genoa, via morego 30, acting as the data holder, using computer and paper-based means, observing the rules on the protection of personal data, including those relating to the security of data. please also note that, pursuant to art.7 of legislative decree 196/2003, you may exercise your rights at any time as a party concerned by contacting the data manager. giorgio metta <giorgio.metta at iit.it> istituto italiano di tecnologia via morego, 30 16163 genoa, italy ph: +39 010 7178-1411 fax: +39 010 7178-1205 url: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__pasa.cognitivehumanoids.eu&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=sygpxf6msyver9_madvgxionwq65gpnrtusxf2hpp6o&s=4gho3xi_t61qdrwrjiokjz-jrecnnwcj7hby29oa4ia&e=

subject: iot field application developer at  zerynth
content: dear colleagues, we are looking for a field applications developer. candidate will join a collaborative team to develop, test on the field and maintain the firmware of a smart seismic sensor that will be used in a very challenging and innovative project aimed at making early detection of seismic events. this seismic early warning prototype will be tested at the ego (european gravitational observatory) hosting the virgo interferometer. the smart seismic sensors will be integrated in a network capable of issuing early warnings based on incoming seismic waves. these warnings will be used to protect the virgo infrastructure from unwanted seismic disturbances that may affect the duty cycle of the instrument. the sensor firmware will be implemented by the candidate using the zerynth <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.zerynth.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=eso_dh2l3mummbtkvpmbzi0bcn4bkzdw-dttkaxjpaw&s=x4u0zt7y6lg93dlxbyhwcqz3jlbachirbwnxgm5isde&e=> framework and in particular the zerynth virtual machine (vm) and the related toolchain. the smart seismograph will be produced by lunitek <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.lunitek.it_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=eso_dh2l3mummbtkvpmbzi0bcn4bkzdw-dttkaxjpaw&s=wyx8fl9fxn60yrhnephjmgr7wqfzjxows0l5-j-hmhc&e=> and it will be endowed with a 32bit microcontroller and a low power wide area network (lpwan) modem (e.i: lora, sigfox or similar). here you can find the extended job description: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__drive.google.com_open-3fid-3d1or9ord1ylpnasogoirib2226zl3e2okh&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=eso_dh2l3mummbtkvpmbzi0bcn4bkzdw-dttkaxjpaw&s=j6pozurpcgnfogsatpuv7ns-okycl9dmn0movf-wgve&e= here the link to the official call for application: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__bandi.miur.it_bandi.php_public_fellowship_id-5ffellow_140590&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=eso_dh2l3mummbtkvpmbzi0bcn4bkzdw-dttkaxjpaw&s=imk-pt9jyi-7xlvndwrfv_my51c8uto7qqoqbs2ejqq&e= please share it to your colleagues, students and collaborators. d ------------------------------------------------------------ daniele mazzei assistant professor at computer science department of university of pisa largo bruno pontecorvo, 3 56127 pisa, italy tel: +39 050 221 2779 mobile: +39 329 4352823 skype: floyd_elba *try zerynth the python iot suite* https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.zerynth.com&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=eso_dh2l3mummbtkvpmbzi0bcn4bkzdw-dttkaxjpaw&s=9cwwvbwyp_d3tq3bn5btug3ti0oaehefs1dv6h8hrb8&e= https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.danielemazzei.it&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=eso_dh2l3mummbtkvpmbzi0bcn4bkzdw-dttkaxjpaw&s=kl8jdeu3bvorgbe-sj8it0tkktqak9l4hkb7vxazh0q&e= - subject: sw + ee engineers for legged robot  project at iit, italy
content: ****************************************** engineers for legged robot project at iit, genova ****************************************** the advanced robotics department (advr) and the dynamic legged systems  (dls) research lines at iit, istituto italiano di tecnologia, an  english-language research institute, are seeking two highly motivated,  full-time engineers with key development roles in the areas of software  (1st position) and electronics, electrical and embedded systems (2nd  position). *the selected candidates will join a motivated, inter-disciplinary group  of researchers and engineers, and have the opportunity to pursue  research and development within the project of a tele-operated quadruped  vehicle with manipulator in collaboration with inail (italy?s national  institute for insurance against workplace injuries). * *info about the quadruped robot: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__dls.iit.it_robots-2a&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ows0cmlw6eib19s7rmnpgzxn_hfcnfx8cdu6vysxqbq&s=sc0pm93ag_tu4xlb83i_1kfwegcbbkwatqv11kw-l34&e= the project will develop a novel, collaborative, master-slave  teleoperation hardware and software system targeting operation in  hazard-prone industries, with the aim of reducing risks to workers?  health and safety. it will utilize, develop, and integrate advanced  technologies in tele-locomotion, tele-manipulation, and human-machine  interaction. the project will be developed within an inter-disciplinary  group in close collaboration with end-users. the objectives of the  project are: (1) integration of a new hydraulic quadruped field robot;  (2) development of a novel dexterous robotic manipulator arm for object  grasping and manipulation; (3) development of a high performance 6-dof  force feedback master and integration of a hand exoskeleton for  dexterous haptic tele-manipulation; and (4) development of novel user  interaction interfaces for intuitive teleoperation using augmented and  virtual reality systems. further details about the position and the application procedure can be  found at the below links. the deadline for applications is march 4th, 2018. https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__dls.iit.it_index.php_open-2dpositions_openings_663-3asoftware-2ddevelopment-2dengineer&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ows0cmlw6eib19s7rmnpgzxn_hfcnfx8cdu6vysxqbq&s=xqnnmjruotuedsthlu3x9q6oakqr-lbkmocjcnk2t6q&e= https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__dls.iit.it_index.php_open-2dpositions_openings_662-3aingegnere-2delettronicoelettrico-2dper-2dlo-2dsviluppo-2ddi-2drobot-2dquadrupedi-2didraulici-2delectronicselectrical-2dengineer-2dfor-2dthe-2ddevelopment-2dof-2dhydraulic-2dquadruped-2drobots&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ows0cmlw6eib19s7rmnpgzxn_hfcnfx8cdu6vysxqbq&s=hxywmup96tiyg4ptmj_wzeykwaqaxriezu8orc4gxpq&e= best regards, claudio semini --  claudio semini, phd head of dynamic legged systems lab istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) advanced robotics department via morego 30, 16163 genoa, italy phone: +39 010 71781 912 email: claudio.semini at iit.it web: www.semini.ch or https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_claudio-2dsemini&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ows0cmlw6eib19s7rmnpgzxn_hfcnfx8cdu6vysxqbq&s=qsypka3x5z1h5xjmmv-__mzbghqgu-jywzq2uiy2mdi&e=

subject: internship position in augmented  reality at iit, italy
content: ************************************ internship position in augmented reality at the istituto italiano di tecnologia, italy ************************************ the advanced robotics research line at iit, istituto italiano di tecnologia, an english-language research institute, is seeking a highly motivated intern with key development role in software development for augmented reality and user experience in relation to robotic teleoperation for improving worker safety in high risk industry. the selected candidate will join a motivated, inter-disciplinary group of researchers and engineers, and have the opportunity to pursue research and development for new software systems as part of the master station in advanced robotic teleoperation. the project will use, develop, and integrate advanced technologies on tele-locomotion and haptic tele-manipulation for robots providing an immersive 3d user interaction experience. we seek a highly energetic engineer with a degree in computer science, engineering, robotics, or other fields and knowledge and motivation in the area of augmented reality development. the successful candidates will be offered a 1-year contract with a highly competitive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience. *to apply, please send electronically: (i) a detailed cv, (ii) university transcripts, (iii) a letter outlining motivation and (iv) names and contacts of 2 referees, to nikhil.deshpande at iit.it <nikhil.deshpande at iit.it> by march 23rd, 2018. please state ?augmented reality intern advr inail [cb: 74435]? in the subject line. * the deadline for applications is march 23, 2018. further details available at below link. https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_677-2daugmented-2dreality-2dfellow-2din-2dadvanced-2drobotic-2dteleoperation&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kaj8jx8b-bwcecgaugliisns5820z7uaaxg3bln3odu&s=qubbo1w85r__igvdvpxwkvyemdd8wuxfqzsthy1wlli&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_544-2d3-2dfellows-2dpositions-2davailable-2din-2dadvanced-2drobotic-2dteleoperation-2ddevelopment&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=kaj8jx8b-bwcecgaugliisns5820z7uaaxg3bln3odu&s=0tj-h7osg62i4yvk7lj55v_72kvhfwlwkpwo-hvgglq&e=> best regards, ~ nikhil deshpande -------------------------------------------- researcher advanced robotics istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) via morego 30, genova, 16163, italia ph: (+39) 010 71781 805 fax: (+39) 010 71781 232 --------------------------------------------

subject: postdoc position in robotics and  automation at university of pisa
content: dear colleagues, please find attached below a call for a post doc position in robotics  and automation at university of pisa. please feel free to forward the call to everybody who might be interested. best regards,  ??? lorenzo pollini *post-doc position in robotics and automation* requirements: phd or equivalent qualification obtained in italy or abroad project: guidance, navigation and control for enhanced unmanned vehicle  safety and security duration: 12 months (start date: april 2018) call (italian and english):  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.unipi.it_ateneo_bandi_assegni_pra2017_informaz_16032018_index.htm&d=dwidba&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ncarwchmhkx9agvavoqfuvowwjqy3ynnrz6l8xgo5em&s=za3ljvmji2kd042cnphfjynt_bquq6ovqrvjx8icrvq&e= deadline for application: *march 16^th 2018* project description: the candidate will participate in a project where  safe and secure cooperation between unmanned ground vehicles and  unmanned aerial vehicles will be demonstrated. he/she will be  responsible of development and experimentation of a guidance, navigation  and control system for mixed indoor/outdoor missions where fusion  between gps, uwb, lidar and vision is sought for safe navigation and  resilience to gps jamming and spoofing. the system will be demonstrated  in various scenarios including: -indoor/outdoor transition -gps jamming and spoofing detection and counteraction -approach and landing on moving platforms (ground and at sea); -indoor /outdoor environment mapping for navigation and exploration; -haptic pilot support for situational awareness and obstacle avoidance  for remotely piloted aerial vehicles; -enemy vehicles tracking, engagement and deception via selective  gps-spoofing candidate required skills : control systems and kalman filters design,  matlab, simulink, c/c++ programming candidate desired skills : guidance and navigation, ros, computer  vision, slam, haptics, mpc salary: in the call. point of contact: lorenzo pollini (lorenzo.pollini at unipi.it) --  ______________________________________________      lorenzo pollini, ph.d.      associate professor      dip. di ingegneria dell'informazione      universit? di pisa      via diotisalvi 2      56122 pisa pi, italy      tel. +39 050 221 7363      fax  +39 050 221 7333      e-mail: lorenzo.pollini at unipi.it      web: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.dsea.unipi.it_members_polliniw&d=dwidba&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ncarwchmhkx9agvavoqfuvowwjqy3ynnrz6l8xgo5em&s=rwz_sbebep4jfsv7a_s5dqngvkqzmcmlz_o2ueclt_c&e= ______________________________________________

subject: postdoctoral researcher,  software engineering for mobile manipulation @iit
content: the humanoid sensing and perception laboratory (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__goo.gl_gmxd62&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hfyh7f0mjseui79ievcsib7z39utjqu4kppgoqhhewq&s=mrxr42dgemnmpqb-_hgicgrodonbvkvftl0e2-ecxbm&e=) at the istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) is seeking to appoint as post-doctoral research position. the selected candidate will join the interdisciplinary team of the icub project, working on software engineering for mobile manipulation in the context of the carve project (one of the itp funded by the h2020 project robmosys, https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__robmosys.eu_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hfyh7f0mjseui79ievcsib7z39utjqu4kppgoqhhewq&s=qinpzux_hrud3ykm1gzkq3puoj08z-uftdc6jyijvak&e=). the position is available immediately for the duration of 1 year. more information on the position and how to apply are available online: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__goo.gl_rht8l3&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hfyh7f0mjseui79ievcsib7z39utjqu4kppgoqhhewq&s=_ypyznloyxrt4pyhxm0cqtr7hrc7-ns5ny5rywjxyy0&e= -- istituto italiano di tecnologia lorenzo natale, phd lorenzo.natale at iit.it via morego, 30 16163 genova ph: +39 010 71781946 fax: +39 010 7170205 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__lornat75.github.io&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hfyh7f0mjseui79ievcsib7z39utjqu4kppgoqhhewq&s=luwzbcpc39seol1frbqnfash7ugmdalhucfo5upv6u0&e= www.iit.it

subject: postdoctoral position in multi-robot  systems for precision farming
content: *** expressions of interest for a post-doc position expressions of interest are invited for a post-doc position to carry out research in the areas of control, robotics, and optimization  at the research group led by prof. andrea gasparri at the department of engineering at rome tre university in rome, italy. the post-doc position is funded by the h2020 project ?pantheon - precision farming of hazelnut orchards? (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.project-2dpantheon.eu&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=06uoghcqc0qczrytpezy5fksuy0gbbmdygkcfq3u69m&s=78q4js2idxrj2juggh3bbkyenol_2n-ga6xvvf5-uu4&e=)   coordinated by prof. gasparri, which started on november 1st, 2017. research experience is expected in one of the following areas:  simultaneous localization and mapping, robot motion planning, multi-robot coordination and task allocation, cloud robotics, and field robotics  with experimental validations. the knowledge of the robot operating systems (ros) will be considered as a plus. candidates should hold a phd in relevant fields. in addition, candidates should have a track record of high impact international publications  and demonstrate enthusiasm for performing both theoretical and experimental research activities. furthermore, candidates should have  strong programming skills in c++, c, and (possibly) python. responsibilities include: theoretical and experimental research activities,  tutorship and mentoring of graduate and phd students. should any candidate be considered fit for the post-doc position, a call for applications will be opened. the post-doc appointment is to begin  at any time during 2018, the sooner the better. the position is full-time. the position is open to candidates of any nationality; in particular,  no knowledge of the italian language is required. the gross salary is 27.362,00 ?, which will result in ~1650 ? net per month.  travel funding will be available. the reply to this call should consist of an email, sent to gasparri at dia.uniroma3.it, containing:  (1) a curriculum vitae, including a list of publications;  (2) the names and contact details of at least two references. expressions of interest should be sent no later than the 31st of march 2018. *** abstract -- h2020 project ?pantheon - precision farming of hazelnut orchards?   the project pantheon introduces a supervisory control and data acquisition (scada) system for the precision farming of orchards. pantheon objective is to design an integrated system where a limited number of unmanned aerial and ground robots move within the orchard  to collect data and perform typical farming operations. the data is stored in a central operative unit where the information is integrated in order  to perform automatic feedback actions (e.g. to regulate the irrigation system) and to support the decisions of the agronomists. the proposed scada will acquire information at the resolution of the single plant. this will allow to dramatically increase the detection of limiting  factors for each individual plant, such as lack of water or pests and diseases affecting the plant health, and to react accordingly. this focused  intervention will result in a better average state of health of the orchard. this architecture has the potential to increase the production of the orchard  while being more cost-effective and environmentally-friendly. the proposed scada will be experimentally validated in a real-world (1:1 scale) hazelnut orchard located in the tuscia area (province of viterbo, italy). we are looking forward to receiving your expression of interest. best regards, andrea gasparri p.s.: for those of you who may be interested in this position and will be attending erf2018, it may be possible to set up a meeting in person.  just send me an email at gasparri at dia.uniroma3.it to arrange it.  -- prof. andrea gasparri associate professor dipartimento di ingegneria universit? degli studi "roma tre" via della vasca navale, 79 00146 roma (italy) e-mail: gasparri at dia.uniroma3.it website: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__gasparri.dia.uniroma3.it_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=06uoghcqc0qczrytpezy5fksuy0gbbmdygkcfq3u69m&s=ocjhbagmadhlil8uxwfqo5vxzaent2q21bexapg8bru&e= phone: +39-06-5733-3206 fax:   +39-06-5733-3612

subject: postdoc position available @ prisma lab
content: the prisma lab at the university of naples federico ii is seeking to  recruit senior postdoctoral research fellows that will have a key  research role in the following area: visual servoing and automatic  control especially focused on aerial and mobile robots. the successful  candidates will conduct their research at the prisma lab on the european  research project hyfliers on the following themes: autonomous landing of  vtol vehicles on pipes in a refinery; autonomous navigation of pipes  with hybrid drones with omnidirectional, articulated wheels;  visual-force control of an hyper-redundant cable-driven robot arm. hyfliers (hybrid flying-rolling with-snake-arm robot for contact  inspection - www.hyfliers.eu <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.hyfliers.eu&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=iiyh8hinpvfypvks0gxtms0s3yiz0alne6gkqknqi4i&s=9q0-xltrzuhguq3pou-je0hvrlmxlbfy-rzrnb47vp8&e=>) is a research and  innovation action of eu horizon 2020 programme for advanced robot  capabilities research and take-up, worth 3,9 million euro funding.  hyfliers, running from 2018 to 2021, will develop the world's first  industrial integrated robot with hybrid air and ground mobility with a  long-reach hyper-redundant manipulator capable of reaching sites where  no other robot can access, reducing the exposition of human inspectors  to potentially dangerous working conditions. targeting ultrasonic  thickness measurements for oil and gas refineries and chemical plants,  the results could be applied to many other robotic inspection technologies. we are looking for highly-motivated young scientists with a background  and phd in automatic control and/or robotics, preferably with at least  two years of experience abroad, and a well-established publication  record among these respective areas:  ? - visual servoing  ? - modeling and control of uav/mobile robots  ? - piecewise-smooth, hybrid and impacting dynamic systems strong competencies in c/c++/ros programming and matlab are essential. qualified potential applicants holding a phd degree should provide the  following material:  ???? 1) cover letter briefly describing their background and career plans  ???? 2) cv  ???? 3) link to their research web-site  ???? 4) list of publications  ???? 5) date of availability  ???? 6) names and contact information of at least two references all documents should be submitted via email as a single compressed/pdf  file to prof. bruno siciliano siciliano at unina.it  <mailto:siciliano at unina.it>with the subject: postdoc candidate (hyfliers) *about prisma lab* university of naples federico ii is the third oldest university in italy  and the oldest public university in europe. the school of engineering,  with a population of 11,000 students, is the oldest in italy and  recently celebrated its second centennial since the foundation by king  gioacchino murat in 1811. the prisma team operates in the department of  electrical engineering and information technology, where since almost 30  years is conducting research in robotics. current interests include  force control, visual servoing, dual-arm/hand manipulation, human-robot  interaction, aerial robotics and surgical robotics. the team has gained  world-wide recognition and is currently engaged in six projects  supported by the european community. see www.prisma.unina.it  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.prisma.unina.it&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=iiyh8hinpvfypvks0gxtms0s3yiz0alne6gkqknqi4i&s=7uileekszdlhqroficirmo9jvb4fq1wrurjmn0pcane&e=>for further information. *about naples** ***naples is the third largest city in italy, and is the capital of the  campania region. world-known for its rich history, art, culture,  architecture, music, and gastronomy, naples is a lively, exciting and  bustling city situated on the southwest coast in a gorgeous gulf, and is  surrounded by attractive tourist and archaeological sites such as capri,  ischia, amalfi coast, pompei, ercolano, mount vesuvius. *salary and duration* the positions are full time and will be paid according to the current  italian scheme. salary will be determined depending on the level of  experience and research seniority of the individual candidate. positions are available immediately and will remain open until a  suitable number of strongly qualified candidates are selected. --  prof bruno siciliano ieee fellow, asme fellow, ifac fellow past president ieee robotics & automation society board director european robotics association prisma lab chair of automation 0817683179 mob +39 368605665 emailsiciliano at unina.it skype bsiciliano subject: phd and postdoc positions @ campus  bio-medico university, rome, italy
content: - apologies for cross-postings - in the context of the european research council grant ?reshape: restoring the self with embodiable hand prostheses? and related national grants, we are seeking outstanding post-doc scientists and highly-motivated phd students to join us in developing new tools and methods to improve the embodiment of robotic hand prostheses and supernumerary limbs, and to study the related brain processes. activities will be carried out in a multidisciplinary research environment (nextlab: neurophysiology and neuroengineering of human-technology interaction) @ campus bio-medico university, rome italy (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.unicampus.it_next&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=y2uo70z7umsfcs8m9bkus-vqifrmcj4xgyi2ynl6oky&s=wcshbgazbhjg7xcswh_onpnljggi_ml18ajz1gtcpra&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.unicampus.it_next&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=y2uo70z7umsfcs8m9bkus-vqifrmcj4xgyi2ynl6oky&s=wcshbgazbhjg7xcswh_onpnljggi_ml18ajz1gtcpra&e=>). post-doc ideal candidates should ?         have relevant publications in international journals and experience in fund raising ?         be english mother tongue or have almost comparable fluency ?         have experience in the following topics: 1.       programming for development/customization of interactive virtual/augmented reality environment 2.       eeg/mri signal processing 3.       body ownership, embodiment, cognitive neuroscience. phd student ideal candidates should ?         be english mother tongue or have good fluency ?         have a master degree (or equivalent) in o   biomedical robotics, biomedical engineering, computer science, signal processing, or other related fields o   medicine, neuroscience, neurophysiology, neuropsychology or other related fields suitable candidates can introduce themselves by contacting giovanni di pino (g.dipino at unicampus.it <mailto:g.dipino at unicampus.it>), domenico formica (d.formica at unicampus.it <mailto:d.formica at unicampus.it>) and luca vollero (l.vollero at unicampus.it <mailto:l.vollero at unicampus.it>).

subject: internship position in augmented  reality at iit, italy
content: ************************************ internship position in augmented reality at the istituto italiano di tecnologia, italy ************************************ application deadline: march 23rd, 2018! ************************************ the advanced robotics research line at iit, istituto italiano di tecnologia, an english-language research institute, is seeking a highly motivated intern with key development role in software development for augmented reality and user experience in relation to robotic teleoperation for improving worker safety in high risk industry. the selected candidate will join a motivated, inter-disciplinary group of researchers and engineers, and have the opportunity to pursue research and development for new software systems as part of the master station in advanced robotic teleoperation. the project will use, develop, and integrate advanced technologies on tele-locomotion and haptic tele-manipulation for robots providing an immersive 3d user interaction experience. we seek a highly energetic engineer with a degree in computer science, engineering, robotics, or other fields and knowledge and motivation in the area of augmented reality development. the successful candidates will be offered a 1-year contract with a highly competitive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience. *to apply, please send electronically: (i) a detailed cv, (ii) university transcripts, (iii) a letter outlining motivation and (iv) names and contacts of 2 referees, to nikhil.deshpande at iit.it <nikhil.deshpande at iit.it> by march 23rd, 2018. please state ?augmented reality intern advr inail [cb: 74435]? in the subject line. * further details available at below link. https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_677-2daugmented-2dreality-2dfellow-2din-2d&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=gmlwmjup9d8xlugur4trgiss1gd028ulepezurbuoxq&s=cmf3wkh-mpm_y51forvfyooq1ruzahqagsqx9pt1jfi&e= advanced-robotic-teleoperation best regards, ~ nikhil deshpande -------------------------------------------- researcher advanced robotics istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) via morego 30, genova, 16163, italia ph: (+39) 010 71781 805 fax: (+39) 010 71781 232 --------------------------------------------

subject: post-doc in 5g telesurgery at iit, genoa,  italy
content: the advanced robotics research line of istituto italiano di tecnologia is seeking a highly motivated, full-time post-doc in the area of teleoperation and medical robotics. ** description of the position ** the position is linked to ongoing projects in collaboration with large telecom companies developing and deploying 5g systems, including ericsson and vodafone. it will offer the opportunity to experiment with and contribute to the development of this new standard in telecommunications, and also to that of associated novel technologies that will benefit from it.  the focus of this position will be on developing and implementing solutions for teleoperation and telementoring over 5g in the context of robotic surgery. these applications offer vast possibilities for research, including in frameworks for safety-critical real-time teleoperation; novel interfaces for mobile telesurgery and telemedicine; remote surgical robot control and automation; and many other topics. the selected candidate will join a highly multidisciplinary research team and have the opportunity to collaborate closely with surgeons and the partner companies. the successful candidate will also have the possibility to contribute to the development of teleoperation systems for the new generation of mobile and remotely controlled robots of iit's department of advanced robotics, including quadrupeds and humanoids. the successful candidate will be offered a fixed-term contract (24 months) with a highly competitive salary commensurable with qualifications and experience. ** about the ideal candidate ** we are looking to appoint a skilled and enthusiastic researcher with experience in the design and implementation of systems for robot teleoperation. the candidate should possess a phd degree in engineering, computer science or related field and an excellent publication record. experience in one or more of the following areas will be considered a plus: telecommunication systems, user interfaces, smart mobile devices, robot-assisted surgery, control systems and automation. ** workplace ** genoa, italy ** application ** to apply, please send a detailed cv to leonardo.demattos at iit.it by april 15, 2018 stating the position title (post-doc in 5g telesurgery) in the subject of the e-mail. applications will be reviewed on a rolling basis. _______________________________   leonardo mattos, phd  head of biomedical robotics lab department of advanced robotics istituto italiano di tecnologia via morego, 30 - 16163 genova, italy phone:  +39.010.71781.409  fax: +39.010.71781.232 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__iit.it_people_leonardo-2ddemattos&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=f6dy8ptr9w0vjwmzfyjeen1jzkhzgo_bwttzc1-j0se&s=m6i8ecjt1-biz6zlthitvtcwvbaik6x9flvt1zxht-u&e= istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit), with its headquarters in genova, italy, is a non-profit institution with the primary goal of creating and disseminating scientific knowledge and strengthening italy's technological competitiveness. the institute offers state-of-the-art equipment and a top-level interdisciplinary research environment focused on robotics and computer vision, neuroscience, drug discovery, nanoscience and technology. in order to comply with italian law (art. 23 of privacy law of the italian legislative decree n. 196/03), the candidate is kindly asked to give his/her consent to allow iit to process his/her personal data. we inform you that the information you provide will be solely used for the purpose of assessing your professional profile to meet the requirements of istituto italiano di tecnologia. your data will be processed by istituto italiano di tecnologia, with its headquarters in genoa, via morego 30, acting as the data holder, using computer and paper-based means, observing the rules on the protection of personal data, including those relating to the security of data. please also note that, pursuant to art. 7 of legislative decree 196/2003, you may exercise your rights at any time as a party concerned by contacting the data manager. istituto italiano di tecnologia is an equal opportunity employer that actively seeks diversity in the workforce.

subject: fellow position in 5g telesurgery at  iit, genoa, italy
content: the advanced robotics research line of istituto italiano di tecnologia is seeking a highly motivated, full-time fellow in the area of teleoperation and medical robotics. ** description ** the position is linked to ongoing projects in collaboration with large telecom companies developing and deploying 5g systems, including ericsson and vodafone. it will offer the opportunity to experiment with and contribute to the development of this new standard in telecommunications, and also to that of associated novel technologies that will benefit from it.  the focus of this position will be on developing and implementing solutions for teleoperation and telementoring over 5g in the context of robotic surgery. specifically, the fellow will work on the design and implementation of mobile device applications for remote control of a surgical robot (telesurgery) and for real-time supervision of remote surgical procedures (telementoring).  the selected candidate will join a highly multidisciplinary research team and have the opportunity to collaborate closely with surgeons and the partner companies. the successful candidate will also have the possibility to contribute to the development of teleoperation systems for the new generation of mobile and remotely controlled robots of iit's department of advanced robotics, including quadrupeds and humanoids. the successful candidate will be offered a fixed-term contract (12 months). ** about the ideal candidate ** we are looking to appoint a skilled and enthusiastic person with experience in the design and implementation of software for smart devices. the candidate should possess a msc degree in engineering, computer science or related field. experience in one or more of the following areas will be considered a plus: telecommunication systems, user interfaces, teleoperation, robotics. ** workplace ** genoa, italy ** application ** to apply, please send a detailed cv to leonardo.demattos at subject: research internship opening on '3d  perception and learning for humanoid robot locomotion/manipulation' at the  italian institute of technology (iit), genoa in-reply-to: <ba32fa62ad974f5c8001d3bb06f64542@iit.it> references: <ba32fa62ad974f5c8001d3bb06f64542@iit.it>
content: fellow junior (research internship) opening on ?3d perception and learning for humanoid robot locomotion/manipulation? at the italian institute of technology (iit), genoa where: humanoids and human-centred mechatronics lab (hhcm), department of advanced robotics (advr) at the istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit), genoa, italy. starting date: as soon as possible; june-july 2018 (preferable) deadline: april 23, 2018 (a fcfs policy will be followed in the evaluation of the applications until a suitable candidate is appointed) duration: 4-5 months with potential follow up enrolment to continue for phd studies. potential topics (one should be selected):   -- "3d perception and learning for legged robot navigation: rough terrain locomotion (vision and path planning) using geometric and machine learning techniques"   -- "3d perception and (deep) learning for humanoid robot tool manipulation: detection, localization, and use" tutors: dr. dimitrios kanoulas, dr. nikos tsagarakis contacts: dimitrios.kanoulas at iit.it, nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it description: the humanoids and human centred mechatronics lab at the department of advanced robotics of the italian institute of technology (iit) (an english language institute, placed in genoa) is seeking a fully funded 4-5 months research intern (msc should have been completed), with a strong ambition to pursue a research career, to work on one of our eu-funded walk-man (walk-man.eu, video: youtu.be/kzzwvwzawme, video: youtu.be/7uectbjusci), cogimon (cogimon.eu), and/or centauro (centauro-project.eu) humanoid robots.   after fukushima daiichi nuclear disaster in 2011 the need of robots to deal with unstructured environments and replace humans in hazardous tasks became one of the main open problems in robotics. rapid advancements in actuation and control over the last few years enabled articulated legged robots to walk in uneven terrain and manipulate several objects. still, the problems of 1) foot placement in rough terrain for navigation and 2) tool manipulation and reasoning in uncertain setups using 3d perception, remain two of the main challenges in robotics and are the key aspects for completing several tasks in unknown environments.   the aim of this topic is to develop new geometric or machine learning (e.g. deep learning) methods for environment reconstruction and cognition that enable limbed robots, such as walk-man (walk-man.eu), centauro (centauro-project.eu) , or cogimon (cogimon.eu) to perform legged locomotion and manipulation in unstructured environments using 3d perception for foot-placement and hand/arm/wholebody-placement for path planning and mapping (slam). several exteroceptive (stereo/event/rgb cameras, rgb-d sensors, 2d/3d lidar scanners) sensors will be used on our limbed robots, to acquire rgb images and dense 3d point clouds. geometric simplifications for reasoning the contact between the robot's body (e.g., foot, hands, arms) and the environment will need to take place. moreover, path planning methods need to be developed to extract primitives for locomotion and manipulation. the development and testing will take place on our full-size humanoid/quadrupedal robots in real-world environments. requirements: 1. to be eligible, you must have recently (at most 6 months) completed a masters degree, or expect to complete soon. 2. this topic lies in the intersection of vision, learning, and robotics. a background in any of robotics, computer/robotic vision, path planning, robot learning is desirable. 3. ideal applicants should have strong c++ (python and matlab are a plus) programming skills. 4. machine learning and computer vision skills are required. 5. knowledge of the robot operating system (ros) and the point cloud library (pcl) is a very big plus. 6. the applicants should be fluent in english and team players. references: -- legged robot navigation    1. kanoulas et. al., "vision-based foothold contact reasoning using curved surface patches", humanoids 2017.    2. kanoulas et. al., "footstep planning in rough terrain for bipedal robots using curved contact patches", icra 2018. -- humanoid robot tool manipulation    1. kanoulas et. al. ?center-of-mass-based grasp pose adaptation using 3d range and force/torque sensing?, ijhr 2018.    2. nguyen et. al., "object-based affordances detection with convolutional neural networks and dense conditional random fields", iros 2017. application: the applicants should submit their cv electronically outlining experience and qualifications, a short statement (max 1 page) about the research areas of interest as well as the names of two referees to dimitrios.kanoulas at iit (cc-ed nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it), quoting [hhcm-internship] in the email subject (total email size should not exceed 1mb). best regards --   --   dimitrios kanoulas, ph.d.   postdoctoral researcher   humanoids and human-centred mechatronics lab (hhcm)   dept. of advanced robotics (advr)   istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit-genova)   via morego 30,genova 16163, italy   e-mail: dimitrios.kanoulas at iit.it   url: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__dkanou.github.io_&d=dwif-g&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=mf9cjq5bvy3qwmknvrql-rzonxse_r3kjdevvbf7uqk&s=o4o4u46clqpflwxesf8fje8_21o9zspab2df5mr0rbs&e=

subject: research engineers at the italian  institute of technology
content: the humanoid sensing and perception laboratory (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_research_lines_humanoid-2dsensing-2dand-2dperception&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=iby24gytpbjf0nv5insk-um6yogw_du7zid0100vk50&s=e_ic5a_kk_cq1znwu68gw250pra1uidq6nstqkgxsg0&e=) and the dynamic interaction control laboratory (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_research_lines_dynamic-2dinteraction-2dcontrol&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=iby24gytpbjf0nv5insk-um6yogw_du7zid0100vk50&s=71jamyyykiocqw40w09leozcv3epmzbyzmvq4h4sjhc&e=)  at italian institute of technology (iit) are looking for talented and enthusiastic robotics and software engineers to bring modern robot software technologies to the factory floor. the selected candidates will join the interdisciplinary team of the icub project ( https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_icub&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=iby24gytpbjf0nv5insk-um6yogw_du7zid0100vk50&s=x4n2xkib9gdozcxr0oaqr3nkeiyoplm3q-tjdu83u_g&e= ). they will contribute to the recently created joint laboratory between iit and danieli automation. danieli automation is a large international company active in the industry automation field. the iit-danieli joint laboratory will carry out research and development in the field of robotics and artificial intelligence applied to industrial  automation in hazardous environments. the goal of the joint laboratory is to reduce risks related to occupational health hazards and thereby increase safety for workers in the steel industry. the desirable skills are real-time system programming and/or robotics experience, but applications from recent graduates are welcome as well. the successful candidate will be offered a fixed term contract with a salary commensurate to experience and skills. to get more information and the application guidelines, please check the official job openings on iit's website: * subject: fellow position in legged robot design  at istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit)
content: fellow position in legged robot design - humanoid and human-centred mechatronics research line istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit), genoa, italy deadline: may 15th, 2018 ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- the humanoid and human centred mechatronics research line at istituto italiano di tecnologia(iit), an english-language research institute in genoa (italy), is currently one of the world leading research group in the design and development of novel robotic platforms, and is seeking to appoint a well-motivated fellow with a strong ambition to pursue a research careertowards the design (and control) of legged robots for real-world tasks. at the time of the application, the prospected candidate is about to receive a master's degree in engineering or computer science or has already received a corresponding master's degree not more than 6 months ago. due to unique potentiality of legged robots in locomoting over various terrains and operating in unstructured environments, development of such platforms has attracted increasing attention over the past few years. moreover, a variety of actuation units enhancing the system's energy efficiency and dynamic performance has been developed, on the basis of variable/fixed stiffness and damping units in series and/or parallel. yet, the performance and efficiency of floating based platforms is subject to additional criteria that are often omitted; thereby preventing long-time performance required for real-world applications. this research topic will focus on the limb/structure design aspects when adopting state-of-the-art robotics actuation and transmission systems, and utilising energy recycling techniques and bio-inspired control principles. the outcome of this study will be a novel legged robot performing energy efficient dynamic motions such as jumping. the selected applicant of this position will join an interdisciplinary research group and have the opportunity to pursue research within the h2020 cogimon project, funded by the european commission under the grant agreement n. 644727. requirements: the successful applicant for this area is expected to have a background in mechanical/mechatronic/electrical engineering, physical sciences or robotics. candidates should have competencies in mechanical design and understanding of robot dynamics/kinematics and control. application documents: interested applicants, meeting the requirements outlined above, must submit their application including: - a cover letter - a cv outlining experience and qualifications - names of at least two referees the application documents must be submitted via email to dr. navvab kashiri (navvab.kashiri at iit.it) before may 15, 2018. make sure your application is considered by quoting "legged robot design fellow position 75186" in the email subject. international applications are encouraged. for further information please contact: dr. navvab kashiri (navvab.kashiri at iit.it) link: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__iit.it_careers_openings_opening_704-2dfellow-2dposition-2din-2dlegged-2drobot-2ddesign-2dhumanoid-2dand-2dhuman-2dcentred-2dmechatronics-2dresearch-2dline&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=x1bo-bodxeglnqskzshlohbhwlcp_xt22igfm05fuv8&s=ucz6ubl_2p1sica2nxylnoeypotiycikulaaegolaz0&e= -------------------------------------------- navvab kashiri (b.sc.eng., m.sc.eng., ph.d.) senior post-doctoral researcher istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) department of advanced robotics humanoids & human centred mechatronics lab phone: +39 010 71781 582
