subject: postdoctoral position in advanced  industrial automation - [ postdoc ]
content: [jobs] postdoctoral position in advanced industrial automation - [ postdoc ] workplace: genova, iit added on: 12/02/2018 - expires on: 20/04/2018 the advanced robotics research line at istituto italiano di tecnologia, an english-language research institute, is seeking a highly motivated, full-time post-doc, who will have a leading research role in advanced robotics and industrial automation. the selected candidate will join an interdisciplinary team and have the opportunity to pursue research within industrial projects. please apply to: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_656-2dpostdoctoral-2dposition-2din-2dadvanced-2dindustrial-2dautomation&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=p9ith4inwj6gia2-km7lhk5-4tlcnnvz1w7r6xfen1k&s=xbtcrj0zjohlrea4o6mq95gqkk7xpdkmz5qqr1inmn8&e= best wishes, giovanni giovanni gerardo muscolo (ph.d., msc. applied mechanics, machine desing, robotics) postdoctoral research fellow advanced industrial automation lab - advanced robotics research line (advr) - italian institute of technology (iit) - via morego, 30 16163 genova (italy) phone (office): +39 010 71781 347 email: giovanni.muscolo at iit.it web: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_giovanni-2dmuscolo&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=p9ith4inwj6gia2-km7lhk5-4tlcnnvz1w7r6xfen1k&s=gvdp407hs6y_flzbuplqlicvdjr7mdywxqtvqgiedgy&e=

subject: research internship opening on "3d  perception and learning for humanoid robot locomotion/manipulation" at the  italian institute of technology (iit), genoa in-reply-to: <45b5e8bf547a4ff4b54a6d1171e27535@iit.it> references: <ba32fa62ad974f5c8001d3bb06f64542@iit.it>,  <45b5e8bf547a4ff4b54a6d1171e27535@iit.it>
content: fellow junior (research internship) opening on "3d perception and learning for humanoid robot locomotion/manipulation" at the italian institute of technology (iit), genoa where: humanoids and human-centred mechatronics lab (hhcm), department of advanced robotics (advr) at the istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit), genoa, italy. starting date: as soon as possible; june-july 2018 (preferable) deadline: april 23, 2018 (a fcfs policy will be followed in the evaluation of the applications until a suitable candidate is appointed) duration: 4-5 months with potential follow up enrollment to continue for phd studies. potential topics (one should be selected):   -- "3d perception and learning for legged robot navigation: rough terrain locomotion (vision and path planning) using geometric and machine learning techniques"   -- "3d perception and (deep) learning for humanoid robot tool manipulation: detection, localization, and use" tutors: dr. dimitrios kanoulas, dr. nikos tsagarakis contacts: dimitrios.kanoulas at iit.it, nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it description: the humanoids and human centred mechatronics lab at the department of advanced robotics of the italian institute of technology (iit) (an english language institute, placed in genoa) is seeking a fully funded 4-5 months research intern (msc should have been completed), with a strong ambition to pursue a research career, to work on one of our eu-funded walk-man (walk-man.eu, video: youtu.be/kzzwvwzawme, video: youtu.be/7uectbjusci), cogimon (cogimon.eu), and/or centauro (centauro-project.eu) humanoid robots.   after fukushima daiichi nuclear disaster in 2011 the need of robots to deal with unstructured environments and replace humans in hazardous tasks became one of the main open problems in robotics. rapid advancements in actuation and control over the last few years enabled articulated legged robots to walk in uneven terrain and manipulate several objects. still, the problems of 1) foot placement in rough terrain for navigation and 2) tool manipulation and reasoning in uncertain setups using 3d perception, remain two of the main challenges in robotics and are the key aspects for completing several tasks in unknown environments.   the aim of this topic is to develop new geometric or machine learning (e.g. deep learning) methods for environment reconstruction and cognition that enable limbed robots, such as walk-man (walk-man.eu), centauro (centauro-project.eu) , or cogimon (cogimon.eu) to perform legged locomotion and manipulation in unstructured environments using 3d perception for foot-placement and hand/arm/wholebody-placement for path planning and mapping (slam). several exteroceptive (stereo/event/rgb cameras, rgb-d sensors, 2d/3d lidar scanners) sensors will be used on our limbed robots, to acquire rgb images and dense 3d point clouds. geometric simplifications for reasoning the contact between the robot's body (e.g., foot, hands, arms) and the environment will need to take place. moreover, path planning methods need to be developed to extract primitives for locomotion and manipulation. the development and testing will take place on our full-size humanoid/quadrupedal robots in real-world environments. requirements: 1. to be eligible, you must have recently (at most 6 months) completed a masters degree, or expect to complete soon. 2. this topic lies in the intersection of vision, learning, and robotics. a background in any of robotics, computer/robotic vision, path planning, robot learning is desirable. 3. ideal applicants should have strong c++ (python and matlab are a plus) programming skills. 4. machine learning and computer vision skills are required. 5. knowledge of the robot operating system (ros) and the point cloud library (pcl) is a very big plus. 6. the applicants should be fluent in english and team players. references: -- legged robot navigation    1. kanoulas et. al., "vision-based foothold contact reasoning using curved surface patches", humanoids 2017.    2. kanoulas et. al., "footstep planning in rough terrain for bipedal robots using curved contact patches", icra 2018. -- humanoid robot tool manipulation    1. kanoulas et. al. "center-of-mass-based grasp pose adaptation using 3d range and force/torque sensing", ijhr 2018.    2. nguyen et. al., "object-based affordances detection with convolutional neural networks and dense conditional random fields", iros 2017. application: the applicants should submit their cv electronically outlining experience and qualifications, a short statement (max 1 page) about the research areas of interest as well as the names of two referees to dimitrios.kanoulas at iit (cc-ed nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it), quoting [hhcm-internship] in the email subject (total email size should not exceed 1mb). best regards --   --   dimitrios kanoulas, ph.d.   postdoctoral researcher   humanoids and human-centred mechatronics lab (hhcm)   dept. of advanced robotics (advr)   istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit-genova)   via morego 30,genova 16163, italy   e-mail: dimitrios.kanoulas at iit.it   url: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__dkanou.github.io_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=yaikleujs-bjdbyzyks9nil8rbpebwl62xqhx77v9qo&s=v-uxqouuetwj3ciz-x3o1aquqizaoffc2xf1fxm-rm4&e=

subject: post-doctoral position perception and  machine learning for manipulation
content: the humanoid sensing and perception research line (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_research_lines_humanoid-2dsensing-2dand-2dperception&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=4q_tmhyoevmsxealo-5iagtx5z7z4jdwrbl3-mcwtmi&s=ucmilnadimozgcx1gom0vh10epmtnd0zke9oigfuf9s&e=) at the istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) is seeking to appoint a post doc on perception and machine learning for manipulation. the selected candidate will join the interdisciplinary team of the icub project and will contribute to the implementation of perception and manipulation skills of humanoid robots. we are looking for a talented and enthusiastic post-doctoral researcher who will join our team to study machine-learning algorithms to advance the capabilities of humanoid robots to interact with the environment, grasping and manipulating objects. the focus is on strategies that allow autonomous learning, and incremental machine learning techniques for dynamically adapting to novel situations. topics include: * perception of affordances; * scene segmentation; * robot self-perception for visual control of manipulation; * data-driven approaches to object grasping. the ideal candidate will have a phd in a relevant field (e.g. robotics or machine learning) and the following skills: * proven experience working with real robotic systems; * knowledge of deep learning frameworks; * strong knowledge of programming languages, i.e. c/c++; * knowledge of robotic middleware like ros and yarp. the successful candidate will be offered a salary commensurate to experience and skills. the positon is available starting june 2018. please submit your application, including a detailed cv, a research statement, and the contact information of two references, e to applications at iit.it quoting exactly ""bc 75221 - jp11 - post doc on perception and machine learning for manipulation" in the e-mail subject. the text of the call and instructions for applicants are available online: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_713-2dpost-2ddoc-2dposition-2don-2dperception-2dand-2dmachine-2dlearning-2dfor-2dmanipulation&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=4q_tmhyoevmsxealo-5iagtx5z7z4jdwrbl3-mcwtmi&s=o1ss2fxcd107xcejsnvvks8hy0wihiguxq8ygoencq4&e=  -- istituto italiano di tecnologia lorenzo natale, phd lorenzo.natale at iit.it via morego, 30 16163 genova ph: +39 010 71781946 fax: +39 010 7170205 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__lornat75.github.io&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=4q_tmhyoevmsxealo-5iagtx5z7z4jdwrbl3-mcwtmi&s=zsyzkp2msgfnkejhszc5tjxgqgrzws2q0xfvymz0wm4&e= www.iit.it

subject: deep learning computer vision software  engineer
content: the humanoid sensing and perception laboratory (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_research_lines_humanoid-2dsensing-2dand-2dperception&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=xw-dxdkmnfhbj3yuzqgc2dw6prakrtr6vnhasx5olgu&s=z2cahoplizp4wch_fb3r8ja__w8r94d6n8itgt1gc_4&e=) at istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) is seeking to appoint a deep learning computer vision software engineer (fixed term contract). the selected candidate will join the interdisciplinary team of the icub project, contributing to the development of perception algorithms for humanoid robots. we are looking for a talented and enthusiastic software engineer who will join our team to develop deep learning algorithms for object recognition and pose estimation. required qualifications: * bachelor's and/or master's degree in computer science, computer engineering or related fields; * knowledge of programming languages, in particular c/c++; * knowledge of tools for software development in linux and/or windows; * good communication skills and ability to cooperate; * creative, proactive and collaborative attitude; * proficient in english language (written and oral). desirable skills: * knowledge of computer vision and opencv library; * knowledge of deep-learning frameworks (e.g. caffe, torch, tensorflow, thano); * knowledge of basic machine learning; * knowledge of high performance/parallel computing (e.g. cuda); * knowledge of middleware for robotics (e.g. yarp or ros); the successful candidate will be offered a salary commensurate to experience and skills. the position is available starting june 2018. instructions for applicants and the text of the call are available online: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_712-2ddeep-2dlearning-2dcomputer-2dvision-2dsoftware-2dengineer&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=xw-dxdkmnfhbj3yuzqgc2dw6prakrtr6vnhasx5olgu&s=jboxthedennj1k4wp8xxz_fscw--jaut2iftwqn25qa&e=  -- istituto italiano di tecnologia lorenzo natale, phd lorenzo.natale at iit.it via morego, 30 16163 genova ph: +39 010 71781946 fax: +39 010 7170205 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__lornat75.github.io&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=xw-dxdkmnfhbj3yuzqgc2dw6prakrtr6vnhasx5olgu&s=w_a1dv2-ssj87xhvmwjghq8fmv7qtcdvt1enlk5z7ou&e= www.iit.it

subject: post doc position for software  engineering for mobile manipulation
content: we are looking for a highly motivated postdoctoral candidate with expertise in software engineering and robotics, to study formalisms and tools for the development of reactive robot behaviours for mobile manipulation with safety constraints. the successful candidate will have the opportunity to work in an exciting and young environment, in close interaction with research technicians, phd students and post-doctoral researchers in the icub facility department. this project will be executed within the humanoid sensing and perception group (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iit.it_humanoid-2dsensing-2dand-2dperception&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=cbyvxai-0eagtbsz7onaoi4_vdqsq5-8_e5oyzx3d40&s=zrgaiwkxzwf35hhodim2kirjtzwhycvuw_rnp74wkng&e=) within the icub facility department (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iit.it_icub&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=cbyvxai-0eagtbsz7onaoi4_vdqsq5-8_e5oyzx3d40&s=2vnenu9p5x5ajslcy_z6klp3zxloexfcumywdjs4nca&e=). this position is supported by the project carve, which is funded by the horizon 2020 eu project robmosys grant agreement 732410 through its first open call. robmosys envisions an industry-grade component development and integration ecosystem able to support the expectations of evolving robotics technology and applications. carve will extend the robmosys ecosytem coverage by providing behavior developers an agile formalism for describing robot behaviors that are simpler to understand, maintain and adapt to different application domains, fostering the creation of a "behavior market" that will complement the "component" market envisaged in robmosys. carve will make a step change towards the realization of certifiable, autonomous systems. this will further support the adoption of model driven software engineering in robotics, reducing debugging time, development cost, and time-to-market of robotic applications. carve will consider an assistive robotic scenario to be implemented with the r1 humanoid robot. the ideal candidate will have a phd in robotics or equivalent and the following skills: * software engineering * experience with mobile manipulation and navigation * strong knowledge of the c++ language * knowledge of robotic middleware like ros or yarp an internationally competitive salary, dependent on experience, will be offered. interested candidates should send their application to applications at iit.it emailing their cv, a list of publications, and names of 2 referees (possibly 1 reference letter). please set the subject of your e-mail exactly as: "bc 75087 - postdoc carve". instructions for applicants and the text of the call are available online: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_680-2d1-2dpost-2ddoc-2dposition-2dfor-2dsoftware-2dengineering-2dfor-2dmobile-2dmanipulation-2din-2dthe-2dhumanoid-2dsensing-2dand-2dperception-2dresearch-2dline-2dwithin-2dthe-2dicub-2dfacility&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=cbyvxai-0eagtbsz7onaoi4_vdqsq5-8_e5oyzx3d40&s=1_xi5o7jiztti3mbis9jnuzw2jdqewvr2ogydhhwqwu&e= -- istituto italiano di tecnologia lorenzo natale, phd lorenzo.natale at iit.it via morego, 30 16163 genova ph: +39 010 71781946 fax: +39 010 7170205 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__lornat75.github.io&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=cbyvxai-0eagtbsz7onaoi4_vdqsq5-8_e5oyzx3d40&s=peigmyoq488ss6hzhcfje044xxx1ug-dxu8kah-en_o&e= www.iit.it

subject: phd positions at the university of  genova
content: *phd positions at the university of genova*   the department of computer science and engineering, bioengineering and robotics (dibris) of the universita? di genova (italy) jointly with the italian institute of technology (iit) offers phd positions and scholarships for students applying for research activities in the following domains (curricula):   ?         bioengineering and bioelectronics  ?         robotics and autonomous systems ?         advanced and humanoid robotics (funded by iit) ?         bionanotechnology (funded by iit) ?         cognitive sciences, interactive and rehabilitation technologies (funded by iit)   for further details on the research topics please check here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__phd.dibris.unige.it_biorob_index.php_how-2dto-2dapply&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=vkgbnkgizdm9m3l-9dx1duci19xxnxd1py0k3mzrjg8&s=hjillnmdoz7d4edqpbukbyslqy1ebiilg1cefkjisnk&e=     *general informations*   the phd has a duration of three years and the scholarship amounts to 16,500.00 ?/year. phd students will also have a personal allowance of 1,650 ?/year for travels and research activities.   the call for phd positions is *now open*. the complete text of the call can be found on the web site of the universita? di genova: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.studenti.unige.it_postlaurea_dottorati_xxxiv_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=vkgbnkgizdm9m3l-9dx1duci19xxnxd1py0k3mzrjg8&s=mppawxusqt-isr27ci6yjuqo0dnx1whd1z6dm588oko&e=   the deadline for the applications is *june 12th, 2018 (12:00 a.m. cet)*   further details about the phd programs at dibris are also available  on the doctorate web page:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.dibris.unige.it_dottorati&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=vkgbnkgizdm9m3l-9dx1duci19xxnxd1py0k3mzrjg8&s=vgc5vux-i65z5nsj5fvpqecia6a2d9lp6swaaxwy2f4&e=       for specific questions related to the various curricula please refer to:   ? subject: phd positions in robotics available at  the university of genova
content: *phd positions in *robotics* available at the university of genova*   the department of computer science and engineering, bioengineering and robotics (dibris) of the universita? di genova (italy) offers 3 phd scholarships for students applying for research activities in the area of *robotics and autonomous systems*.   we are looking for highly talented, motivated and skilled candidates to work on one of the following research topics:   1. approximate methods for active identification  2. goal-based cooperation and reasoning models for heterogeneous robot swarms made-up of terrestrial and aerial robots 3. sensor based control of bi-manual robots for human-robot cooperative operations  4. tactile sensing technologies and perception  5. culture-aware robots and environmental sensor systems for elderly support  6. surface and underwater deployment and docking systems for underwater autonomous vehicles  7. robots in the warehouse: methods and technologies for the next-generation warehouse logistics    for further details on the research topics please check here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__phd.dibris.unige.it_biorob_media_phd-2520themes-252034o-2520-2d-2520robotics-2520and-2520autonomous-2520systems-2520-282018-29.pdf&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=yqloqx0pvu-auc4zc5qwj6t73ncxtelpam8ywael8hk&s=-imbe_ln-pqbfxukqbhjsyxko-vmsheigxpdxkvq0j0&e= or https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__phd.dibris.unige.it_biorob_index.php_how-2dto-2dapply&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=yqloqx0pvu-auc4zc5qwj6t73ncxtelpam8ywael8hk&s=kc9dk7ahosmr0-xhw8lc3ldo4ymggslblyyfewecbks&e= personal allowance of 1,650 ?/year for travels and research activities.   the call for phd positions is *now open*. the complete text of the call can be found on the web site of the universita? di genova: subject: phd positions at the humanoid sensing  and perception lab, istituto italiano di tecnologia
content: new phd positions (with scholarship) are available in the humanoid sensing and perception laboratory, icub facility, istituto italiano di tecnologia.  the positions are available through the phd course of bioengineering and robotics, curriculum on advanced and humanoid robotics. prospective candidates are invited to get in touch with lorenzo natale (name.surname at iit.it) for further details. themes titles (see below for details): * multimodal object exploration and grasping * perception and machine learning for manipulation * vision for walking robots more information on the themes, links to the call and application instructions can be found here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__lornat75.github.io_phd-2dcalls-2d2018.html&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=nireconqyet62hwsqo1teap2ovcttreudppdiwdnz2k&s=v-7hpzmwglhu7y8z-exltlxv8turb36b8x66irn7ah8&e= online application available from april 19, 2018 at 10.00 a.m. (italian time) to june 12th, 2018 at 12.00 noon (italian time) -- istituto italiano di tecnologia lorenzo natale, phd lorenzo.natale at iit.it via morego, 30 16163 genova ph: +39 010 71781946 fax: +39 010 7170205 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__lornat75.github.io&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=nireconqyet62hwsqo1teap2ovcttreudppdiwdnz2k&s=momm2mppq5a5fymqaptnxvjrilsfsw3izqylvnnm_im&e= www.iit.it

subject: phd openings at iit genoa's hyq robot  project (motion control and planning)
content: -------------------------------------------------------------------------- 2 phd positions at iit in hydraulic robot motion control and planning -------------------------------------------------------------------------- the dynamic legged systems lab at the istituto italiano di tecnologia  (iit), an english language institute, is seeking to appoint 2  outstanding, highly-motivated phd students who will be involved in the  *hyq project* that aims to develop *versatile all-terrain legged  robots*. the positions are fully funded, start in november 2018 and  typically last 3 years. for more details on the topics and submission, visit https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__dls.iit.it_open-2dpositions_bsc-2dmsc-2dphd&d=dwicaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hupghhyvzfij5hdlyprstte7mlrad_g8udbmouqivk4&s=xwyvvfbn8-3mt-paiohfafyod3swqdn-_be_blvu95i&e= the hydraulic quadruped hyq and its successors are unique research  platforms. they are fully torque controlled hydraulic quadruped robots  equipped with inertial measurement units, laser range finders and stereo  cameras. since 2011 hyq has demonstrated a wide range of static and  dynamic motions such as a crawl gait, walking trot over flat, inclined  and rough terrain (indoors and outdoors), squat jumps, rearing,  balancing under disturbances and step reflexes: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.youtube.com_user_hydraulicquadruped&d=dwicaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hupghhyvzfij5hdlyprstte7mlrad_g8udbmouqivk4&s=yr3rnkpgxftkambc1plyyotswkmxi00yw8qi_w4gbba&e= -for more information: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__dls.iit.it&d=dwicaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hupghhyvzfij5hdlyprstte7mlrad_g8udbmouqivk4&s=aufeq9qgtd6rvfftgmytzpw71rlrlo9pbhapjcfjnxg&e= -for news visit our facebook page: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.facebook.com_iitdlslab_&d=dwicaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hupghhyvzfij5hdlyprstte7mlrad_g8udbmouqivk4&s=py7vyk6toelk4zhx8tfdli0qjykts37peh7-inxxdee&e= -or meet me during icra 2018 in brisbane (please send me an email to  arrange a meeting). open phd themes: *theme 18:*	hydraulic quadruped robots with arms: multi-contact  optimization for cluttered environments tutors: michele focchi, claudio semini *theme 19:* hydraulic quadruped robots: recovery strategies for dynamic  locomotion on irregular surfaces tutors: michele focchi, victor barasuol, claudio semini for a detailed description of the themes and instructions on how to  apply, visit: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__dls.iit.it_open-2dpositions_bsc-2dmsc-2dphd&d=dwicaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hupghhyvzfij5hdlyprstte7mlrad_g8udbmouqivk4&s=xwyvvfbn8-3mt-paiohfafyod3swqdn-_be_blvu95i&e= the application deadline is strictly june 12th, 2018 (noon, cest italian  time). start the process a few days before the deadline. best regards, claudio --  claudio semini, phd head of dynamic legged systems lab istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) advanced robotics department via morego 30, 16163 genoa, italy phone: +39 010 71781 912 email: claudio.semini at iit.it web: www.semini.ch or www.iit.it/people/claudio-semini

subject: fully-funded phd positions for legged  robot control: iit, genoa, italy
content: **************************************************************** call for fully funded phd positions for legged robot control advanced robotics(advr), istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit)  **************************************************************** there are several fully funded phd positions, jointly offered by the university of genoa and istituto italiano di tecnologia (italian institute of technology, iit). i am particularly seeking highly motivated applicants to the following two subjects (theme 8 and theme 11): * theme 8. legged robot control: whole-body falling-over recovery control for humanoids     - whole-body sensing algorithm using proprioceptive sensors (e.g., joint torque sensors, encoders and imu) and exteroception (e.g., force-torque sensors and stereo vision), and   - motion planning and control for recovering action of the entire body using robust dynamic control schemes. * theme 11. robot interaction control: whole-body multiple contact physical interaction control of a hybrid legged/wheeled robot platform    - dynamic whole-body control strategy of hybrid robotic platform to guarantee agile responses and high dexterity to cope with multi contacts of dual arm and four legs and the high kinematic redundancy. *********************************************** iit (in genova, italy) is an english language institute; international applications are encouraged and will receive support with visa issues, etc. the advanced robotics (advr) research line offers state-of-the-art robot platforms and a top-level interdisciplinary research environment focused on robotics.  the successful applicant will be fully funded for three years phd course on the focused research theme.  *********************************************** application should be submitted to:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.studenti.unige.it_postlaurea_dottorati_xxxiv_en_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=2vbznoyd3je48kgw0ijfiovml_trsjzbzuydreimtxw&s=sqqxaizzkyhyeh3ihbc37kxkqruchmfndxeiref1woo&e=   due date: june 12th, 2018 at 12.00 noon (italian time) full list of themes is found in research theme "advanced and humanoid robotics" in the following link: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_phd-2dschool_phd-2dschool-2dgenoa&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=2vbznoyd3je48kgw0ijfiovml_trsjzbzuydreimtxw&s=-r2yxw4jvrxbyo26aqdvakyzck_fipbaufz_knie0am&e=      *********************************************** for any inquiries, please contact: jinoh lee (jinoh.lee at iit.it) and nikos tsagarakis (nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it) best regards, jinoh. _______________________________ researcher, humanoid & human-centered mechatronics lab.,  advanced robotics department,  fondazione istituto italiano di tecnologia(iit),  via morego 30, genoa, 16163, italy https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iit.it_people_jinoh-2dlee&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=2vbznoyd3je48kgw0ijfiovml_trsjzbzuydreimtxw&s=kc4nv8uebtohnoo43u-aro2y4r2nnie6nlxuqy_qnhq&e=

subject: 3 phd positions in "motor learning and  rehabilitation robotics" with scholarship at iit in-reply-to: <capx2ug+mhd0tfxdvvv+retv+8phun49fvcmj_dwvstwyvokrkq@mail.gmail.com> references: <capx2ug+1mvomhdtuertbs4fsub1kh3stqaia-3wbiybczxsorg@mail.gmail.com>  <capx2ug+mhd0tfxdvvv+retv+8phun49fvcmj_dwvstwyvokrkq@mail.gmail.com>
content: 3 phd positions in "motor learning and rehabilitation robotics" with scholarship starting from november 2018 at the robotics, brain and cognitive sciences department, istituto italiano di tecnologia, https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iit.it_rbcs&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=9tvv5h5fn3mjqawbzm6tyisf7-m6iuwxqw6v8margai&s=mxxfcl2tuwreogh5s9zblhx0fgyevqberfuxj-5nddm&e= * official call: phd program in bioengineering and robotics. curriculum on cognitive robotics, interaction and rehabilitation technologies: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__phd.dibris.unige.it_biorob_index.php_how-2dto-2dapply&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=9tvv5h5fn3mjqawbzm6tyisf7-m6iuwxqw6v8margai&s=z5kkqxr3wcq_pobqn-ojwczj3pvqxnybguejjx6wzb0&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__phd.dibris.unige.it_biorob_index.php_how-2dto-2dapply&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=9tvv5h5fn3mjqawbzm6tyisf7-m6iuwxqw6v8margai&s=z5kkqxr3wcq_pobqn-ojwczj3pvqxnybguejjx6wzb0&e=> https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_phd-2dschool&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=9tvv5h5fn3mjqawbzm6tyisf7-m6iuwxqw6v8margai&s=tkbyrjsmqbzni18vqwzqowzn4rdb7hrqjz6itzlm470&e= * application *must* be done online before june 12, 2018. * applicants are strongly encouraged to contact: jacopo zenzeri <jacopo .zenzeri_(at)_iit.it> *theme 1: robotic assessment and training to speed up sensorimotor skill recovery* *tutor**:* dr. jacopo zenzeri, prof. pietro morasso *research unit:* robotics, brain and cognitive sciences ( https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_rbcs&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=9tvv5h5fn3mjqawbzm6tyisf7-m6iuwxqw6v8margai&s=wkvdemesyn2c2inh7pcxl6bxxytiooqgzm4gbmlzgmc&e=) *division:* motor learning, assistive and rehabilitation robotics *description:* a great majority of neurological patients present both motor dysfunctions and impairments in kinesthesia, but traditional robot and virtual reality training techniques focus either in recovering motor functions or in assessing proprioceptive deficits. the open challenge is to implement effective and reliable assessment and training protocols for  sensorimotor recovery that exploit the interaction capabilities of the robots. in order to do it the mechanisms underlying sensorimotor deficits have to be studied from a computational point of view and translated into control algorithms in rehabilitation robots. the research will involve experiments with human subjects (children and adults - healthy and impaired) using haptic interfaces, analysis of movements and their neural correlates (using emg, eeg, tms). the knowledge gained from the experiments will be also used to design more effective haptic systems to be delivered directly to clinicians. this will imply a real push of the prototypes improved during the research period toward products and the concrete transfer of them in the clinical environment. the clinical experimental activities will be carried out inside major hospitals where iit has formalized collaborations. *requirements:* a master degree in bioengineering, computer science or equivalent, with experience in the analysis and modeling of human movements and in robot programming. attitude for experimental work, problem solving and computational modeling will constitute factors of preference. *references:* 1. de santis d, zenzeri j, casadio m, masia l, riva a, morasso p and squeri v (2015) robot-assisted training of the kinesthetic sense: enhancing proprioception after stroke. front. hum. neurosci. 8:1037, doi: 10.3389/fnhum.2014.01037 2. squeri v, masia l, giannoni p, sandini g, morasso p (2014) wrist rehabilitation in chronic stroke patients by means of adaptive, progressive robot aided therapy. ieee trans. neural systems and rehab engineering, 22(2): 1-14, doi:10.1109/tnsre.2013.2250521 *theme 2: optimizing haptic interaction for vocational training* *tutor:* dr. jacopo zenzeri, prof. pietro morasso *research unit:* robotics, brain and cognitive sciences ( https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_rbcs&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=9tvv5h5fn3mjqawbzm6tyisf7-m6iuwxqw6v8margai&s=wkvdemesyn2c2inh7pcxl6bxxytiooqgzm4gbmlzgmc&e=) *division:* motor learning, assistive and rehabilitation robotics *description:* in the last decade there has been a growing interest in studying physical coupling between humans or humans and machines. indeed, developing a machine capable of understanding the intention of a movement and interactively cooperate with a human is among the frontiers of the research in robotics as well as rehabilitation and vocational training. in the last cited field the focus is on the motor skill transfer from an expert human agent to a na?ve one in a dyadic configuration [1]. the main idea behind the phd project is to pass from a dyadic configuration to a triadic one where two human exchange haptic information mediated by a robot that play an active role. the objective of the robot is to convey and shape the haptic information coming from the expert human to the na?ve one maximizing the learning process [2]. the research will involve experiments with human subjects (healthy and impaired) using haptic interfaces, mathematical modeling of human control strategies and design of more effective robots able to effectively transfer skills. *requirements:* a master degree in bioengineering, computer science or equivalent, with experience in the analysis and modeling of human movements and in robot programming. attitude for experimental work, problem solving and computational modeling will constitute factors of preference. *references:* 1. avila-mireles, e.j. et al., 2017. skill learning and skill transfer mediated by cooperative haptic interaction. ieee transactions on neural systems and rehabilitation engineering, 25(7), pp.832?243. 2. galofaro, e., morasso, p. & zenzeri, j., 2017. improving motor skill transfer during dyadic robot training through the modulation of the expert role. in ieee international conference on rehabilitation robotics. london. *theme 4: transferring of human-robot interaction competencies: towards robot symbiosis in the acquisition of new skills* *tutor:* jacopo zenzeri, phd; alessandra sciutti, phd; francesco rea, phd *research unit:* robotics, brain and cognitive sciences ( https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_rbcs&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=9tvv5h5fn3mjqawbzm6tyisf7-m6iuwxqw6v8margai&s=wkvdemesyn2c2inh7pcxl6bxxytiooqgzm4gbmlzgmc&e=) *division:* motor learning, assistive and rehabilitation robotics & cognitive robotics and human-human interaction *description:* in the recent years many studies focused on how to optimize human-robot collaboration tasks. here we focus on a fundamental case where a human agent has to  learn how to use a tool while collaborating with an expert humanoid robot agent which, in this case, plays the active role of maximizing the learning of the human. in this new  perspective the process will proceed in two steps: 1) the humanoid robot acquire the knowledge of the collaborative tasks and becomes the ?robot teacher? by interacting (through the tool) with an expert human; 2) the na?ve human interact (through the tool) with the ?robot teacher? in order to learn the task in an optimal way. behavioral  experiments on motor learning will be conducted using haptic interfaces to study motor control mechanisms and how motor control strategies emerge during the interaction with specific set of tools. this activity is based on recent studies on dyadic interaction [1-2] and will contribute to define human inspired models of interaction. the model is transferred to the humanoid agent to acquire the human expert knowledge (in step 1) and to teach it to the na?ve one (in step 2). behavioral experiments will then be conducted with the humanoid robot icub to implement real use cases. in this context, the proactive role of the icub will enrich existing cognitive framework for human robot interaction. the  candidate will also exploit measure of engagement in the task (attentional level, cognitive load and fatigue). *requirements:* a master degree in bioengineering, computer science or equivalent, with experience in the analysis and modeling of human movements and in robot programming. *references:* 1. avila-mireles, e.j. et al., 2017. skill learning and skill transfer mediated by cooperative haptic interaction. ieee transactions on neural systems and rehabilitation  engineering, 25(7), pp.832?243. 2. galofaro, e., morasso, p. & zenzeri, j., 2017. improving motor skill transfer during dyadic robot training through the modulation of the expert role. in ieee international  conference on rehabilitation robotics. london. 3. vignolo a., noceti n., rea f., sciutti a., odone f. & sandini g. 2017, ?detecting biological motion for human-robot interaction: a link between perception and action?,  frontiers in robotics and ai, 4. jacopo zenzeri, phd head of motor learning, assistive and rehabilitation robotics lab robotics, brain and cognitive sciences department center for human technologies istituto italiano di tecnologia, genova, italy

subject: postdoc position available @ prisma lab
content: the prisma lab at the university of naples federico ii is seeking to  recruit senior postdoctoral research fellows that will have a key  research role in the following area: visual servoing and automatic  control especially focused on aerial and mobile robots. the successful  candidates will conduct their research at the prisma lab on the european  research project hyfliers on the following themes: autonomous landing of  vtol vehicles on pipes in a refinery; autonomous navigation of pipes  with hybrid drones with omnidirectional, articulated wheels;  visual-force control of an hyper-redundant cable-driven robot arm. hyfliers (hybrid flying-rolling with-snake-arm robot for contact  inspection - www.hyfliers.eu <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.hyfliers.eu&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=lnajj-at-fny8z2xp77nb9kmyc5tnuk7gu5ry6u4ky8&s=7hrsak_mm5hies6vlf1cn_9dpw68qjknurpctx8lxpe&e=>) is a research and  innovation action of eu horizon 2020 programme for advanced robot  capabilities research and take-up, worth 3,9 million euro funding.  hyfliers, running from 2018 to 2021, will develop the world's first  industrial integrated robot with hybrid air and ground mobility with a  long-reach hyper-redundant manipulator capable of reaching sites where  no other robot can access, reducing the exposition of human inspectors  to potentially dangerous working conditions. targeting ultrasonic  thickness measurements for oil and gas refineries and chemical plants,  the results could be applied to many other robotic inspection technologies. we are looking for highly-motivated young scientists with a background  and phd in automatic control and/or robotics, preferably with at least  two years of experience abroad, and a well-established publication  record among these respective areas:  ? - visual servoing  ? - modeling and control of uav/mobile robots  ? - piecewise-smooth, hybrid and impacting dynamic systems strong competencies in c/c++/ros programming and matlab are essential. qualified potential applicants holding a phd degree should provide the  following material:  ???? 1) cover letter briefly describing their background and career plans  ???? 2) cv  ???? 3) link to their research web-site  ???? 4) list of publications  ???? 5) date of availability  ???? 6) names and contact information of at least two references all documents should be submitted via email as a single compressed/pdf  file to prof. bruno siciliano siciliano at unina.it  <mailto:siciliano at unina.it>with the subject: postdoc candidate (hyfliers) *about prisma lab* university of naples federico ii is the third oldest university in italy  and the oldest public university in europe. the school of engineering,  with a population of 11,000 students, is the oldest in italy and  recently celebrated its second centennial since the foundation by king  gioacchino murat in 1811. the prisma team operates in the department of  electrical engineering and information technology, where since almost 30  years is conducting research in robotics. current interests include  force control, visual servoing, dual-arm/hand manipulation, human-robot  interaction, aerial robotics and surgical robotics. the team has gained  world-wide recognition and is currently engaged in six projects  supported by the european community. see www.prisma.unina.it  <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.prisma.unina.it&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=lnajj-at-fny8z2xp77nb9kmyc5tnuk7gu5ry6u4ky8&s=x5cccmmougat7fr1xtgig2jwjnj5nzvfjdggwjprz4m&e=>for further information. *about naples** ***naples is the third largest city in italy, and is the capital of the  campania region. world-known for its rich history, art, culture,  architecture, music, and gastronomy, naples is a lively, exciting and  bustling city situated on the southwest coast in a gorgeous gulf, and is  surrounded by attractive tourist and archaeological sites such as capri,  ischia, amalfi coast, pompei, ercolano, mount vesuvius. *salary and duration* the positions are full time and will be paid according to the current  italian scheme. salary will be determined depending on the level of  experience and research seniority of the individual candidate. positions are available immediately and will remain open until a  suitable number of strongly qualified candidates are selected. --  prof bruno siciliano ieee fellow, asme fellow, ifac fellow past president ieee robotics & automation society board director european robotics association prisma lab chair of automation engineering study course department of electrical engineering and information technology director of icaros center university of naples federico ii via claudio 21, 80125 napoli, italy tel +39 0817683179 mob +39 368605665 emailsiciliano at unina.it skype bsiciliano https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__wpage.unina.it_sicilian&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=lnajj-at-fny8z2xp77nb9kmyc5tnuk7gu5ry6u4ky8&s=cexymvk5yfb8pfqxrsoyuzsbfp03ohnoe5ufnfv3ayk&e= --- dona il 5 per mille all'universit? federico ii per sostenere studenti e ricercatori codice fiscale universit? degli studi di napoli federico ii 00876220633

subject: phd opportunity in skippy (highly  athletic robot) project at iit
content: fully funded phd position in skippy project at iit genoa ======================================================== an opportunity exists for a highly talented and ambitious person to join the skippy project team at the italian institute of technology (iit). the skippy project aims to create a highly athletic, small, light-weight robot that is capable of leaping 4 metres high, performing somersaults and other acrobatic movements, balancing on a single point, and a variety of other activities that require strength, speed, accuracy and skill.  skippy is also rugged enough to crash land after making a mistake, and then get back up again unaided and undamaged.  this makes skippy an ideal platform for ambitious motor-skill experiments, and for learning by doing.  for more information about skippy see https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__royfeatherstone.org_skippy_index.html&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=w3ihwyahgqhqlq5qnt88gkbknheqhgdbpiizdg8hxg0&s=xuxztuay7x6h5oqcslk36fx4cevlek08tpnxuosiytq&e= iit is a large, english-speaking research centre located near the city of genoa in northern italy.  it is well-equipped, well-funded, and has a large presence in robotics research.  for more details, see https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iit.it_research_domains_robotics&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=w3ihwyahgqhqlq5qnt88gkbknheqhgdbpiizdg8hxg0&s=hvkgnlhbh0vhlufjlopcyhy2z90whit_-iapm9vzhme&e= to apply for this opportunity, you must apply to the university of genoa, which collaborates with iit.  the place to start is https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__phd.dibris.unige.it_biorob_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=w3ihwyahgqhqlq5qnt88gkbknheqhgdbpiizdg8hxg0&s=kwxqz6umuwnbgu5bf2w7jo5hmdsdvz03n48-1z4v5wy&e= following the link "2018 doctorate call now open" gets you to https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__phd.dibris.unige.it_biorob_index.php_how-2dto-2dapply&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=w3ihwyahgqhqlq5qnt88gkbknheqhgdbpiizdg8hxg0&s=vfifnqqdbksu31e9lhasrq8gre9auvd281viu55zetq&e= >from there, the link "advanced and humanoid robotics" gets you the list of ph.d. themes.  skippy is theme number 27, on page 30.  (ignore the table of contents at the beginning of the file, which doesn't list the skippy theme.)  returning to the previous page, clicking on "please check the university website" gets you to a page where you have to choose between instructions in italian (bando generale) and instructions in english (bando generale (english version)). deadline: 12th june, but the procedure is complicated, so you should start now. also, it is a good idea to discuss your application with me (roy featherstone) in advance, and to send me a copy of your application at the time you submit it to the university.

subject: phd positions in robotics at the  university of genoa
content: dear all, the department of informatics, bioengineering, robotics and systems  engineering of university of genoa, italy, offers 3 phd scholarships for  students wishing to conduct cutting-edge research in robotics. we are looking for talented, highly motivated and skilled candidates to  work on the following topics: 1/ approximate methods for active identification 2/ goal-based cooperation and reasoning models for heterogeneous robot  swarms made up of terrestrial and aerial robots 3/ sensor-based control of bi-manual robots for human-robot cooperative  operations 4/ tactile sensing technologies and perception 5/ culture-aware robots and environmental sensor systems for elderly  support 6/ surface and underwater deployment and docking systems for underwater  autonomous vehicles 7/ robots in the warehouse: methods and technologies for the  next-generation warehouse logistics. 8/ semi-autonomous defects inspection in shop-floor scenarios via  human-robot cooperation processes. all topics are offered by the phd program in bioengineering and  robotics, curriculum robotics and autonomous systems. work to be carried  out will include basic scientific research as well as technology  development for a wide range of applications. students will be actively  involved in research activities jointly performed in cooperation with  other research institutions worldwide (e.g., in collaborative projects  funded by the european commission) and important companies in robotics,  automation and logistics. further information and a thorough description of research topics can be  found at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__phd.dibris.unige.it_biorob_media_phdtheme-5f2018-5frobotics.pdf&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=f9-ptoamik3cjwm9mn2hzkg0kgbv3zx1pj83cyrwcdg&s=xnki3lq6snlwcuhz_oslu5xchs84wv4nctocfdk3y94&e= ** general information ** the phd scholarship has a duration of three years, and it amounts to  21,859 ?/year. phd students will also have a personal allowance of 1,650  ?/year for travels and research expenses. candidates must hold a master degree in engineering or other scientific  disciplines. the call for phd positions is now open. the complete text of the call  can be found on the web site of university of genoa at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.studenti.unige.it_postlaurea_dottorati_xxxiv_en_&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=f9-ptoamik3cjwm9mn2hzkg0kgbv3zx1pj83cyrwcdg&s=3orykwglqjrn4s1iypj9gm3jgr6l2v1zo51p3b_l-og&e= the deadline for applications is **june 12th, 2018 (12:00 am cet)** for further information please contact: prof. fulvio mastrogiovanni ? reference person for the robotics and  autonomous system curriculum, email: fulvio.mastrogiovanni at unige.it prof. giorgio cannata ? coordinator of the phd program,  email:giorgio.cannata at unige.it best, fulvio

subject: research fellowships and phd openings  at the dynamic interaction control lab, iit
content: the dynamic interaction control (dic) lab at the italian institute of technology (iit) is seeking for research fellows and phd students in the following areas   *   bipedal terrestrial locomotion [1]   *   physical human-robot interaction [2]   *   aerial humanoid robotics [3] the successful candidates will work in genoa in the context of the humanoid robot icub [4] and the eu horizon project 2020 andy [5]. applicants for research fellowships, eventually aimed at master theses, shall provide the following material (write to daniele.pucci at iit.it<mailto:daniele.pucci at iit.it> [6])   1.  cover letter briefly describing their background and career plans   2.  cv   3.  date of availability names and contact information of at least two references are welcome. subject: post-doc opening in industrial  manipulator project
content: the advanced robotics (advr) at istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit), an english-speaking research institute, is looking for a highly motivated, full-time postdoctoral researcher to work in the area of robotics for industrial application for one year (renewable depending on the results) in the advanced industrial automation lab (aial). we are seeking a highly motivated and talented researcher to work in the analysis, evaluation and design of a novel industrial manipulator. this outstanding scientist should have a phd in engineering, robotics, or other scientific fields and a background in electronic/mechanical engineering, physical sciences or robotics. the successful candidate will work on the design and development of a novel manipulator to be applied in an innovative robotic soft materials handling system. the project will be carried out in collaboration with the research and development department of a worldwide leader in automated packaging machines. the work will mainly focus on the analysis, evaluation and design of a robot allowing the manipulation of different parts, fostering efficient multi-variant production, demonstrating highly dexterous behaviour. the scientist will work in a multidisciplinary team including roboticists, electronic and mechanical designers, and industrial researchers. field studies (industrial automation, packaging, etc.) will be an integral part of the work, serving both to refine system specifications and to assess new technologies. the research will advance the state of the art in manipulation enabling greatly enhanced industry production during the packaging process. the position includes hands-on and theoretical research within the general activities of the lab. desired qualifications:   *   phd degree in mechanical engineering or equivalent   *   high quality publication record   *   experience working in multidisciplinary teams   *   strong communication and english language skills (written and spoken) experience in the following fields would be ideal:   *   experience in reconfigurable mechanisms and robot end arm tooling (grippers or hands in particular), industrial automation   *   industrial robotics (direct and indirect kinematics and dynamics, handling, etc)   *   cad and 3d design modeller   *   finite element model and multibody simulation skills will be taken into account (msc.adams, msc.nastran or ansys are preferable) experience in the following fields would be useful, but is not essential:   *   strong interest in industrial robotics   *   creativity and proactive attitude.   *   independent and persistent personality, strong team player the salary will depend on qualifications and experience and will include additional health benefits. interested applicants should submit in electronic form (1) their cv outlining experience and qualifications, (2) list of publications, (3) your best first-author paper, (4) a cover letter outlining motivation and statement of research interests and (5) contact information of at least two references to ferdinando.cannella at iit.it<mailto:ferdinando.cannella at iit.it> by june 4, 2018, stating "aial-postdocmechanical - cb 74410" in the subject of the e-mail. istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit), with its headquarters in genova, italy, is a non-profit institution with the primary goal of creating and disseminating scientific knowledge and strengthening italy's technological competitiveness. the institute offers state-of-the-art equipment and a top-level interdisciplinary research environment focused on robotics and computer vision, neuroscience, drug discovery, nanoscience and technology. in order to comply with italian law (art. 23 of privacy law of the italian legislative decree n. 196/03), the candidate is kindly asked to give his/her consent to allow iit to process his/her personal data. we inform you that the information you provide will be solely used for the purpose of assessing your professional profile to meet the requirements of istituto italiano di tecnologia. your data will be processed by istituto italiano di tecnologia, with its headquarters in genoa, via morego 30, acting as the data holder, using computer and paper-based means, observing the rules on the protection of persona     l data, including those relating to the security of data. please also note that, pursuant to art. 7 of legislative decree 196/2003, you may exercise your rights at any time as a party concerned by contacting the data manager. istituto italiano di tecnologia is an equal opportunity employer that actively seeks diversity in the workforce. added on: 09/03/2018 - expires on: 04/06/2018

subject: fully-funded phd positions for legged  robot control: iit, genoa, italy
content: **************************************************************** 2nd call for fully funded phd positions for legged robot control: istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) **************************************************************** there are several fully funded phd positions, jointly offered by the university of genoa and the istituto italiano di tecnologia (italian institute of technology, iit). i am particularly seeking highly motivated applicants to the following two subjects (theme 8 and theme 11): * theme 8. legged robot control: whole-body falling-over recovery control for humanoids    - whole-body sensing algorithm using proprioceptive sensors (e.g., joint torque sensors, encoders and imu) and exteroception (e.g., force-torque sensors and stereo vision), and   - motion planning and control for recovering action of the entire body using robust dynamic control schemes. * theme 11. robot interaction control: whole-body multiple contact physical interaction control of a hybrid legged/wheeled robot platform    - dynamic whole-body control strategy of the hybrid robotic platform to guarantee agile responses and high dexterity to cope with multi contacts of the dual arm and four legs and the high kinematic redundancy. *********************************************** istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) in genova, italy is an english language institute; international applications are encouraged and will receive support with visa issues, etc. the advanced robotics (advr) research line offers state-of-the-art robot platforms and a top-level interdisciplinary research environment focused on robotics. the successful applicant will be fully funded for three years phd course on the focused research theme. *********************************************** application should be submitted to:  https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.studenti.unige.it_postlaurea_dottorati_xxxiv_en_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hsv3pm9tkyqpfvxagkhtr1pgg8ehpq2k1gf8w86hb0o&s=2tmwjzz7f6igidhpeltbruxf7bse1-paxqa1rgvwwba&e= due date: june 12th, 2018 at 12.00 noon (italian time) full list of themes is found in research theme "advanced and humanoid robotics" in the following link: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_phd-2dschool_phd-2dschool-2dgenoa&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hsv3pm9tkyqpfvxagkhtr1pgg8ehpq2k1gf8w86hb0o&s=78rdnp8wuhidwsazvdpzgtnapn6ybgqfubck3vvx_hg&e= *********************************************** for any inquiries, please contact: jinoh lee (jinoh.lee at iit.it) and nikos tsagarakis (nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it) best regards, jinoh lee. _______________________________ researcher, humanoid & human-centered mechatronics lab., advanced robotics department, fondazione istituto italiano di tecnologia(iit), via morego 30, genoa, 16163, italy https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iit.it_people_jinoh-2dlee&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=hsv3pm9tkyqpfvxagkhtr1pgg8ehpq2k1gf8w86hb0o&s=ffc16vryfnazbvss2f01qqtup_0hi_sqvwjjnkabab0&e=

subject: [news] research fellowships and phd  openings at the dynamic interaction control lab, iit
content: the dynamic interaction control (dic) lab at the italian institute of technology (iit) is seeking for research fellows and phd students in the following areas   *   bipedal terrestrial locomotion [1]   *   physical human-robot interaction [2]   *   aerial humanoid robotics [3] the successful candidates will work in genoa in the context of the humanoid robot icub [4] and the eu horizon project 2020 andy [5]. applicants for research fellowships, eventually aimed at master theses, shall provide the following material (write to daniele.pucci at iit.it<mailto:daniele.pucci at iit.it> [6])   1.  cover letter briefly describing their background and career plans   2.  cv   3.  date of availability names and contact information of at least two references are welcome. applicants for phd openings shall follow the procedure at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__phd.dibris.unige.it_biorob_&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wqgbkkeiw2yfagedtb1nyhu7xzig0udiazy3acd79qo&s=pipem2wr2bsj30jvrigx8vbqmbpwk6qbyftkmjci6sy&e= subject: phd positions in robotics at the  university of genova
content: *phd positions in *robotics* available at the university of genova*   the department of computer science and engineering, bioengineering and robotics (dibris) of the universita? di genova (italy) offers 3 phd scholarships for students applying for research activities in the area of *robotics and autonomous systems*.   we are looking for highly talented, motivated and skilled candidates to work on one of the following research topics:   1. approximate methods for active identification  2. goal-based cooperation and reasoning models for heterogeneous robot swarms made-up of terrestrial and aerial robots 3. sensor based control of bi-manual robots for human-robot cooperative operations  4. tactile sensing technologies and perception  5. culture-aware robots and environmental sensor systems for elderly support  6. surface and underwater deployment and docking systems for underwater autonomous vehicles  7. robots in the warehouse: methods and technologies for the next-generation warehouse logistics      for further details on the research topics please check here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__phd.dibris.unige.it_biorob_media_phd-2520themes-252034o-2520-2d-2520robotics-2520and-2520autonomous-2520systems-2520-282018-29.pdf <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__phd.dibris.unige.it_biorob_media_phd-2520themes-252034o-2520-2d-2520robotics-2520and-2520autonomous-2520systems-2520-282018-29.pdf&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=yqloqx0pvu-auc4zc5qwj6t73ncxtelpam8ywael8hk&s=-imbe_ln-pqbfxukqbhjsyxko-vmsheigxpdxkvq0j0&e> or https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__phd.dibris.unige.it_biorob_index.php_how-2dto-2dapply <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__phd.dibris.unige.it_biorob_index.php_how-2dto-2dapply&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=yqloqx0pvu-auc4zc5qwj6t73ncxtelpam8ywael8hk&s=kc9dk7ahosmr0-xhw8lc3ldo4ymggslblyyfewecbks&e> (curriculum *robotics and autonomous systems*)   *general informations*   the phd has a duration of three years and the scholarship amounts to 16,500.00 ?/year. phd students will also have a personal allowance of 1,650 ?/year for travels and research activities.   the call for phd positions is *now open*. the complete text of the call can be found on the web site of the universita? di genova: subject: post-doctoral position in inspection  robots - iit genova italy
content: post-doctoral position in design & control of industrial       inspection robots for power plant maintenance - [ postdoc ] workplace:genova, italy,? iit expires on: 15/06/2018 the advanced robotics (advr) research line of the istituto italiano di  tecnologia (iit), an english-speaking research institute, is seeking a  highly motivated, full-time post-doc, who will have a leading research  role in the design and control of an innovative collaborative robotic  system for industrial applications within the advanced industrial  automation lab (aial) *the selected candidate will join an interdisciplinary team and will  have the opportunity to pursue research within a project developed by  iit and an industrial partner operating worldwide in energy production  and power plant maintenance.* project: in the past decades, industrial robotics has been the dominating sector  in the robotic sales worldwide. however, there are indications that  today's robotics market is about to undergo substantial changes. the aim of the project is to create a new robot arm able to accomplish  the inspection tasks *we are looking for a highly motivated candidate with a phd in robotics,  mechanics, electronics or other fields related to design and control of  robots, and with an excellent track record in the area of robotics,  electronics or mechatronics.* in this position, the candidate will have a key role in the team  responsible for the design, development and control of the manipulator  for inspection tasks. desired qualifications: the candidate should have proficiency in the design and control of  robotics or mechatronic systems, and a strong portfolio of practical  projects. we are seeking a motivated candidate with excellent hands-on  competencies and proved experience in the field of robotics-related  technologies such as electronics, mechanics, and programming. the successful candidate should have the following skills:   * phd degree (already taken or expected to be taken very soon) in     mechanical, electronics, engineering, physic or other     technical/scientific areas.   * ability to communicate technical knowledge in a clear and     understandable manner   * broad understanding of modern and innovative manufacturing techniques   * hands-on experience with analysis, design and testing of robotic systems   * experience in programming in labview is welcome   * familiarity with data acquisition, control and communications with     embedded systems is welcome.   * experience in mechanical design with, creo etc., actuators and     drives, hands-on system integration is welcome.   * experience in electronical design with, altium, orcad etc, is welcome.   * available to attend conferences, visit fieldworks, participate in     meetings and other events;   * ability to work in a team, willing to join a group of young and     enthusiast colleagues is a must. what we offer: the successful candidate will exploit a solid foundation of established  technologies within the advanced robotics research line. this foundation  consists of extensive know-how on the design and control of mechatronics  systems, key enabling technologies, actuation, sensing, embedded  control, etc. the successful candidate will be involved in organizing  the research and development activities in the assigned tasks,  accomplishing project deliverables and communications through reports  and demonstrations. the successful candidate will be offered a highly competitive salary,  which will be commensurate with qualifications and experience in line  with european standards. *to apply, please send electronically a detailed cv (including list of  publications), a letter outlining motivation, and names of 2 referees  tocarlo.canali at iit.it <mailto:carlo.canali at iit.it>by june 15, 2018  stating [aen-iit candidature cb 75152] in the subject of the e-mail.  only complete applications will be evaluated.* iit was established in 2003 and successfully created a large-scale  infrastructure in genova and a network of 10 state-of-the-art  laboratories countrywide with an international staff of about 1500  people from more than 50 countries. iit's research endeavor focuses on  high-tech and innovation, representing the forefront of technology with  possible applications from medicine to industry, computer science,  robotics, life sciences and nano-biotechnologies. in order to comply with italian law (art. 23 of privacy law of the  italian legislative decree n. 196/03), the candidate is kindly asked to  give his/her consent to allow iit to process his/her personal data. we  inform you that the information you provide will be solely used for the  purpose of assessing your professional profile to meet the requirements  of istituto italiano di tecnologia. your data will be processed by  istituto italiano di tecnologia, with its headquarters in genoa, via  morego 30, acting as the data holder, using computer and paper-based  means, observing the rules on the protection of personal data, including  those relating to the security of data. please also note that, pursuant  to art.7 of legislative decree 196/2003, you may exercise your rights at  any time as a party concerned by contacting the data manager. istituto italiano di tecnologia is an equal opportunity employer that  actively seeks diversity in the workforce. --  ------------------------------------- dr. carlo brindesi canali phd in physics italian institute of technology via morego, 30   genova 16163 - italy tel: +39.010.71781793 e-mail: carlo.canali at iit.it https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iit.it_&d=dwidba&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=fvzzwqzspvizvljimfykey9bfckbgzcxqp3rjhktktu&s=5k7p7qbw7hc2bpwx97d45hudtrzamj_qsei6jz0nmu0&e= subject: post-doctoral position perception and  machine learning for manipulation
content: the humanoid sensing and perception research line (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_research_lines_humanoid-2dsensing-2dand-2dperception&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=pm1vif-dj7ydx5lw_hfeixnl_0fbkjfcyzs1bp8bu1q&s=vyoa4p2mwy0l6aqv3jwdkmkqktxplxyxevhh5os_uhw&e=) at the istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) is seeking to appoint a post doc on perception and machine learning for manipulation. the selected candidate will join the interdisciplinary team of the icub project and will contribute to the implementation of perception and manipulation skills of humanoid robots. we are looking for a talented and enthusiastic post-doctoral researcher who will join our team to study machine-learning algorithms to advance the capabilities of humanoid robots to interact with the environment, grasping and manipulating objects. the focus is on strategies that allow autonomous learning, and incremental machine learning techniques for dynamically adapting to novel situations. topics include: * perception of affordances; * scene segmentation; * robot self-perception for visual control of manipulation; * data-driven approaches to object grasping. the ideal candidate will have a phd in a relevant field (e.g. robotics or machine learning) and the following skills: * proven experience working with real robotic systems; * knowledge of deep learning frameworks; * strong knowledge of programming languages, i.e. c/c++; * knowledge of robotic middleware like ros and yarp. the successful candidate will be offered a salary commensurate to experience and skills. please submit your application, including a detailed cv, and references, to applications at iit.it quoting exactly ""bc 75221 - jp11 - post doc on perception and machine learning for manipulation" in the e-mail subject. the text of the call and instructions for applicants are available online: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_713-2dpost-2ddoc-2dposition-2don-2dperception-2dand-2dmachine-2dlearning-2dfor-2dmanipulation&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=pm1vif-dj7ydx5lw_hfeixnl_0fbkjfcyzs1bp8bu1q&s=qloup2m8fn1eagxx3b5fhuiqhlwixfpxc5ayhmjikoc&e=. for further information and inquires do not hesitate to contact: lorenzo.natale at iit.it -- istituto italiano di tecnologia lorenzo natale, phd lorenzo.natale at iit.it via morego, 30 16163 genova ph: +39 010 71781946 fax: +39 010 7170205 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__lornat75.github.io&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=pm1vif-dj7ydx5lw_hfeixnl_0fbkjfcyzs1bp8bu1q&s=1grqoz93_nlejwufjqtd7xlrezosrg_5hpnoqtfwtgc&e= www.iit.it

subject: phd positions in robotic surgery at iit, genoa,  italy
content: the advanced robotics research line of the istituto italiano di tecnologia is seeking highly motivated phd students to contribute to the area of biomedical robotics. ===>>   application deadline: 12 june 2018  <<=== ** the research lab ** the biomedical robotics laboratory focuses on research and development of human-centered robotic technologies. we are a highly multidisciplinary group working towards the creation of novel technologies that can directly impact the health and well-being of people. the laboratory has a wide expertise on robotic microsurgery, robot-assisted laser surgery, micromanipulation, human-machine interfaces, endoscopic image processing,  stereo vision, augmented reality, biosignals acquisition and processing (eeg, emg, gsr, etc), and systems integration. the activities of the biomedical robotics lab are devoted to study and to design intelligent interfaces and mechanisms for real applications, especially related to disease diagnosis and surgery, assisted communications, teleoperation, biomanipulation, and general healthcare. these areas are investigated both under theoretical and applied perspectives, and involve highly multidisciplinary collaborations with engineers, surgeons, neuroscientists, biologists and physicists to tackle real problems through advanced robotic solutions. our overarching  research theme is "assistive systems for augmented control." this represents well a fundamental objective behind our research projects, i.e., the development of novel technologies to assist and augment controllability in activities that are normally beyond human capabilities, in particular when the person is constrained by disabilities or have to operate in challenging environments (e.g. microsurgery). ** research themes ** we currently have a number of phd positions open in connection to our robotic microsurgery project, which aims to create innovative technologies to revolutionize the way highly delicate surgical procedures are performed. possible research themes include, but are not limited to, the following: - robot-assisted microsurgery: design and control of novel instruments - sensing and automation in robotic surgery: development of novel sensors, automatic controllers and supervisory systems - 5g telesurgery: novel user interfaces and control systems for safe and robust teleoperation of surgical robots ** workplace ** genoa, italy ** application ** further details and instructions for application can be found at: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__iit.it_phd-2dschool&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wcfbukno9tg8-5qgj1vbaqk0hb_fghtb7gyfatf9chm&s=djq0dab7gwvhljffj_6nrvfof2u7w0hy9eqqjjjf_y8&e=
