subject: 4 fully funded phd positions at the  italian institute of technology in the cognitive robotics and interaction  lab of the robotics, brain and cognitive sciences department
content: last few days to apply to these positions. apologies for cross-posting ================================================================== phd openings at the cognitive robotics and interaction lab robotics, brain and cognitive sciences department italian institute of technology =========================================================== in the spirit of the doctoral school on bioengineering and robotics the phd program for the curriculum ?cognitive robotics, interaction and rehabilitation technologies? provides interdisciplinary training at the interface between technology and life-sciences. the general objective of the program is to form scientists and research technologists capable of working in multidisciplinary teams on projects where human factors play a crucial role in technological development and design. robotics and neuroscience researchers in rbcs share, as a fundamental scientific objective, the study of physical and social interaction in humans and machines (www.iit.it/rbcs ).? among the different research themes proposed i would like to advertise these topics: ?  visual cues for mutual understanding in human-robot interaction ? computational neuroscience models for auditory aware robots ?  transferring of human-robot interaction competencies: towards robot symbiosis in the acquisition of new skills ?  cyber - physical social security applied to emergent innovative technologies the ideal candidates are students with a higher level university degree willing to invest extra time and effort in blending into a multidisciplinary team composed of neuroscientists, engineers, psychologists, physicists working together to investigate brain functions and realize intelligent machines, rehabilitation protocols and advanced prosthesis. international applications are encouraged and will receive logistic support with visa issues, relocation, etc. below you can find more details related to the positions and the instructions on how to apply ======================================================================= application deadline: *****12 june 2018, noon,? italian time***** ======================================================================= =============== themes =============== visual cues for mutual understanding in human-robot interaction tutors: alessandra sciutti, phd; francesco rea, phd; prof. giulio sandini institute: iit (istituto italiano di tecnologia) research unit: robotics, brain and cognitive sciences (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_rbcs&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=a3cv45vj45cv3pqpp68kwx0evpudli2tmufn75i52be&s=kebebeto01zgjd6ezjqmc9vfhcegfm5gcxpp0wp3t7o&e=) division: cognitive robotics and human-human interaction description: the ability of humans at interacting and collaborating with each other is based on mutual understanding and is supported by a continuous exchange of information mediated only in minimal part by language. the majority of messages are covertly embedded in the way the two partners move their eyes and their body. this implicit information exchange allows to anticipate the needs and intentions of the partner. the general goal of this project will be to provide the humanoid icub robot with the ability to perceive these covert visual signals sent by its human partners, as well as becoming able to send analogous cues with its own movements. the pipeline of the computational system includes an attentional module able to localize the portion of the scene containing biological motion and to extract the visual properties of the observed movements, as speed, trajectory, acceleration. starting from this analysis, performed by modules already available on the robot, icub will need to use the derived movement features to understand its partners? actions and to decode their intentions, needs and emotions. view-invariance will be one of the crucial aspects of the system. additionally, these movement features will guide the selection of the appropriate robot behavior, to make it intuitively predictable and legible to the partner. robot motion planning could leverage existing tools to design biologically plausible robot movements for the icub. requirements: degree in robotics, bioengineering, computer science, computer engineering, or related disciplines, attitude for problem solving, c++ programming. a background on computer vision and machine learning is an asset. references 1. sciutti a., mara m., tagliasco v., sandini g. 2018 humanizing human-robot interaction: on the importance of mutual understanding, ieee technology and society magazine https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__ieeexplore.ieee.org_document_8307144_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=a3cv45vj45cv3pqpp68kwx0evpudli2tmufn75i52be&s=atjegbficm-ncrgmzmhfufr8rgyforceayis95u1p5u&e= 2. sciutti a. & sandini g. 2017 , ?interacting with robots to investigate the bases of social interaction?, ieee transactions on neural systems and rehabilitation engineering, 10.1109/tnsre.2017.2753879 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__ieeexplore.ieee.org_document_8068256_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=a3cv45vj45cv3pqpp68kwx0evpudli2tmufn75i52be&s=efxvxaahbg1kdvn-dvlp0xp5qgvjcn9rpro_w7k7fuu&e= 3. vignolo a., noceti n., rea f., sciutti a., odone f. & sandini g. 2017, ?detecting biological motion for human-robot interaction: a link between perception and action?, frontiers in robotics and ai, 4. https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__journal.frontiersin.org_article_10.3389_frobt.2017.00014_full&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=a3cv45vj45cv3pqpp68kwx0evpudli2tmufn75i52be&s=9w0pjbxibga-gfqt2o_ftcrg__j11dxnjz9vnhtu8tk&e= 4. sandini g., sciutti a. & rea f. (2018) ?movement-based communication for humanoid-human interaction?. in: section: human-humanoid interaction, humanoid robotics: a reference contacts: alessandra.sciutti at iit.it, francesco.rea at iit.it, giulio.sandini at iit.it  - applicants are strongly encouraged to contact the perspective tutors before they submit their application.? ========================================================================== =============================== computational neuroscience models for auditory aware robots tutors: francesco rea, phd; prof. giulio sandini institute: iit (istituto italiano di tecnologia) research unit: robotics, brain and cognitive sciences (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_rbcs&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=a3cv45vj45cv3pqpp68kwx0evpudli2tmufn75i52be&s=kebebeto01zgjd6ezjqmc9vfhcegfm5gcxpp0wp3t7o&e=) division: cognitive robotics and human-human interaction description: selective attention is fundamental to any living being as a prerequisite for action performance and social interaction. the process of visually shifting attention on task-relevant targets has been studied extensively in cognitive neuroscience and implemented computationally for a variety of real-word problems. however multisensory attention has been only partially exploited despite the evident advantages in attentional orienting and explicit communication (speech) understanding in social realistic contexts. the phd program will implement a novel computational neuroscience models of auditory processing by endowing the humanoid robot icub with auditory awareness in an unstructured acoustic world. in detail, icub will 1) show proactive attention toward relevant salient sound sources, 2) generate motor-control and integrate sensor input across successive movements to reinforce the interpretation of the scene, and 3) provide a reliable and novel speech recognition system [1],[2]. the activities carried out in collaboration with with department of computational neuroscience at university of lethbridge (alberta, canada) aim: a) to consolidate audio attention system in the existing robotics setup icub[3]; b) to enable experimentation involving ecological interaction with human subjects; c) to enhance the existing multimodal attention system; d) to provide deep-learning models of speech recognition based on dnns; e) to integrate the outcome in the icub cognitive architecture [4]. requirements: degree in robotics, bioengineering, computer science, computer engineering, or related disciplines, attitude for problem solving, c++ programming. a background on machine learning is an asset. references: 1. mosadeghzad m., rea f., tata m., brayda l. & sandini g. 2015, ?saliency based sensor fusion of broadband sound localizer for humanoids?, 2015 ieee international conference on multisensor fusion and information integration (mfi 2015), san diego, ca, usa, september 14-16, 2015; 2. ilievski m., rea f.iit, sandini g., tata m., ?a binaural beamforming approach to resolve complex auditory scenes for humanoid robots? 2017 ieee/rsj international conference on intelligent robots and systems, vancouver, bc, canada, september 24-28, 2017 3. rea f., sandini g., metta g., ?motor biases in visual attention for a humanoid robot?, ieee-ras international conference on humanoid robots, vol. 2015-february, pp. 779-786 4. mohan v, sandini g, morasso p. (2014), ?a neural framework for organization and flexible utilization of episodic memory in "cumulatively" learning baby humanoids?, neural computation 26(12), 2692-2734, mit press contacts: francesco.rea at iit.it , giulio.sandini at iit.it - applicants are strongly encouraged to contact the perspective tutors before they submit their application.? ========================================================================== =============================== transferring of human-robot interaction competencies: towards robot symbiosis in the acquisition of new skills tutor: jacopo zenzeri, phd; alessandra sciutti, phd; francesco rea, phd institute: iit (istituto italiano di tecnologia) research unit: robotics, brain and cognitive sciences (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_rbcs&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=a3cv45vj45cv3pqpp68kwx0evpudli2tmufn75i52be&s=kebebeto01zgjd6ezjqmc9vfhcegfm5gcxpp0wp3t7o&e=) division: motor learning, assistive and rehabilitation robotics & cognitive robotics and human-human interaction description: in the recent years many studies focused on how to optimize human-robot collaboration tasks. here we focus on a fundamental case where a human agent has to learn how to use a tool while collaborating with an expert humanoid robot agent which, in this case, plays the active role of maximizing the learning of the human. in this new perspective the process will proceed in two steps: 1) the humanoid robot acquire the knowledge of the collaborative tasks and becomes the ?robot teacher? by interacting (through the tool) with an expert human; 2) the na?ve human interact (through the tool) with the ?robot teacher? in order to learn the task in an optimal way. behavioral experiments on motor learning will be conducted using haptic interfaces to study motor control mechanisms and how motor control strategies emerge during the interaction with specific set of tools. this activity is based on recent studies on dyadic interaction [1-2] and will contribute to define human inspired models of interaction. the model is transferred to the humanoid agent to acquire the human expert knowledge (in step 1) and to teach it to the na?ve one (in step 2). behavioral experiments will then be conducted with the humanoid robot icub to implement real use cases. in this context, the proactive role of the icub will enrich existing cognitive framework for human robot interaction. the candidate will also exploit measure of engagement in the task (attentional level, cognitive load and fatigue). requirements: a master degree in bioengineering, computer science or equivalent, with experience in the analysis and modeling of human movements and in robot programming. references: 1. avila-mireles, e.j. et al., 2017. skill learning and skill transfer mediated by cooperative haptic interaction. ieee transactions on neural systems and rehabilitation engineering, 25(7), pp.832?243. 2. galofaro, e., morasso, p. & zenzeri, j., 2017. improving motor skill transfer during dyadic robot training through the modulation of the expert role. in ieee international conference on rehabilitation robotics. london. 3. vignolo a., noceti n., rea f., sciutti a., odone f. & sandini g. 2017, ?detecting biological motion for human-robot interaction: a link between perception and action?, frontiers in robotics and ai, 4. contacts: jacopo.zenzeri at iit.it alessandra.sciutti at iit.it francesco.rea at iit.it  - applicants are strongly encouraged to contact the perspective tutors before they submit their application. ========================================================================== =============================== cyber - physical social security applied to emergent innovative technologies tutor: francesco rea, stefano bencetti institute: iit (istituto italiano di tecnologia) department: ict/ robotics, brain and cognitive sciences (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_rbcs&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=a3cv45vj45cv3pqpp68kwx0evpudli2tmufn75i52be&s=kebebeto01zgjd6ezjqmc9vfhcegfm5gcxpp0wp3t7o&e=) description: the field of cyber security is a fast-growing discipline that impacts on the interaction between people and technology. even though the effectiveness of security measures to protect personal data is increasing, people remain susceptible to manipulation and thus the human element remains the weakest link. social engineering. such weakness is often is exploited by the use of various manipulation techniques aiming at the disclosure of sensitive information, namely social engineering. the field of social engineering is still in its early stages however the interaction between individuals and new technologies ( assistive robotics, robot companion) and new ways of working (smart working) might be exposed to yet unknown risks associated with the misuse of protected data only partially addressed by traditional computer security. the overall aim of the project is to investigate how to prevent disclosure of sensitive information applied to the areas where humans use interconnected technologies (e.g. :robotics, iot, big data analytics systems) especially in the context of human machine interactions (e.g.: robot companion, assistive robotics, home assistance, etc.). the aim unfolds into two goals for the candidate. first, the ideal candidate is required to develop algorithms of human machine interaction that adapts to the person. the technology autonomously decides what sensitive information is acquired from the person in relation to the specific objective of the interaction (medical assessment, adaptation to user`s needs, etc). for example, the assistive robot autonomously adapts the data acquisition strategy to the goal of improving the provided assistance without the acquisition of personal data, which is irrelevant to the assistance. the second goal is to improve the robustness and high integrity of system architectures (cyber-physical security) adopted for above-mentioned cutting-edge technologies. the solutions defined by the candidate can also help the security risk management and the analysis of social engineering threats. as outcome of the project, such methodologies will be concretely applied to innovative applications designed at the istituto italiano di tecnologia in collaboration with the robotic labs of the institute to make the applications socially aware and socially acceptable. requirements: a degree in computer science with high interests in life sciences. programming skills, familiarity with social network contacts: francesco.rea at iit.it stefano.bencetti at iit.it - applicants are strongly encouraged to contact the perspective tutors before they submit their application. =============== how to apply =============== please note that the positions are available through the phd course of bioengineering and robotics, curriculum on cognitive robotics, interaction and rehabilitation technologies, offered jointly by iit and the university of genoa. the official calls are available here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_phd-2dschool_phd-2dschool-2dgenoa&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=a3cv45vj45cv3pqpp68kwx0evpudli2tmufn75i52be&s=0i5idjled9da8pdpmkzgy-yktknepjly4lw2q6w_fcg&e= under the curriculum ?cognitive robotics, interaction and rehabilitation technologies?. please have a look at the "admission guide" section, which contains detailed instructions on how to apply and a list of documents you have to present. in particular, note that the preparation of a short project proposal is required and is important in the evaluation of prospective candidates. please find here a template (pdf) : the link to the on-line application page is: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.studenti.unige.it_postlaurea_dottorati_xxxiv_en_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=a3cv45vj45cv3pqpp68kwx0evpudli2tmufn75i52be&s=uzgoqx-699almf9pca6ytkhysfyalbjumeq0sr4ntii&e= in case of problems or questions related to the application procedure, please contact: anastasia.bruzzone at iit.it  ? ============================================================ application deadline: *****12 june 2018, noon,? italian time****** ============================================================ ---------------------------------------- alessandra sciutti (phd) researcher, robotics brain and cognitive sciences unit  istituto italiano di tecnologia center for human technologies via enrico melen 83, building b 16152 genova, italy tel: +39 010? 8172 210 email: alessandra.sciutti at iit.it website: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_people_alessandra-2dsciutti&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=a3cv45vj45cv3pqpp68kwx0evpudli2tmufn75i52be&s=i7g_t0al-xpsikufvryhiakrpq5keu6enifw4wgwglq&e=

subject: post doc position for software  engineering for mobile manipulation
content: the humanoid sensing and perception laboratory (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.iit.it_humanoid-2dsensing-2dand-2dperception&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=rad8kmunpgbtdc6plfyp7tna9nql0ks1s1y_70uwsuk&s=qi625kzdkngubnxsi_risu1imjvatguhn7_-e-cq6hw&e=) at istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) is seeking to appoint a postdoctoral position on mobile manipulation. we are looking for a talented and enthusiastic postdoctoral researcher who will join our team to develop algorithms for navigation and object manipulation on our humanoid robot r1, in the context of domestic and healthcare applications. the selected candidate will join the interdisciplinary team of the icub project, and will have the opportunity to work in an exciting and young environment, in close interaction with research engineers, phd students and post-doctoral researchers. the main tasks will be to explore how to integrate various aspects of robotics that are typically studied in isolation (e.g. visual perception, machine learning, motion planning, object grasping and manipulation using visual and tactile feedback) to implement advanced capabilities for navigation and object manipulation in unstructured environments. results will be experimentally validated with the r1 humanoid robot, under real world conditions involving end users. the ideal candidate will have a phd in robotics or equivalent and the following skills: ability to analyze, improve and propose new algorithms/solutions; strong motivation to work with real robotic systems; experience with mobile manipulation and navigation; knowledge of c++ and development tools (e.g. cmake and git); familiarity with robotic middleware (e.g. yarp, ros). this position is supported by the project carve, which is funded by the horizon 2020 eu project robmosys grant agreement 732410 through its first open call. the successful candidate will be offered a salary commensurate to experience and skills. please apply by june 20 2018, by sending your application to applications at iit.it quoting exactly "bc75087 - postdoc carve" in the e-mail subject. your application shall contain a detailed cv, a research statement, and the contact information of two references. -- istituto italiano di tecnologia lorenzo natale, phd lorenzo.natale at iit.it via morego, 30 16163 genova ph: +39 010 71781946 fax: +39 010 7170205 https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__lornat75.github.io&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=rad8kmunpgbtdc6plfyp7tna9nql0ks1s1y_70uwsuk&s=g5396qnybdqczmak5brzodzvlfsangoluzzdjl8y6tq&e= www.iit.it

subject: postdoctoral position in mechatronics  for exoskeletons
content: postdoctoral position in mechatronics for exoskeletons. the advanced robotics research line at istituto italiano di tecnologia,  an english-language research institute, is seeking to appoint a highly  motivated full-time post-doc who will have a leading research role in  developing industrial exoskeletons. the selected candidate will join an interdisciplinary team and have the  opportunity to pursue research within the project ?sistemi cibernetici  collaborativi ? exoskeletons? in partnership with inail (?istituto  nazionale per l'assicurazione contro gli infortuni sul lavoro? - italian  workers? compensation authority) this project aims at the development of a full-body exoskeleton to  assist workers performing manual tasks. there will be an important focus  towards the industrial needs from different areas, including, but not  limited to, automotive, logistics and construction. the project will be  developed within an inter-disciplinary group, including not only experts  in robotics and exoskeletons, but also professionals in bioengineering  and ergonomics. find detailed information about the open position and the application  procedure in the following link: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__iit.it_careers_openings_opening_737-2dpostdoctoral-2dposition-2din-2dmechatronics-2dfor-2dexoskeletons&d=dwidaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=bl1eqahlhf8bgtzdjiozhazu3oyi8tusi-id7-1aayq&s=ab54nljkxkj54m8bi91-6pjtp_ddclqxbesinw1rytu&e= -------------------------- jes?s ortiz researcher department of advanced robotics (advr) istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) via morego 30 16163, genova, italy email: jesus.ortiz at iit.it tel: +39 010 71781 412

subject: research internship opening on "3d  perception and learning for humanoid robot locomotion/manipulation" at the  italian institute of technology (iit), genoa
content: fellow (research internship) opening on "3d perception and learning for humanoid robot locomotion/manipulation" at the italian institute of technology (iit), genoa link: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_693-2dfellow-2dopening-2don-2d3d-2dperception-2dand-2dlearning-2dfor-2dhumanoid-2drobot-2dlocomotionmanipulation&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=4mbkvhfqsml4h21vnkxphq8v90qklohvoq1vfu5dga0&s=c5psjcj9i0xge4anj0txqzjb5um57ro7w5er-ddnhh0&e=<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_693-2dfellow-2dopening-2don-2d3d-2dperception-2dand-2dlearning-2dfor-2dhumanoid-2drobot-2dlocomotionmanipulatio&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=4mbkvhfqsml4h21vnkxphq8v90qklohvoq1vfu5dga0&s=sn51xjkivp4plajhu2topy28rzwjy42qtcbbmzcazxo&e=><https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_693-2dfellow-2dopening-2don-2d3d-2dperception-2dand-2dlearning-2dfor-2dhumanoid-2drobot-2dlocomotionmanipulation&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=4mbkvhfqsml4h21vnkxphq8v90qklohvoq1vfu5dga0&s=c5psjcj9i0xge4anj0txqzjb5um57ro7w5er-ddnhh0&e=> where: humanoids and human-centred mechatronics lab (hhcm), department of advanced robotics (advr) at the istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit), genoa, italy. starting date: as soon as possible; june-july 2018 (preferable) deadline: july 9, 2018 (a fcfs policy will be followed in the evaluation of the applications until a suitable candidate is appointed) duration: 6+ months with potential follow up enrollment to continue for phd studies. tutors: dr. dimitrios kanoulas, dr. nikos tsagarakis contacts: dimitrios.kanoulas at iit.it, nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it description: the humanoids and human centred mechatronics research line at istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) (an english language institute, placed in genoa) is seeking a fully funded 6 months fellow (msc should have been completed), with a strong ambition to pursue a research career, to work on one of our eu-funded walk-man (www.walk-man.eu, video: youtu.be/kzzwvwzawme, video: youtu.be/7uectbjusci), cogimon (cogimon.eu), and/or centauro (www.centauro-project.eu) humanoid robots. we are looking for highly motivated candidates with a msc degree in electrical/computer engineering/science. potential topics (one should be selected):   *   "3d perception and learning for legged robot navigation: rough terrain locomotion (vision and path planning) using geometric and machine learning techniques"   *   "3d perception and (deep) learning for humanoid robot tool manipulation: detection, localization, and use"   after fukushima daiichi nuclear disaster in 2011 the need of robots to deal with unstructured environments and replace humans in hazardous tasks became one of the main open problems in robotics. rapid advancements in actuation and control over the last few years enabled articulated legged robots to walk in uneven terrain and manipulate several objects. still, the problems of 1) foot placement in rough terrain for navigation and 2) tool manipulation and reasoning in uncertain setups using 3d perception, remain two of the main challenges in robotics and are the key aspects for completing several tasks in unknown environments.   the aim of this topic is to develop new geometric or machine learning (e.g. deep learning) methods for environment reconstruction and cognition that enable limbed robots, such as walk-man (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.walk-2dman.eu_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=4mbkvhfqsml4h21vnkxphq8v90qklohvoq1vfu5dga0&s=3j0ypkwjgwhxrtql1q6qro5lq9waqblw0vmsxtj8wv4&e=), centauro (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.centauro-2dproject.eu&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=4mbkvhfqsml4h21vnkxphq8v90qklohvoq1vfu5dga0&s=la5j_wkpownz3bowfoukhdqczt46xkjx7x3nwsqzczm&e=) , or cogimon (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__cogimon.eu&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=4mbkvhfqsml4h21vnkxphq8v90qklohvoq1vfu5dga0&s=aasepwsyo5b6r-kgmsnk84xn4aoqhf073xyufe60lgo&e=) to perform legged locomotion and manipulation in unstructured environments using 3d perception for foot-placement and hand/arm/wholebody-placement for path planning and mapping (slam). several exteroceptive (stereo/event/rgb cameras, rgb-d sensors, 2d/3d lidar scanners) sensors will be used on our limbed robots, to acquire rgb images and dense 3d point clouds. geometric simplifications for reasoning the contact between the robot's body (e.g., foot, hands, arms) and the environment will need to take place. moreover, path planning methods need to be developed to extract primitives for locomotion and manipulation. the development and testing will take place on our full-size humanoid/quadrupedal robots in real-world environments. requirements:   *   the person in interest should have acquired a master degree (obtained within the past six months from the application) in a relevant field.   *   this topic lies in the intersection of vision, learning, and robotics. a background in any of robotics, computer/robotic vision, path planning, robot learning is desirable.   *   ideal applicants should have strong c++ (python and matlab are a plus) programming skills.   *   machine learning and computer vision skills are required.   *   knowledge of the robot operating system (ros) and the point cloud library (pcl) is a very big plus.   *   the applicants should be fluent in english and team players. references: -- legged robot navigation    1. kanoulas et. al., "vision-based foothold contact reasoning using curved surface patches", humanoids 2017.    2. kanoulas et. al., "footstep planning in rough terrain for bipedal robots using curved contact patches", icra 2018. -- humanoid robot tool manipulation    1. kanoulas et. al. "center-of-mass-based grasp pose adaptation using 3d range and force/torque sensing", ijhr 2018.    2. nguyen et. al., "object-based affordances detection with convolutional neural networks and dense conditional random fields", iros 2017. application: the applicants should submit their cv  (deadline july 9, 2018) electronically outlining experience and qualifications, a short statement (max 1 page) about the research areas of interest as well as the names of two referees to dimitrios.kanoulas at iit<mailto:dimitrios.kanoulas at iit> (cc-ed nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it<mailto:nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it>), quoting [hhcm-internship - cb75158 ] in the email subject (total email size should not exceed 1mb). best regards --   --   dimitrios kanoulas, ph.d.   postdoctoral researcher   humanoids and human-centred mechatronics lab (hhcm)   dept. of advanced robotics (advr)   istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit-genova)   via morego 30,genova 16163, italy   e-mail: dimitrios.kanoulas at iit.it   url: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__dkanou.github.io_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=4mbkvhfqsml4h21vnkxphq8v90qklohvoq1vfu5dga0&s=ngnjr4qulh5kgzpo1jt4rq0a0jyligsol4myyum5-y0&e=

subject: three post-doc positions available to  join the icub team at iit
content: dear roboticists, three positions (postdoctoral fellow) are available at the istituto italiano di tecnologia to work on the icub robot. more details can be found at the links below: * postdoc on human-robot trajectory retargeting (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_768-2dpostdoc-2don-2dhuman-2drobot-2dtrajectory-2dretargeting&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=a9pyzsvffezedx4ib1j4ebrflkullcxgqdrv_tuvquc&s=amyogzytik7kxmu7zdu3emjzxxsfw-n1edle9obel1e&e=) * postdoc on "robot control for hri" (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_769-2dpostdoc-2don-2drobot-2dcontrol-2dfor-2dhri&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=a9pyzsvffezedx4ib1j4ebrflkullcxgqdrv_tuvquc&s=00shrxh3gxzd2v4h2pl4b8piqniiblily0dcw5wwzn8&e=) * postdoc on "the design of better icub hands" (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_770-2dpostdoc-2don-2dthe-2ddesign-2dof-2dbetter-2dicub-2dhands&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=a9pyzsvffezedx4ib1j4ebrflkullcxgqdrv_tuvquc&s=dpfqxnve_pro8ttzdw1hmfdagvcg0c6gkh0_7vhndwo&e=) additional information this research is part of a large-scale project, funded directly by iit, that aims at developing innovative robotic technologies applied to the diagnosis and therapy of neuro-developmental disorders (ndds), as well as to study neurotypical development. evidence from research on neuroplasticity indicates that early diagnosis followed by appropriate intervention is critical to optimize the outcome for children suffering from many ndds, including autism, and improve their skills and functioning in daily social environment. the theragnostic robotics program will integrate cognitive neuroscience, robotics and electronics to address the following grand challenges: * improve the design of robots by tuning it to the needs of both typically and atypically developing individuals; * design, develop, and test advanced robotic technologies for accurate diagnostic and therapeutic approaches to autism and other ndds; * enhance the social, cognitive and sensorimotor functioning of both typical and atypical developing individuals by developing innovative sensorial technologies and rehabilitation procedures. to apply, please follow instructions detailed at the abovementioned webpages. best,  giorgio giorgio metta <giorgio.metta at iit.it> istituto italiano di tecnologia via morego, 30                             16163 genoa, italy                          ph: +39 010 7178-1411 fax: +39 010 7178-1205 url: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__pasa.cognitivehumanoids.eu&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=a9pyzsvffezedx4ib1j4ebrflkullcxgqdrv_tuvquc&s=wqk3o7asxgf88vewc3nc0lgkf9b0nm9ndkhxnmcalxw&e=

subject: research internship opening on "3d  perception and learning for humanoid robot locomotion/manipulation" at the  italian institute of technology (iit), genoa in-reply-to: <585f85a528ba44cb92b544cce6f99c39@iit.it> references: <585f85a528ba44cb92b544cce6f99c39@iit.it>

(https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__cogimon.eu&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=so5iihgcao6g0pinfbf1ffec5vtsvb-eviqei9sfsde&s=iacqorw6asa9uk2xg6hfrkqchok2hli_0juffltewi0&e=) to perform legged locomotion and manipulation in unstructured environments using 3d perception for foot-placement and hand/arm/wholebody-placement for path planning and mapping (slam). several exteroceptive (stereo/event/rgb cameras, rgb-d sensors, 2d/3d lidar scanners) sensors will be used on our limbed robots, to acquire rgb images and dense 3d point clouds. geometric simplifications for reasoning the contact between the robot's body (e.g., foot, hands, arms) and the environment will need to take place. moreover, path planning methods need to be developed to extract primitives for locomotion and manipulation. the development and testing will take place on our full-size humanoid/quadrupedal robots in real-world environments. requirements:   *   the person in interest should have acquired a master degree (obtained within the past six months from the application) in a relevant field.   *   this topic lies in the intersection of vision, learning, and robotics. a background in any of robotics, computer/robotic vision, path planning, robot learning is desirable.   *   ideal applicants should have strong c++ (python and matlab are a plus) programming skills.   *   machine learning and computer vision skills are required.   *   knowledge of the robot operating system (ros) and the point cloud library (pcl) is a very big plus.   *   the applicants should be fluent in english and team players. references: -- legged robot navigation    1. kanoulas et. al., "vision-based foothold contact reasoning using curved surface patches", humanoids 2017.    2. kanoulas et. al., "footstep planning in rough terrain for bipedal robots using curved contact patches", icra 2018. -- humanoid robot tool manipulation    1. kanoulas et. al. "center-of-mass-based grasp pose adaptation using 3d range and force/torque sensing", ijhr 2018.    2. nguyen et. al., "object-based affordances detection with convolutional neural networks and dense conditional random fields", iros 2017. application: the applicants should submit their cv  (deadline july 9, 2018) electronically outlining experience and qualifications, a short statement (max 1 page) about the research areas of interest as well as the names of two referees to dimitrios.kanoulas at iit<mailto:dimitrios.kanoulas at iit> (cc-ed nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it<mailto:nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it>), quoting [hhcm-internship - cb75158 ] in the email subject (total email size should not exceed 1mb). best regards --   --   dimitrios kanoulas, ph.d.   postdoctoral researcher   humanoids and human-centred mechatronics lab (hhcm)   dept. of advanced robotics (advr)   istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit-genova)   via morego 30,genova 16163, italy   e-mail: dimitrios.kanoulas at iit.it   url: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__dkanou.github.io_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=so5iihgcao6g0pinfbf1ffec5vtsvb-eviqei9sfsde&s=fbr95jdncvyzeyczpj9fan1lvnkwjpexrysuaentlrk&e=

subject: technologist position at iit -  mechanical workshop

subject: two open research assistant positions  at free university of bolzano
content: 2 full-time research assistant positions at free university of bolzano the free university of bolzano, faculty science and technology invites national and international applicants to apply for 2 full-time research assistant positions in the fields of action, plan and intention understanding in human-robot collaboration as well as the dynamic emotion estimation from physiological signals. we are looking for 2 full-time positions with an initial contract duration of 1 year, and with the possibility of renewal given the positive evaluation of the activity and availability of funds. more details about the two open positions can be found at: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.unibz.it_en_home_position-2dcalls_positions-2dfor-2dacademic-2dstaff_3443-2dautomation-2dprof-2dpeer-2dpos-2d1-3fgroup-3d18&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=7p3ktkgfig1hkc6qjfz8jnrmdwmzr_ubza7jraikds8&s=jbb5_zmqmub3ldmngjq-ygi8wpxb46zqsptqemlxydm&e= subject: [news] postdoc at the dynamic  interaction control lab, iit, on physical human-robot interaction

subject: postdoctoral position in computer  vision & machine learning cb 75470 in-reply-to: <19a16df1a33d4b4b9215f91ad05665c5@iit.it> references: <19a16df1a33d4b4b9215f91ad05665c5@iit.it>
content: postdoctoral position in computer vision & machine learning cb  75470 iit, istituto italiano di tecnologia, genova, italy the pattern analysis and computer vision research line (pavis) at iit in genova is looking for a highly qualified post doc with a strong background in computer vision, pattern recognition and machine learning, with particular emphasis on recognition, video analysis, behavior understanding and prediction. as the activities may be carried out in collaboration with other iit research units, previous multidisciplinary experience is an added value which will be duly considered. the main mission of pavis is to design and develop innovative image- and video-based intelligent systems, characterized by the use of highly functional smart sensors and advanced data analytics features. pavis also plays an active role in supporting the other iit research units providing scientists in neuroscience, nanophysics and other iit departments/centers with ad hoc solutions. to this end, the group is involved in activities concerning computer vision and pattern recognition, machine learning, multimodal\multimedia data analysis and sensor fusion, and embedded computer vision systems. the lab will pursue this goal by working collaboratively and in cooperation with external private and public partners. in particular, this call aims at consolidating pavis expertise in the video surveillance area and especially on action/activity recognition and scene understanding from video sequences and other sensory modalities. in particular, the following topics are of interest: ?    analysis of static and dynamic scenes. ?    recognition (objects, scenes, actions, events, etc.) and reconstruction. ?    behavior analysis and activity recognition (individuals, groups, crowd). ?    prediction of intentions. ?    domain adaptation. ?    mutimodal data analysis ?    zero-shot learning >from the methodological standpoint, the ideal candidate should be familiar with one or more of the following subjects (it?s not an exhaustive list): deep learning, graphical models, topic models, representation/feature learning, sparse and dictionary learning, clustering, kernel methods, manifold learning and statistical and probabilistic models in general. candidates for this position have a ph.d. in computer vision, machine learning, pattern recognition or related areas. research experience and qualification in computer vision and pattern recognition/machine learning are clearly a must and evidence of top quality research on the above-specified areas in the form of published papers in top conferences/journals and/or patents is mandatory. moreover, experience in the preparation and management of research proposals (eu, us, national) and industrial research projects, a few years of postdoc experience, either in academia or in an industrial lab, will also be duly considered. the winning candidate will also be asked to contribute to setting up new (funding) project proposals and will participate in funding activities. he/she is also expected to publish his/her research results in leading international journals and conferences, supervise phd candidates and collaborate with other scientists, also with different expertise. salary will be commensurate with qualification and experience and in line with international standards. further details and informal inquiries can be made by email to pavis at iit.it quoting pavis-pd 75470 as reference number. please send your completed application forms by july 23, 2018. application must include: a curriculum listing all publications (possibly including a pdf of your most representative publications), a research statement describing your previous research experience and outlining its relevance to the above topics and the name of 2 referees by email to pavis at iit.it quoting pavis-pd 75470 as reference number. iit was established in 2003 and successfully created a large-scale infrastructure in genova, a network of 10-state-of-the-art laboratories countrywide and recruited an international staff of about 1100 people from more than 50 countries. iit's research endeavor focuses on high-tech and innovation, representing the forefront of technology with possible applications from medicine to industry, computer science, robotics, life sciences and nanobiotechnologies. we inform you that the information you provide will be used solely for the purposes of evaluating and selecting professional profiles in order to meet the requirements of istituto italiano di tecnologia. your data will be processed by istituto italiano di tecnologia, based in genoa, via morego 30, acting as data controller, in compliance with the rules on protection of personal data, including those related to data security. please also note that, pursuant to articles 15 et. seq. of european regulation no. 679/2016 (general data protection regulation), you may exercise your rights at any time by contacting the data protection officer (phone +39 010 71781 - email: dpo at iit.it). istituto italiano di tecnologia is an equal opportunity employer that actively seeks diversity in the workforce.

subject: research internship opening on "3d  perception and learning for humanoid robot locomotion/manipulation" at the  italian institute of technology (iit), genoa in-reply-to: <585f85a528ba44cb92b544cce6f99c39@iit.it> references: <585f85a528ba44cb92b544cce6f99c39@iit.it>
content: fellow (research internship) opening on "3d perception and learning for humanoid robot locomotion/manipulation" at the italian institute of technology (iit), genoa link: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_693-2dfellow-2dopening-2don-2d3d-2dperception-2dand-2dlearning-2dfor-2dhumanoid-2drobot-2dlocomotionmanipulation&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=8opuhtpckt9bv1teneejj9ztzx7u2xsk2elxw0xb_-i&s=f4hev3r00rzjur6k9fh5wafihyuy4fgof8-4oh1mkqm&e=<https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_693-2dfellow-2dopening-2don-2d3d-2dperception-2dand-2dlearning-2dfor-2dhumanoid-2drobot-2dlocomotionmanipulatio&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=8opuhtpckt9bv1teneejj9ztzx7u2xsk2elxw0xb_-i&s=vuenv52qwh-7pgcmbw6-wtpgfkszah2ml6oli37khry&e=><https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_693-2dfellow-2dopening-2don-2d3d-2dperception-2dand-2dlearning-2dfor-2dhumanoid-2drobot-2dlocomotionmanipulation&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=8opuhtpckt9bv1teneejj9ztzx7u2xsk2elxw0xb_-i&s=f4hev3r00rzjur6k9fh5wafihyuy4fgof8-4oh1mkqm&e=> where: humanoids and human-centred mechatronics lab (hhcm), department of advanced robotics (advr) at the istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit), genoa, italy. starting date: as soon as possible; june-july 2018 (preferable) deadline: july 9, 2018 (a fcfs policy will be followed in the evaluation of the applications until a suitable candidate is appointed) duration: 6+ months with potential follow up enrollment to continue for phd studies. tutors: dr. dimitrios kanoulas, dr. nikos tsagarakis contacts: dimitrios.kanoulas at iit.it, nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it description: the humanoids and human centred mechatronics research line at istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit) (an english language institute, placed in genoa) is seeking a fully funded 6 months fellow (msc should have been completed), with a strong ambition to pursue a research career, to work on one of our eu-funded walk-man (www.walk-man.eu, video: youtu.be/kzzwvwzawme, video: youtu.be/7uectbjusci), cogimon (cogimon.eu), and/or centauro (www.centauro-project.eu) humanoid robots. we are looking for highly motivated candidates with a msc degree in electrical/computer engineering/science. potential topics (one should be selected):   *   "3d perception and learning for legged robot navigation: rough terrain locomotion (vision and path planning) using geometric and machine learning techniques"   *   "3d perception and (deep) learning for humanoid robot tool manipulation: detection, localization, and use"   after fukushima daiichi nuclear disaster in 2011 the need of robots to deal with unstructured environments and replace humans in hazardous tasks became one of the main open problems in robotics. rapid advancements in actuation and control over the last few years enabled articulated legged robots to walk in uneven terrain and manipulate several objects. still, the problems of 1) foot placement in rough terrain for navigation and 2) tool manipulation and reasoning in uncertain setups using 3d perception, remain two of the main challenges in robotics and are the key aspects for completing several tasks in unknown environments.   the aim of this topic is to develop new geometric or machine learning (e.g. deep learning) methods for environment reconstruction and cognition that enable limbed robots, such as walk-man (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.walk-2dman.eu_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=8opuhtpckt9bv1teneejj9ztzx7u2xsk2elxw0xb_-i&s=lcxiy3tqdmqmzbud0ct37uidynxk0-ft7xapqp_sipe&e=), centauro (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.centauro-2dproject.eu&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=8opuhtpckt9bv1teneejj9ztzx7u2xsk2elxw0xb_-i&s=iiytos0j9r3c13q-3norytsz6smuiagdo-m5jwmzxh4&e=) , or cogimon (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__cogimon.eu&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=8opuhtpckt9bv1teneejj9ztzx7u2xsk2elxw0xb_-i&s=8rn2h7pf_tg7lv7sdxsrzw9th1scig7a0jsfede3ohw&e=) to perform legged locomotion and manipulation in unstructured environments using 3d perception for foot-placement and hand/arm/wholebody-placement for path planning and mapping (slam). several exteroceptive (stereo/event/rgb cameras, rgb-d sensors, 2d/3d lidar scanners) sensors will be used on our limbed robots, to acquire rgb images and dense 3d point clouds. geometric simplifications for reasoning the contact between the robot's body (e.g., foot, hands, arms) and the environment will need to take place. moreover, path planning methods need to be developed to extract primitives for locomotion and manipulation. the development and testing will take place on our full-size humanoid/quadrupedal robots in real-world environments. requirements:   *   the person in interest should have acquired a master degree (obtained within the past six months from the application) in a relevant field.   *   this topic lies in the intersection of vision, learning, and robotics. a background in any of robotics, computer/robotic vision, path planning, robot learning is desirable.   *   ideal applicants should have strong c++ (python and matlab are a plus) programming skills.   *   machine learning and computer vision skills are required.   *   knowledge of the robot operating system (ros) and the point cloud library (pcl) is a very big plus.   *   the applicants should be fluent in english and team players. references: -- legged robot navigation    1. kanoulas et. al., "vision-based foothold contact reasoning using curved surface patches", humanoids 2017.    2. kanoulas et. al., "footstep planning in rough terrain for bipedal robots using curved contact patches", icra 2018. -- humanoid robot tool manipulation    1. kanoulas et. al. "center-of-mass-based grasp pose adaptation using 3d range and force/torque sensing", ijhr 2018.    2. nguyen et. al., "object-based affordances detection with convolutional neural networks and dense conditional random fields", iros 2017. application: the applicants should submit their cv  (deadline july 9, 2018) electronically outlining experience and qualifications, a short statement (max 1 page) about the research areas of interest as well as the names of two referees to dimitrios.kanoulas at iit<mailto:dimitrios.kanoulas at iit> (cc-ed nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it<mailto:nikos.tsagarakis at iit.it>), quoting [hhcm-internship - cb75158 ] in the email subject (total email size should not exceed 1mb). best regards --   --   dimitrios kanoulas, ph.d.   postdoctoral researcher   humanoids and human-centred mechatronics lab (hhcm)   dept. of advanced robotics (advr)   istituto italiano di tecnologia (iit-genova)   via morego 30,genova 16163, italy   e-mail: dimitrios.kanoulas at iit.it   url: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__dkanou.github.io_&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=8opuhtpckt9bv1teneejj9ztzx7u2xsk2elxw0xb_-i&s=wqcm5qzvpnyxjmfpccmv32ftotxoi62zum2sqc18ggk&e=

subject: research fellowship at istc-cnr on  development of software architectures for autonomy
content: subject: research fellowship at istc-cnr on development of software architectures for autonomy applications are invited for a 12-month research fellowship (assegno di ricerca) for conducting research in the scope of the ?impact - intrinsically motivated planning architecture for curiosity-driven robots? and ?mars-express data planning tool mexar2 maintenance? projects funded by the european space agency (esa) at the institute of cognitive sciences and technologies, cnr, (istc-cnr), rome, italy. the successful applicant will work on the topic "development of software architectures for autonomy" through the design and implementation of prototype software architectures for the control of robotic systems and complex subsystems operating in space. the applicant is expected to have a master's degree in computer science or electronic engineering (or equivalent). a phd degree or equivalent in computer science or a related field is not mandatory, but would be a plus. the ideal candidate is expected to have a background in artificial intelligence, in particular, state-of-the-art ai planning systems and algorithms, and reinforcement learning algorithms. the candidate should also have experience in the design, implementation and integration of complex software systems, as well as some familiarity with systems for automated planning and robotic simulation. the research activity should start as soon as possible and will last 12 months. more info and the application form can be found here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__bandi.urp.cnr.it_doc-2dassegni_documentazione_8055-5fdoc-5fit.pdf&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=rul9fzw3p2nof-6awpln_xwwt_vx6jq81xan8thgzro&s=qkyrtjxwoskjx1xyh_lxmcgefoss0mgozfz_vkr2xxo&e= subject: open junior university researcher  position (rtd) in robotics at free university of bolzano
content: 1 full-time post of junior university researcher (rtd) at free university of bolzano the free university of bolzano, faculty science and technology invites national and international applicants to apply for 1 full-time post of junior university researcher (rtd) in the field of safety-enhancement in physical human-robot interaction. the position is announced in the disciplinary-scientific sector ing-inf/04 (systems and control engineering) and the competition sector 09/g1 (systems and control engineering. the duration of the contract is 3 years. more details about the position can be found at: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.unibz.it_en_home_position-2dcalls_positions-2dfor-2dacademic-2dstaff_3643-2dsystems-2dand-2dcontrol-2dengineering-2dprof-2dpeer-3fgroup-3d16&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ccq-lmhxdk9yaqqz-d8olzw1a1qj6qsgcldmydn_ois&s=wwueixqaebuhzyjkuuyfyr14iyrg39xwddvmfe5fchu&e= and in the following document (please scroll down to position number 4 in the disciplinary sector ing-inf/04): https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__webservices.scientificnet.org_rest_uisdata_api_v1_tenders_attachments_35897&d=dwifaw&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ccq-lmhxdk9yaqqz-d8olzw1a1qj6qsgcldmydn_ois&s=sulprmvwfv-1qjlqoasnpncvoqfrfqgi_rcugdjzsma&e= ++++++++++++ deadline for applications: 02.08.2018 ++++++++++++ --- angelika peer professorin auf planstelle professoressa di ruolo tenured professor freie universit?t bozen libera universit? di bolzano free university of bozen - bolzano campus bruneck campus di brunico bruneck - brunico campus universit?tsplatz 1 piazzetta dell?universit?, 1 39031 bruneck - brunico italy t: +39 0471 017 766 f: +39 0471 017 009 angelika.peer at unibz.it<mailto:angelika.peer at unibz.it> www.unibz.it im sinne der datenschutzgrundverordnung (dsgv n. 679/2016) informieren wir sie, dass die in dieser e-mail enthaltenen informationen vertraulich und ausschlie?lich f?r den adressaten bestimmt sind. sollten sie diese nachricht irrt?mlich erhalten haben, bitten wir sie, diese zu vernichten ohne sie zu kopieren oder an dritte weiterzuleiten. auch bitten wir sie, uns dar?ber unverz?glich in kenntnis zu setzen. danke. ai sensi del regolamento ue 679/2016 si precisa che le informazioni contenute in questo messaggio sono riservate ed a uso esclusivo del destinatario. qualora il messaggio in parola le fosse pervenuto per errore, la invitiamo ad eliminarlo senza copiarlo e a non inoltrarlo a terzi, dandocene gentilmente comunicazione. grazie. according to the regulation eu 2016/679, you are hereby informed that this message contains confidential information that is intended only for the use of the addressee. if you are not the addressee, and have received this message by mistake, please delete it and immediately notify us. in any case you may not copy or disseminate this message to anyone. thank you.

subject: postdoctoral position in robotics for  precision farming
content: a funded post-doc position is available at the networked multiagent systems research group led by prof. andrea gasparri at the department of engineering at rome tre university in rome, italy to carry out research in the areas of control, robotics, and optimization. the post-doc position is funded by the h2020 project ?pantheon - precision farming of hazelnut orchards? (https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.project-2dpantheon.eu&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=ee4m1rglbvftxzbuqlpqzsn917okuinvl2ixfcxsd0a&s=u2c1vnbbha3tfhbfbdceu6kkydg7m6ofligheb0wgge&e=) coordinated by prof. gasparri, which started on november 1st, 2017. research experience is expected in one of the following areas:  simultaneous localization and mapping, robot motion planning, multi-robot coordination and task allocation, cloud robotics, and field robotics with experimental validations. the knowledge of the robot operating systems (ros) will be considered as a plus. candidates should hold a phd in relevant fields. in addition, candidates should have a track record of high impact international publications and demonstrate enthusiasm for performing both theoretical and experimental research activities. furthermore, candidates should have strong programming skills in c++, c, and (possibly) python. responsibilities include: theoretical and experimental research activities, tutorship and mentoring of graduate and phd students. the position is full-time. the position is open to candidates of any nationality; in particular, no knowledge of the italian language is required. the gross salary is ~27.500,00 ?, which will result in ~1650 ? net per month.  travel funding will be available. the reply to this call should consist of an email, sent to gasparri at dia.uniroma3.it, containing:  (1) a curriculum vitae, including a list of publications;  (2) the names and contact details of at least two references. expressions of interest should be sent no later than the 31st of july 2018. *** abstract -- h2020 project ?pantheon - precision farming of hazelnut orchards?   the project pantheon introduces a supervisory control and data acquisition (scada) system for the precision farming of orchards. pantheon objective is to design an integrated system where a limited number of unmanned aerial and ground robots move within the orchard to collect data and perform typical farming operations. the data is stored in a central operative unit where the information is integrated in order to perform automatic feedback actions (e.g. to regulate the irrigation system) and to support the decisions of the agronomists. the proposed scada will acquire information at the resolution of the single plant. this will allow to dramatically increase the detection of limiting factors for each individual plant, such as lack of water or pests and diseases affecting the plant health, and to react accordingly. this focused intervention will result in a better average state of health of the orchard. this architecture has the potential to increase the production of the orchard  while being more cost-effective and environmentally-friendly. the proposed scada will be experimentally validated in a real-world (1:1 scale) hazelnut orchard located in the tuscia area (province of viterbo, italy). we are looking forward to receiving your expression of interest. best regards, andrea gasparri

subject: postdoc position available to work with  the icub team at iit
content: dear roboticists, interested in working at iit in genoa, italy on the icub humanoid robot project. we're looking for a talented postdoctoral fellow to work on software infrastructure development. please find out the complete job description here: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.iit.it_careers_openings_opening_666-2dpostdoctoral-2dposition-2din-2dsoftware-2ddevelopment-2dfor-2drobotics&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=jyczmpy6tboctdpefkml84bg-uurpek_-l1rwc0rrdg&s=gxh6xahuuzlgumczewhh7nhxuv1tvs01wlk_oalooby&e= and clearly do not hesitate to ask questions if anything is unclear. best regards,  giorgio giorgio metta <giorgio.metta at iit.it> istituto italiano di tecnologia via morego, 30                             16163 genoa, italy                          ph: +39 010 7178-1411 fax: +39 010 7178-1205 url: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__pasa.cognitivehumanoids.eu&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=jyczmpy6tboctdpefkml84bg-uurpek_-l1rwc0rrdg&s=mpr-1osxgzzm0rpmdlqx3zlegl70y7sfutkwn80x8m8&e=

subject: phd studentship on "adaptive multimodal  human-robot and machine interaction" (deadline july 31st, 2018)
content: the phd program in information technology and electrical engineering at the university of naples federico ii (italy) has an open call for 1 phd studentship reserved for non-italian citizens who are not resident in italy <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.unina.it_documents_11958_14656033_call-2bfor-2bapplications-2bof-2bnon-2ditalian-2bcitizens-2bwho-2bare-2bnot-2bresident-2bin-2bitaly.pdf&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=edzd-5-jzbpobjh4itg0rky8geqlkh9o8kko30ackss&s=yze9mkgyit_sowrfkz1ivlig0dj-i_rr8nqpefkjllc&e=> on the following topic: adaptive multimodal human-robot and machine interaction compared to a common graphic user interface (gui), a robotic platform can deploy also speech, gestures and other non-verbal signals that can be used to enhance the naturalness of the interaction. this targets a more natural way of dialoguing preferred to those based on a single communication channel as already seen in most of the applications on tablets and mobile phones. in this context, the goal is to study and design adaptive multimodal interaction mechanism where the focus will not only be on relying on different modalities and on how to apply on them fusion techniques in order to generate the correct interpretation of the user intention, but also to select the proper feature set and to optimize them with reference to both each modal channel and to each user. in this view, the majority of the robotic applications are based on static user models, this makes such prevents systems to adapt independently and proactively to changes in the needs and preferences of users. the aim of the present proposal is to investigate how to merge human-robot and human-machine multimodal interaction research issues with online adaptive learning ones.  the selected candidate will join the prisca laboratory (projects of intelligent robotics and advanced cognitive systems) in naples. the prisca lab is a dynamic, international, and multidisciplinary team that offers exciting scientific projects, as well as an excellent and stimulating research environment. ============================================================ how to apply closing date: july 31st, 2018 detailed instructions and further details on the phd call are available at: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.unina.it_didattica_post-2dlaurea_dottorati-2ddi-2dricerca_english-2dversion&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=edzd-5-jzbpobjh4itg0rky8geqlkh9o8kko30ackss&s=jxorxxcnlpqoq4jhtlk2djxpchvhpiqwrqwojymib_i&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.unina.it_didattica_post-2dlaurea_dottorati-2ddi-2dricerca_english-2dversion&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=edzd-5-jzbpobjh4itg0rky8geqlkh9o8kko30ackss&s=jxorxxcnlpqoq4jhtlk2djxpchvhpiqwrqwojymib_i&e=> the selection will be based on cv and a skype interview. if you have any questions related to the position, please don't hesitate to contact dr. silvia rossi by e-mail (silvia.rossi at unina.it <mailto:silvia.rossi at unina.it>).  ============================================================ about naples naples (italian: napoli) is the third largest city in italy, and is the capital of the campania region. world-known for its rich history, art, culture, architecture, music, and gastronomy, naples is a lively, exciting and bustling city situated on the southwest coast in a gorgeous gulf, and is surrounded by attractive tourist and archaeological sites such as capri, ischia, amalfi coast, pompei, ercolano, mount vesuvius. see https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__en.wikipedia.org_wiki_naples&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=edzd-5-jzbpobjh4itg0rky8geqlkh9o8kko30ackss&s=qysj_wsctdlr79zrekv71l1b01aowwjfd01ylmzei24&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__en.wikipedia.org_wiki_naples&d=dwifag&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=edzd-5-jzbpobjh4itg0rky8geqlkh9o8kko30ackss&s=qysj_wsctdlr79zrekv71l1b01aowwjfd01ylmzei24&e=> for further information.

subject: assistant professor (with tenure track  link) at sapienza university of rome - deadline aug 30, 2018
content: position of assistant professor (with tenure track) of robotics and control at sapienza the department of computer, control, and management engineering (diag) at sapienza university of rome  seeks to fill the position of assistant professor of robotics and control, starting from january 1, 2019.  the position lasts 3 years and is linked to a tenured position (italian code: rtd-b), according to the following procedure:  by the end of 2021, the successful applicant must have received a positive evaluation (habilitation) from the national scientific committee (asn). if this is the case, the position is then automatically converted into a tenured associate professorship. work environment the diag department counts over 60 researchers in the areas of computer and systems science, operations research, and management engineering. it was nominated in 2018 as one of 180 departments of excellence in italy, receiving 8.6m? of extra funding in the next five years by the ministry of research and education. according to the 2018 arwu (academic ranking of world universities, https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.shanghairanking.com&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=74aiw_ugmgtyx8dtllcaowdo-m9lz_cfzlpoa1imepm&s=1v0bhephqhnu8ejqoxgbyaxzgle1vr_zhh-bqms64la&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.shanghairanking.com_&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=74aiw_ugmgtyx8dtllcaowdo-m9lz_cfzlpoa1imepm&s=ch19wvlfntv4-qfgqdcg5ki6bl5lfriiinmwdh1qsfa&e=>),  diag is the top italian department in the category ?automation & control? and holds the 16th position worldwide. the robotics lab at diag (see our youtube channel: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.youtube.com_user_roboticslabsapienza&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=74aiw_ugmgtyx8dtllcaowdo-m9lz_cfzlpoa1imepm&s=e0bblnqbcok7oqp6507yazqlflzhbc5nleq5owuz82a&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__www.youtube.com_user_roboticslabsapienza&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=74aiw_ugmgtyx8dtllcaowdo-m9lz_cfzlpoa1imepm&s=e0bblnqbcok7oqp6507yazqlflzhbc5nleq5owuz82a&e=>) counts 4 faculty members, various post-docs, and an average of 3 new phd students/year.  over the years, research has covered robot motion planning, kinematic/dynamic control of flexible, redundant, or underactuated robotic systems,  visual servoing, humanoid locomotion and navigation, control of locomotion platforms, and physical human-robot interaction. the activities have been supported by the fp6, fp7, and h2020 european research projects phriends, cyberwalk, saphari, comanoid, and symplexity, for a total of about 2.4m? of funding. diag is the home of the first editor-in-chief of the ieee transactions on robotics. the lab is equipped with three robotic manipulators (with the lightweight kuka lwr-iv and ur10 arms), several naos and kheperas, 2 quadrotors, 2 geomatic haptic interfaces, a cyberith locomotion interface, plus kinects, stereocameras, f/t sensors etc. diag hosts also two other labs involved with ai and cognitive robotics (rococo and alcor), with further personnel and equipments. the department offers bachelor, master, and phd degrees in the above areas, with a total of 500+ undergraduate and about 350 graduate students/year. particularly of interest to the position are the master in control engineering (40 students/year, https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.diag.uniroma1.it_-7eautomatica_-3fp-3dhome-26l-3den&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=74aiw_ugmgtyx8dtllcaowdo-m9lz_cfzlpoa1imepm&s=9wwvqngxzuoeeohfvzqxz9cxzokz2_zewieruopwtwe&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.diag.uniroma1.it_automatica&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=74aiw_ugmgtyx8dtllcaowdo-m9lz_cfzlpoa1imepm&s=jjnbaknvdcea61vxuo8amouz15hfync9zpa4xwjbwme&e=>)  and the master in artificial intelligence and robotics (60 students/year, https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__corsidilaurea.uniroma1.it_en_corso_2018_29938&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=74aiw_ugmgtyx8dtllcaowdo-m9lz_cfzlpoa1imepm&s=4txxsmo1kdfsj8gj0qt7wuqb4lpr5niqtc7to5h0dby&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__corsidilaurea.uniroma1.it_en_corso_2018_29938&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=74aiw_ugmgtyx8dtllcaowdo-m9lz_cfzlpoa1imepm&s=4txxsmo1kdfsj8gj0qt7wuqb4lpr5niqtc7to5h0dby&e=>), where courses in robotics and control are offered. both two-year programs are taught in english, with 50% of international students. tasks the successful applicant should work in the broad area of planning and control methods for robotic systems, doing both research and teaching at the bachelor and/or master level (between 72 h and 120h of lectures (8 to 12 credits in total) per year). in addition, co-supervision of bachelor, master and phd theses is possible.  eligibility requirements 1.	doctoral degree in robotics, automatic control, or a related field; 2.	a minimum of three years of post-doctoral experience; 3.	pertinent scientific achievements beyond the dissertation/phd thesis; 4.	research experience in the area of planning and control of robotic systems; 5.	relevant publications in leading international journals and conference proceedings. we highly appreciate also: - autonomy in conducting laboratory experiments;  - experience in the acquisition and/or scientific management of research projects; - excellent written and oral communication skills in english;  - team and communication skills. how to apply the legally-binding text of the call is in italian and can be found at https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__web.uniroma1.it_trasparenza_dettaglio-5fbando-5falbo_123817&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=74aiw_ugmgtyx8dtllcaowdo-m9lz_cfzlpoa1imepm&s=bxy_hc5etn79pnalg4pavggo-kgmjhzf9efxngt5_-u&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__web.uniroma1.it_trasparenza_dettaglio-5fbando-5falbo_123817&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=74aiw_ugmgtyx8dtllcaowdo-m9lz_cfzlpoa1imepm&s=bxy_hc5etn79pnalg4pavggo-kgmjhzf9efxngt5_-u&e=> this call is for a total number of 68 similar positions (rtd-b) for the whole sapienza university of rome. the position of interest is at p. 64, scientific sector (ssd) ing-inf/04 automatica. the strict deadline for applications is august 30, 2018.   the application form must be submitted in italian (a template is at the end of the call), using a special certified email procedure  or registered mailing. however, most of the accompanying documents (a cv with description of the academic and professional career, the complete list of scientific publications, projects and other scientific work performed, patents, teaching experience, organisational and editorial duties, etc.)  can be submitted in english.  in view of this, we encourage perspective qualified international candidates to contact us in advance (and in due time!) with the above documentation at the two email addresses roboticslab at diag.uniroma1.it <mailto:roboticslab at diag.uniroma1.it> and deluca at diag.uniroma1.it <mailto:deluca at diag.uniroma1.it> we will provide further information and, in case, some help with the application procedure. note that sapienza university of rome strives to increase the proportion of its female employees, especially in leadership positions, and therefore explicitly invites women to apply.  ==== ------ alessandro de luca dipartimento di ingegneria informatica, automatica e gestionale antonio ruberti -- diag sapienza universit? di roma via ariosto 25 00185 roma, italy tel: +39 06 77274052 fax: +39 06 77274033 email:?deluca at diag.uniroma1.it <mailto:deluca at diag.uniroma1.it> url: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.diag.uniroma1.it_-7edeluca&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=74aiw_ugmgtyx8dtllcaowdo-m9lz_cfzlpoa1imepm&s=som8bp1ncyoyps0jo05c5sgysaunkpdecnxgohz72aw&e=

subject: junior scientist position in deep  learning at cmre in italy
content: the nato sto centre for maritime research and experimentation (cmre) is accepting applications for a junior scientist position dedicated to performing research on deep learning topics, specifically cnns and gans. location: la spezia, italy. duration: 2 years (with potential for extension). base salary: 4,135? per month (tax-free). start date: flexible. application deadline: 9 september 2018. job number: 180626 full description and details are available at: *https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__nato.taleo.net_careersection_2_jobdetail.ftl-3fjob-3d180626-26lang-3den&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0wtrw87nfuf3pfumcgxmkmjwh2aklkhgyc0p5kdspeg&s=piuewtwaw0virpeehapvk_gvhwegzzut8oudzsqcglg&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=https-3a__nato.taleo.net_careersection_2_jobdetail.ftl-3fjob-3d180626-26lang-3den&d=dwmfaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wn9vatcbqz7jsbfyfye2vksbktv1v1tysbhsgdm3fn0&s=cga885iyko5cul6rph5voesbmhnjuwn8okjgn6bh6j8&e=>* information about cmre: https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.cmre.nato.int&d=dwifaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=0wtrw87nfuf3pfumcgxmkmjwh2aklkhgyc0p5kdspeg&s=o-gi7l73-ikju885du3z5aqvd-nyi6qmh6icqnjreeu&e= <https://urldefense.proofpoint.com/v2/url?u=http-3a__www.cmre.nato.int_&d=dwmfaq&c=clk7kqutwtaveovigvi0nu5bouhhpn0h8p7csfnc_gi&r=0w3solp5fswiywf2rl6rss8mcefamfepafdtohgtfyi&m=wn9vatcbqz7jsbfyfye2vksbktv1v1tysbhsgdm3fn0&s=hehg951k-hrxcaluqiize-b7jbfrttcrs6exvuhmwba&e=> if interested, contact david.williams at cmre.nato.int (reference "180626" in subject).
